177501.name: Out of the Abyss
177501.description:
From the back cover:

MADNESS IS THE ONLY ESCAPE

The Underdark is a subterranean wonderland, a vast and twisted labyrinth where fear reigns. It is the home of horrific monsters that have never seen the light of day.

It is here that the dark elf Gromph Baenre, Archmage of Menzoberranzan, casts a foul spell meant to ignite a magical energy that suffuses the Underdark and tears open portals to the demonic Abyss. What steps through surprises even him, and from that moment on, the insanity that pervades the Underdark escalates and threatens to shake the Forgotten Realms to its foundations. Stop the madness before it consumes you!

A Dungeons & Dragons adventure for characters of levels 1–15

177502.name: Monopoly: Marvel Avengers
177502.description:
Save the marvel universe from super villains!

Make a move!
Liberate Avengers Tower from Ultron's grasp!

Assemble the Avengers!
Call for backup to defeat the worst villains!

Use your power!
The super hero with the most power wins!

177503.name: Wonderful Tower
177503.description:
Чудесные башни ("Wonderful Towers") is a card game in which players will turn their towers from upside down to normal position.

In the beginnign of the game each player is dealt 7 cards that form his upside-down tower. Each round the player must perform one of the following actions: take a card from the deck and replace a card in his tower with it; or you play the property of one of previously discarded cards. The winner will be the first one to build his wonderful tower.

177504.name: Hearts and Armour
177504.description:
For a long time there is a war, and opponents have decided to resolve it not through a big battle but a struggle between their best knights. But chivalry is able to integrate even the most irreconcilable enemies. Many soldiers from both sides united with different relations: friendship, lifesaving, vows of chivalry, and even love.
 
In Сердца и Доспехи ("Hearts and Armour") players are divided into two teams. The task of each team - to defeat the opposing team, and killing or wounding more fighters from the opposite side. However, each player draws a relation card of one of the opponents. He can not win if the opponent is killed.

177505.name: Tatou (Issue 7 - Mar 1991)
rpgissuearticle: Il est beau mon Démon Pandemonium
Melniboné de R'lin K'reen A'a à Elric III
177505.description:
From the cover


Hawkmoon
RuneQuest
Stormbringer
Cyberpunk

177506.name: Three Cheers for Master: Feats Expansion
177506.description:
Three Cheers for Master: Feats Expansion adds 8 Feat Cards, 4 Minion cards, and 6 Tokens to the base game.

Feat cards are drawn to an 'unclaimed' area, and, as the game progresses, may be claimed by players who accomplish a drawn feat. Upon claiming a feat, players must immediately choose between the rewards on the card - a token, an immediate effect, or points.

177507.name: Waterloo 2015
177507.description:
Waterloo 2015 is an abstract game about the battle of Waterloo in june 1815.
There are NO DICE and NO combat CARDS in this game.
You will only find Event cards, in order to ensure replayability.
You have to carefully plan your moves and assaults, like in the Chess...

This game uses hexagonal zones, and some zones are crucial : Hougoumont, Mont St.Jean, La Haye Sainte, etc...
In order to win, you have to control a certain number of crucial zones.

One player controls the Allied army (Anglo-Prussian), and the other controls the French army. Each army includes 3 types of units : infantry (normal and elite), cavalry (normal and elite), and artillery. You charge and pursue with the cavalry, you bombard and defend with the artillery, BUT you control the terrain with the infantry...
Each zone contains up to 8 units.

Turn sequence :
Allied Approach.
French Approach.
French Engagement.
Allied Engagement.
Reorganisation.
Victory conditions.

177508.description:
The Final Crusade!

Having returned from the Abyss with Iomedae’s blessing, you’re ready to permanently close the Worldwound. Hosts of demons serving Deskari, the Lord of the Locust Host, await your challenge within the City of Locusts. The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: City of Locusts Adventure Deck is a 110-card expansion to the Wrath of the Righteous Base Set that adds new locations, monsters, villains, and more to the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game.

This deck also includes new loot cards and 6 new scenarios that make up the complete City of Locusts adventure, including an epic final boss battle. Complete your character’s mythic ascension with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: City of Locusts Adventure Deck.
177508.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous Adventure Deck 6 – City of Locusts
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

177509.name: Aaru's Awakening
177509.description:
Aaru's Awakening is a hand-drawn, fast-paced 2D action platformer. The game puts players in charge of Aaru, a mythical creature with two unique abilities teleportation and charging. He uses these abilities as he travels through the dangerous world of Lumenox to defeat an evil entity. These two abilities are at the heart of every level design throughout the game, to make for a challenging and fluid experience. The levels require players to make split second decisions whilst completing fast-paced puzzles.

Source: [https://store.playstation.com/#!/en-us/games/aaru's-awakening/cid=UP2144-CUSA01162_00-AARUSAWAKENINGA4 Aaru's Awakening on PlayStation Store].

177510.name: Die Urlaubsinsel
177510.description: This simple roll-and-move game was published as a insert in the magazine "Fernsehwoche" in the 1970s. The players begin at "Start" and try to be the first to reach the Grand Hotel on Vacation Island. On some spaces evets occur, that hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on a space that is already occupied by onother player, the other player has to back up 7 spaces.

177511.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 64/65 - Apr/May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Alternate Psionics Rules for Traveller20
Doing It My Way: Hazard: Storm!
In A Store Near You: Smart Fabrics
Kurishdam: Slice of Life: The Mutant Question - Psionics
Raconteurs’ Rest: A Compact Model, Part 2
The Prep Room: Modifying Miniatures for Traveller
The Shipyard:  Arrow Assault Fighter and Karve and Dragonship Assault Carriers
The Shipyard:  Beyond Book 2: Expanding the Basic Classic Traveller Starship Design System
177511.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #064/065: Apr/May 2015

Cover: .Pixabay.com user “WikiImages”

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

177512.name: What's in the Box
177512.description:
Made with GameMaker, What's in the Box sees you controlling an infinitely expanding robotic arm tasked with carrying a box across the game's levels. These include barriers that will block either your hand or your box.. Other hazards include roaming enemies, spikes, portals and conveyor belts. Only by beating the game with a low number of failures will you discover what lies inside the titular box. Otherwise, its content gets corrupted.

What's in the Box is designed to look like a BBC Micro game.

177513.description:
The original Champions of Aerim have long since faded from memory. Technology has begun its slow and steady rise within civilization, while many still cling desperately to the magic of old. Astaria itself has grown into a vast, sprawling empire, yet rebellion is carried on whispers from deep within the shadows. The strength of steam could spark a revolution. But for the Eternals, the cycle continues as it always has. For them, there is only... strife.

Strife: Shadows and Steam is a stand-alone sequel to Strife: Legacy of the Eternals. Using the same core mechanics, Strife: SaS introduces new characters, abilities and a unique twist or two that will be sure to add a fresh take on this exciting game. This sequel is also fully compatible with the original game, so you can face off with champions of Aerim from different ages!

Strife, a two-player strategy card game that plays in around an hour, is a game where you always know your opponent's options. Aside from mastering the unique combo-creating gameplay of your champions, figuring out how to outmaneuver your opponent is where the true challenge lies.

Each player has the same hand of ten champions and will simultaneously play them as they fight over key locations throughout Aerim worth varying victory points. Each champion has a battle ability that's triggered during battles and a legacy ability that can be used only while on top of the legacy pile. This creates an intricate latticework of strategy for the players as each champion must be considered for not only what he can do in the current battle, but for which ability he will add to the next.

Further impacting the critical decisions within the game is the Fatestone tie-breaking system. The Fatestone starts at a value of one, and whoever holds the Fatestone die loses all ties; that player may instead pass the stone to his opponent to claim a victory in that tie, but doing so raises the value of the Fatestone by one each time it is passed. At the end of the game, the player holding the Fatestone adds its final value to his victory point tally. Whichever player has the most victory points at the end of the game wins!
177513.name: Strife: Shadows and Steam
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 128: America & Atmosphere

177515.name: SEAL Team Flix
177515.description:
SEAL Team Flix is a fully co-operative or solo tactical dexterity game that pits 1-4 players against the
forces of terrorism. Taking inspiration from several military-themed first-person shooter video games, SEAL Team Flix incorporates flicking, dice rolling, and miniatures into an exciting, unique combination that will have the whole table standing up.

The game has two modes: Campaign and Skirmish. In campaign mode, players embark on an 8 mission non-linear adventure. Individual SEALs will get promoted several times over the course of the campaign... if they live. In skirmish mode, simply play one of the 17 missions as a standalone set-piece.

In addition, the game’s difficulty scales both with the number of SEALs playing as well as with three optional difficulty levels.

SEAL Team Flix is an objective-based game, with primary and secondary objectives which need to be resolved to successfully complete each mission. For example, in some missions, you must locate and acquire intelligence against the terrorist organization Gaia’s Hope. In others, you must disarm time bombs or rescue hostages. While you are given intelligence at the beginning of each mission as to the number and nature of the objectives that need to be completed, every game will be different because you will never know where on the map they are until you physically locate them with your SEALs.

177516.name: Olympus (Issue 3 - Nov/Dec 1982)
rpgissuearticle: A Different Kind of Role Playing
177516.description:
Olympus Nov-Dec 1982 (Vol 1 No 3)

Editorial (Roy Kallerud)
A Different Kind of Role Playing (Dennis Drew)
Out of the Dark (Royce Kallerud)
Mercury - Gaming News
Out of Thin Air (Ken St. Andre)
The Elven Tower - Adventure, Maps (Stephen Breeser)
Menacing Monsters & Curious Creatures
Addendum (stapled insert sheet)
Ballot

177517.name: Olympus (Issue 4 - Jan/Feb 1983)
rpg: ICE RPG (Index Card Easy Role-Playing Game)
177517.description:
Editorial (Stephen Breeser)
Different Faces (Royce Kallerud)
Mercury - Industry News
Fiend Folio: Friend or Foe? (Andrew Oleksiuk)
Double or Nothing (Michael A. Stackpole)
In Review... Arms Law, S4 The Lost Caverns of Tsojcanth, Wyrms Claw, DragonLords (R.B. Chipman)
Damage Vs. Hit Points (Scott Roy)
Traps - A Touch of Spice (Stephen Breeser)
Arcane Items

177518.name: Hero Company
177518.description:
A new game by Masao Suganuma, of Machi Koro's fame, based on the eponymous manga by Kazuhiko Shimamoto, which is basically a parody of the "Super Sentai" series, better known in America for its "Power Rangers" version.

In this game, players are would-be heroes working for the Hero Company, which such fancy names as "Choco-Red", "Soft-Yellow" or "Macaron-Navy". Each turn, which represent a week of game time, they try to resolve three different cases of increasing difficulty (ending with a final battle of supposedly epic proportions), in order to get the best grades from the company. Each hero can only try to resolve one of those, though heroes can queue to resolve the same case. Some cases only rewards the player who actually resolved it (ie, beat the threshold to resolve it with the die/dice), and others rewards every player who participate.

To spice up things, each hero has a hand of skill cards to either boost his capacities or mess up his partners' plan.

While it is important to cooperate to overcome the different cases, in the end, there can be only one winner, so this isn't a cooperative game.

177519.name: Hey Bartender!: The Cocktail Themed Party Game
177519.description:
Hey Bartender! is a cocktail-themed party game for 2-4 players. Players move around the game board collecting ingredients, and develop their world-famous cocktails, with the goal of gathering and matching various ingredients to shake their cocktails. Get ready now for the challenge from your family, friends, and lovers.

How to Play Instruction

1) PREPARATION: Place the game board in the center of the playing area Each player receive 1 chip board, and choose one character to represent him/her while traveling around the board .

2) BARTENDER: Select as Bartender a player who will also maintain the supplies and inventory for the bar. A Bartender who plays in the game must keep his/her chip board separate from the bar board.

3) BARBOARD: The bar boards holds all ingredient chips, cocktail cards, shakers, and cocktail chips. The board supplies ingredient chips to players and exchange cock-tail chips to player upon completing every single cocktail. If the Bar runs of out ingredients, the Bartender is allowed to issue ingredients needed by writing on any ordinary paper.

4) THE PLAY: Starting with the Bartender, each player in turn throws the dice. The player with the highest total starts the play: Place your character on the corner marked “OPEN/START”, throw the dice and move your characters in the direction of the arrow the number of spaces indicated by the dice. After you have completed your play, the character turn passes to the left. Two or more characters may rest on the same space at the same time. According to the space your character reaches, you are entitled to obtain the ingredient designated in the space or follow instruction stated in the space such as Chance, Give, Take, or obliged to rest a turn, jump to any space, or to exchange cocktail card, etc.

5) WHO WIN? The first player to complete all their cocktail cards in hand. If time limit of a game play is set, player with the highest combined total scores of ingredient in hand (please refer to score table) will be the winner. Any completed cocktail chip is awarded 10 bonus points.

Play Option 1: The first player to complete all their cocktail cards in hand wins.
Play Option 2: If time limit of a game play is set (average of 25 minutes), player with the highest combined total scores of ingredient in hand wins.

Players must dodge and utilize Bartender's instructions as it may force you to give or take ingredient chips from other players to make this game unpredictable.

177520.name: Borealis
177520.description:
At the very beginning of time itself, there were only the gods in the great emptiness. The gods were bored. To spice up their gloomy existence, they indulged in their own version of a board game and created worlds in which creatures of their own making would compete. However, their young powers were not developed enough to maintain control easily. Magical totems were therefore placed on the playing field like strings on a puppet and gods would fight over their control.

Borealis is a conquest game whose playing board is created by the players and can be transformed throughout the game. Players will control units with various abilities and try to capture the totems of other players. Winter will periodically disturb their strategies by affecting the units' movements and the arrival of reinforcements.

The thematic elements of the game were inspired by the fauna and flora of the immense boreal forest of eastern Canada. Players indeed represent gods who, one can only imagine, met a long time ago for friendly games in a world that would become today's Quebec.

Borealis can accommodate 2 to 5 players.

The goal is to achieve control over 7 totems totems simultaneously or 6 for 2 consecutive rounds.

177521.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 12 - Spring 2015)
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
rpgissuearticle: Gandalf was a Level Six Technician and a Dralasite
New Engine Requirements for Knight Hawks Ship Construction
The Frogg That Kissed the Prince
177521.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Hello Explorers!

Issue 12 of the Frontier Explorer is now available. This issue is all about psionics. We have a variety of articles on mentalist powers, equipment, creatures, and a new alien race by Laura Mumma, an author making her debut contribution to the magazine. I think you'll really enjoy the race she's invented.

In addition to the mentalism articles there are a variety of optional rules articles covering spaceship construction and critical successes and failures. Additionally we have an adventure set on Clarion, a short review of another old sci-fi RPG, our usual comics, and an analysis of what Gandalf the Gray would look like in the Star Frontiers setting.

The article list for this issue is:

* Zebulon’s Guide to the Rim
* An Intelligent Alien Invasion
* Thought Police
* Battle for the Mind
* Thought Police Archetype
* Dr Mento’s Psychic Equipment
* Psirens: Na’dezh’da
* An SP on Hakosoar
* Titan Rising: 2299
* New Engine Requirements for Knight Hawks Ship Construction
* Condition Critical
* Critical Hits in Star Frontiers
* The Frogg That Kissed the Prince
* Gandalf was a Level Six Technician and a Dralasite
* Universe RPG
* Grymz Guide Comic

We hope you enjoy this issue and as always, keep exploring!

177522.name: Travel all over Thailand
177522.description:
Getting to know Thailands provinces, its sights, traditions, as well as local specialities.

Game-play: Fun and strategy game in rounds from 2 to 9 players.

Goal of the game is to to be the first to have no cards left in hand, or if not possible to have the lowest amount of scoring points on hand.

177523.name: Cruise Ship of the Damned
177523.description:
From Publisher's Intro

Come Aboard. We’re expecting you.

Romance! Action! Blood Curdling Horror! That’s what’s in store for the group of passengers on the brand new SS Tangerine Cruise ship.

Welcome to Spirit of 77 Sucka!

Spirit of 77 is a role playing game about action and adventure in an alternate 1970’s where rock gods from outer space came to Earth to share with us the powers of Glam, Richard Nixon made a deal with aliens to stay in the White House, the streets are run by multinational crime syndicates and brave souls step forward to fight the oppressive minions of The Man.

How To Use This Booklet

This booklet is broken up into several parts
• Part 1 - How to Play outlines the basic rules for Spirit of 77
• Part 2 - Cruise Ship of the Damned is a basic adventure for Spirit of 77
• Part 3 - Premade Characters contains seven pre-generated characters for running the adventure with. Each character sheet includes a move reference on the back.
• Reference Sheets, and a map of the SS Tangerine that you can fill out as you play.

This is a demo package and does not contain the full rules of the game. A full book will be available in the near future.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Party Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2016 UK Games Expo Best Children's Game Winner
177524.description:
The lunch break is almost there and all of the young penguins would finally get the fish they’ve been craving. However, some rascals think they are quick enough to snatch some of the fish before the lunch break starts, but they have forgotten one thing – the Hall Monitor! Each school day one of the penguins is designated to watch over the school, and this is his moment to shine – for each rascal penguin he catches he would get additional fish!

A fun run takes place – the rascals are running everywhere and trying to snatch some fish on their way, but the Hall Monitor is trying to catch each and one of them to have some order in the school. Who will be more successful?

Ice Cool is a flicking game in which each round one of the players takes the role of the Hall Monitor (also called "the Catcher") – his aim will be to catch each other penguin and get points for that. The others (also known as "Runners") will try to run through several doors, thus gaining fish (that give them points) on their way. When either the Hall Monitor has caught each other penguin once or any of the others has gone through all 3 doors that have fish on them, the round is over. Each player will take the role of the Hall Monitor once and at the end of the game the winner will be the one with the most points on their fish cards.

The penguins can be flicked in a straight line, make curves and even jump over the walls! Each player will have to use the best of their skills in order to get the most points in this fun and exciting game. It's not just cool, it's ICE COOL!
177524.name: Ice Cool
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
#26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing

177525.name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – R.O.D. "Ravage Or Detonate"
177525.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card is a Heroic Paratrooper, like the Heroic unit types introduced in the Kickstarter Packs. He can, like the Paratrooper be deployed at any time and furthermore, if he is killed he deals 3 damage to the first enemy in your lane.

He does 6 damage and has 3 life.

177526.name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – 6-Player Add-On
177526.description:
An expansion that make it possible to play with 5 or 6 players.
The Kickstarter edition included 2 fold out cardboard boards similar to the 4 included as a bonus for the Kickstarter campaign.

It also includes 68 cards:
20x 1 XenoSathem
20x 3 Xenosathem
20x 6 Xenosathem
8x Militia

177527.name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – Kickstarter Exclusive Card Packs
177527.description:
Two Kickstarter Exclusive card-packs containing 43 foil cards and 50 non-foil cards.

Foil cards:

177529.description:
User summary

An expansion for Dorasure that contains two new characters: a Minstrel and a Caster, hence the name of the expansion.

It also contains a few new quest hexes, "magical quests" for which the Caster gains a bonus.
177529.name: Dorasure Mincas

177530.description:
User summay:

An expansion to Dorasure that contains a character (Grand Master) that is specifically designed for solo play.
177530.name: Dorasure Grand Master

177531.description:
User summary

An expansion to Dorasure that contains two new characters (Samurai and Shaman, hence the name) and some extra rules for them.

First released for Game Market Osaka 2015 (march 2015).
177531.name: Dorasure SS

177532.description:
User summary

An expansion to Dorasure containing two new characters (Vampire and Werewolf) and new rules to them.

First released for Game Market Tokyo spring 2015 (may 2015).
177532.name: Dorasure Fang

177533.name: Katteni Shiyagare
177533.description:
User summary

The game consists of 10 thick wooden tiles with the front and back of each tile having one of five patterns (suits). Each tile has different patterns on the front and back, and no two tiles are alike. Thus, each pattern appears four times. So, for example, each of the four tiles showing the rose pattern has a different one of the remaining four patterns on the reverse side.

The tiles are randomly placed on the table on their sides on so that each player sees exactly one of the two patterned faces of each tile (the players sit across from each other). The first player rotates one tile 90 degrees so that it is standing up. Next, the other player topples it either towards or away from herself (she chooses) so that one of the two patterned sides is now face up. She then puts the tile into a pile on the side of the table so that the revealed patterned side remains face up. After completing these steps, the players reverse roles.

The goal of the game is to build a complete 2-D tile pyramid, with four tiles in the bottom layer, three tiles in the second layer, two tiles in the third layer and one tile on top. When building on the second or higher layers, a tile can only be placed if it matches the face up pattern of one of the tiles it is being placed on. The pyramid can be built in any order (e.g., work on the second layer can begin before the bottom layer is completed).

Players may not communicate verbally or otherwise.

177534.name: Reidemeister
177534.description:
Forming arts with strings, Flashing your inspiration!

This game is a puzzle game with some strings. You use strings to form the pictures depicted by the cards. You need to be careful to match the lower and upper part of the strings where they cross each other.

It is the point of the game that there are three types of strings in this game. Red is one set consists of 2 circular strings, blue is a long string, and yellow is ne set consists of 2 circular strings crossing each other. You have to form the picture with a correct string(for example, the picture have only one string, you have to use a blue string). So, you need to be able to separate them from each other.

There are three rules, Normal Rule, Race Rule, and Kid's Rule. Race rule is for players who want a handicap. Kid's Rule is for playing with children.

MOVIE:https://youtu.be/Mf-GVJItLcc

177535.name: Kikki's Magical Delivery Service
177535.description:
User summary

A board game based on a bunch of anime that are not to be named (too obviously).

The players are flying delivery services and should pick up and deliver as many goods as possible on the board. On his turn, a player will roll dice and play any number of action cards that will benefit him, then move his pawn on the board, picking up and delivering objects.

177536.name: Lapitta, the island in the sky
177536.description:
User summary

A board game based on an anime that is not to be named too obviously.

The players run back and forth on a crumbling bridge, between the flying ship and the island in the sky. Each turn, the player rolls dice and decides which to use for movement and which to use for destroying the bridge. The removed bridge tiles can become items and whatever the players find on the island will decide what points they will get for what items. The players can also bump into each other and steal items.

177537.description:
User summary

A simple yet engaging card game featuring all possible tanks from WW2. The players start with a lineup of hidden tanks and can place them in the front line or the back line. Cards can be flipped to be revealed, and revealed tanks can attack other player's tanks.

While each attack is extremely simple (roll a D6 below target number), the variations and special effects of cards allows for a tactical game.
Tanks are all real tanks and listed by name and categories, but the setting of the game is in an imaginary future where people fight out battles with various tank miniatures, hence the team of tanks can be any combination of any nationality, and the theme is light-hearted.

MOVIE : https://youtu.be/SC8S-VFiUqg
177537.name: Tank Hunter 2e

177538.name: The Sands of Time
177538.description:
The sands of time sweep across the ages, burying the cities and monuments of civilizations, leaving only whispers of the glory of ancient societies.

The Sands of Time is a civilization-building game set loosely in classical antiquity, on a board inspired by a Roman-era map. Each player rules over a civilization in the ancient world, attempting exploits that will be remembered long after the civilization has withered. Each turn, players will select two action cards, which represent edicts delivered by the player to his populace, announcing what aspects of the empire he/she wishes to address: building structures, implementing advances, migrating population, initiating combat, annexing new territories, instituting reforms to manage the empire’s unrest, building trade routes, demanding tribute, and -- crucially –- recording Chronicles about his/her reign.

The central element of the game's scoring system, Chronicle cards represent claims of great accomplishments. To score a chronicle, the player must have a "heritage" level commensurate with the claim he/she is making: claims of great works will only be believed and perpetuated if the player's civilization has established a reputation in the relevant civilization category (cultural, civil, or political).

Actions generally require the payment of resources (crops or gold), and action costs correlate either to the player's empire size or the player's Unrest level. Unrest increases when a player's territories become too crowded, or when a player re-uses an action card, or when a player voluntarily presses on his populace to squeeze additional productivity out of them. Managing Unrest is a central concern for the player throughout the game.

Players must strike the right balance between competition and peaceful interaction with their neighbors, to propel their civilizations from insignificant, forgettable kingdoms into empires worthy of the attention of historians!

177539.description:
User summary

A standalone expansion to Tank Hunter 2e.

Tank Hunter is set in a fictional future where players pit their army of model tanks against each other. Each player has a small unit of various tanks from WW2, and deploy them against each other trying to defeat the other player's tanks, infantries and guns.

Jäger contains more tanks, more infantry and more guns, and can both be played as a standalone game or integrated with the base set.
177539.name: Tank Hunter 2e Jäger

177540.name: Sheep & Thief: Golden Sheep
177540.description:
User summary

A mini-expansion for Sheep and Thief. Contains 4 golden sheep.

177541.description:
Terrible Monster is a battle card game for two players. Each player starts with four lives, two counter tokens, and a hand of five cards from the deck of 16 cards, with players taking turns to draw a card and play up to two cards against each other, possibly countering or re-countering them.

The first player to defeat the other player wins.
177541.name: Terrible Monster

177542.description:
Shuffle Heroes is card game for two players set in a fantasy steampunk world filled with Lovecraftian monstrosities.

Each game, you draft two heroes and shuffle their cards together, forming your draw deck. This provides a lot of possibilities for different deck combinations while keeping the deck construction fast and easy.

The game-play is pretty straight-forward. During your turn, you either play a card, activate your hero or replenish your hand. However, when played right, you can chain effects together with devastating outcomes.

Your ultimate goal is to defeat enemy heroes either by reducing their health to zero or wearing them down by destroying cards from their deck.

One of the main mechanics in Shuffle Heroes is the so-called deck deconstruction. During the game, you can decide which cards you destroy from your opponent's deck. This decision heavily influences what your opponent can draw in the next turns.
177542.name: Shuffle Heroes

177543.name: Cave Fliers
177543.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lurking in the caves of Everglow, the leather wings are predators in a world of prey ponies. Sharp fanged and keen witted, they will find their way even through the darkest of times to come out on top.

New feats, spells, alchemic discoveries, and lore all designed for leather wing ponies!

177545.name: Battlechangers: Ironworks
177545.description:
From publisher blurb:

Battlechangers: Ironworks builds on my non-D20 based standalone roleplaying game, Battlechangers (2012) and allows players to construct gigantic, transforming robots fully compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Where the original edition of Battlechangers (and the upcoming Generation Two revision) was a comprehensive homage to Transformers with a unique game engine, Ironworks deals with transforming alien mecha integrated into any Pathfinder-based campaign setting.

This massive sourcebook includes a very comprehensive character creation system that will allow you to build everything from child-sized cassette spies to ground shaking, ultra-armored behemoths and everything in between.

But building your Battlechanger isn’t all you’ll be able to do. Battlechangers: Ironworks includes dozens of racial traits and nearly 75 race specific feats, covering everything from the ability to assume Ground Walk Mode or unleash a Mini-Missile Flurry. Your robot might even become the recipient of the legendary Circuit Chalice, the badge of office carried by Freegear leaders, or be chosen as a herald of a star god.

Beyond the traits and feats, new spells like Fuelon Armada and Function Reformatting give Battlechanger mages some unique new occult weapons to deploy.

Finally, you’ll meet some intriguing new threats, including Dino-Berserkers, Tyrakron Hunter-Killers and Freegear Rebels, and learn how you can use this sourcebook to build non-sentient transforming mecha in addition to alien robots!

As a free bonus, the original edition of Battlechangers: The Quick Play, Transforming Robot RPG is included in the download, so you can compare and contrast…or mix and match… as desired.

177547.name: Origin of Man
177547.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Arman and the Nasians share a number of common traits. Both are taller than the human norm and share characteristically blonde hair. However, they live on opposite sides of the world of NeoExodus. One man thinks he holds the key to proving that both share common ancestry. All he requires is a group of adventurers to escort him.

Exodus boasts a turbulent history—from the rise of the Kaga to the defeat of the First Ones and the events of the Twilight War. From creation of the Imperial Alliance to the present crisis that threatens to tear that alliance apart. Great heroes and terrible villains drove its march, though even in hindsight the two are not always easily separated. Theirs were the titanic passions, the burning obsessions, and base treacheries in which modern Exodus was forged and tempered.

The world of Exodus needs heroes...

Inside this adventure you will find you'll need to embark on adventures in the exciting setting of NeoExodus: A House Divided. The Origin of Man adventure will serve as an adventure and showcase of the NeoExodus: A House Divided campaign setting and its unique differences from all the other gaming campaigns on the market. An adventure for 7th level characters for the Pathfinder Role Playing Game. The Origin of Man adventure was written by the former Pathfinder Society Denver Venture Captain and NeoExodus Creative Designer, J.P. Chapleau.

177548.name: Silvered Skull
177548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nestled high in the Grit Mountains, the village of Oldenhaffen is known far and wide for the quality of its wool. The town elders have sent for urgent help from their absent lord, who unable to respond, needs trustworthy adventurers to investigate. Ever since a local shepherd brought back a silvered cavian skull, things have become... distressing. Townsfolk who touched the skull are now dazed and babbling incoherently, and the villagers are worried this is a sign of an incipient curse about to grow worse. A psionic NeoExodus adventure for 3rd-level characters.

177549.name: Summon & Dragon
177549.description:
User summary

A card battle where the players compete for laid out treasures. Players take turns putting out one of their summoned characters face down on any treasure they want. When all have placed, the cards are turned face up and activated, and the player that has the highest total on each treasure gets that treasure.

Each card also have special effects, and character cards are also turned face up each time someone places a new character card on the same treasure. This allows for strange combos and traps.

177550.name: Pedestrian Bridge
177550.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 251st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a modern pedestrian bridge.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

177551.name: Lily & Rose
177551.description:
User summary

A card game in which the players try to pit together couples of the same sex in order to get points.

Nine characters (girls or boys, but not both) are lined up, each getting a certain personality from a deck of personality cards. Each player gets one date spot card. On a player's turn, they can either exchange their date spot with one of the open ones, or put another personality on a character, or show their hand card (date spot) and pick two characters who will date on that spot. If the requirements on the date spot card match the personalities of the characters, the player will earn points. A perfect match means a couple is formed, and the characters are removed from the game.

The game ends when there is just 1 (poor) character left, or if the personalities deck runs out of cards.

177552.name: Meditations of the Lotus
177552.description:
From publisher blurb:

“When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.” - Laozi

Those that train in the art of meditation gain the advantage of developing fantastical abilities others may not dream possible. Adding a little Eastern philosophy, Meditations of the Lotus expands upon the existing meditation feats for your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

This book contains a total of 18 Meditation Feats: 3 feats from the original source and 15 all new ones useable by any class.

Circulatory Control: Fend off bleed damage for a few rounds
Contemplative Maneuver: Take advantage of openings with counter maneuvers.
External Power: Ki Powers aren't just for monks anymore.
Heroic Thoughts: Ki points become Hero Points
Innate Yang & Innate Yin: Are scaling feats that reward you with scaling defense and offense.
Sound of Waves: Offers sonic and force resistance.
Last Efforts: When you thought they were down, the hero (or villain) always comes back just in time.

177553.name: Neco Londele
177553.description:
User summary

A board game where the players' goal is to invite as many cats as possible into their house. Fire cats are walking around the board, and the players roll dice and use cards to get the cats to come to their house.

The player who gets most cats into his house wins.

177554.name: War of Wonders Miniature Game
177554.description:
War of Wonders is a skirmish miniature game set in an alternate, grim World War II fought by superhuman beings.

Details:
War of Wonders Miniature Game is a fast paced 30mm strategic skirmish game based on the deeply immersive setting of Project H.O.P.E. RPG by authors Simone Fini and Riccardo Giuliani, published by Limana Press.
In War of Wonders extraordinary human beings with powers beyond imagination fight on WW II battlefields alongside regular troops and iconic heavy tanks to change History. National heroes, monsters born in laboratories and mysterious beings with their own secret goals: every and each of them will add new tactics, game options and strategies to your games.

Setting:
Nazi Germany declares war on Europe, and its army is unstoppable. Prodigious beings appear on the battlefields to support the Wehrmacht's efforts: flying men shower flames upon the enemy; women wearing iron masks punch through tank armour; bloodthirsty beasts devour entire regiments. The world is about to succumb to the might of the Third Reich. Aaron Spiegelmann, a Jewish scientist who escaped from the Mauthausen concentration camp, is the only hope for the Allied Forces to stop the Nazis. Spiegelmann is the genius who created the Wunderkammer, a new technology that allowed the Germans to create real superheroes with extraordinary powers. With his guidance, the US Army launches Project H.O.P.E. in order to produce their own genetically modified humans to be deployed on the battlefields. As the war rages on and every army creates its own Meta-Humans and war machines, Natural Prodigies, unscrupulous Adventurers and even secretive groups of Warlocks step into battle. From the European battlefields to the Pacific Islands, a conflict like never before is unleashed and spreads with no boundaries: humanity will forever remember it as the first War of Wonders.

177555.name: The Necromancer (Issue 1 - May 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Review - The Treasure Vaults of Lindoran
177555.description:
Editorial (Beckett Rosset)
Game Mixing (Mason Jones)
What is Role-Playing? (Ted Shelton)
The Treasure Chest
Names (Beckett Rosset)
Computer Gaming Review - Wizardry (Johnathan Stahl)
Review - The Treasure Vaults of Lindoran (Geoffry O. Dale)

177556.name: The Necromancer (Issue 2 - July 1982)
177556.description:
Editorial
The Vagaries of Vampires (E.P. Flemyng)
Hit Location (John Stahl)
Filksong (Mike Dawson)
The Treasure Chest
Raving Reviews - The Jabberwock, Abyss, Necronomicon, The Elven Warrior
Computer Gaming Reviews - Computer Adventures

Some copies included an insert apologizing for light type and announcing an issue 3 delay.

177557.name: Gear Grinders
177557.description:
Gear Grinders is a board game where players control one of four unique characters maneuvering around an arena to attack the other players. Each character has their own attacks, stats (attack, defense, movement), life, gear slots, gear cost, and steam tank size. Steam is used to power different attacks or shift gears from first to second gear.

The arena has three different steam vents located throughout. A normal steam vent, a gear vent, and a hatch vent. These can be turned on or off with a die roll. When the vents are on, moving over them can increase the amount of steam in your tank but at the cost of some life. Gear cards could appear on the gear vent with a die roll. The hatch vents are used to move a player from the gear vent.

Gear cards are equipped by players to modify the player's stats. Playing cards are used to help launch attacks or defend. Combat is determined by a die roll adding any modifiers and comparing it to the defender's defense with their modifiers.

The game ends when there is only one person left alive.

Gear Grinders is the first game from Roll One Games Limited.

Game time is 30 minutes to 2 hours depending on the number of players and the aggressiveness of the game play.

177558.name: Envoyer (Issue 17 - Mar 1998)
177558.description:
User summary

Issue #17 contains a range of articles and reviews, comics, the scenario "Wolfsgeheul", riddles and gimmicks.

177559.name: Steamer Wars
177559.description:
“It is both the duty and the tradition of the Royal Navy to engage the enemy wherever there is water to float a ship”

A “fast play” game covering primarily the naval engagements on Lake Tanganyika during the First World War, and also any number of real and hypothetical small craft actions during the period 1910-1920. Written with 1/600 scale models in mind, their inspiration being the models designed by North Head Miniatures of New Zealand.

As well as the tactical rules, a set of mini campaign rules is included. Actions fought using the tactical rules tend to be short and sharp, and so the campaign is easily playable in a few evenings, or as a club project for a day.

177561.name: Lite
177561.description:
Publisher blurb

Lite Grundregelwerk

Das Lite Grundregelwerk enthält alles was man zum Spielen benötigt. Neben den eigentlichen Regeln sind auch neun Settings enthalten.

Ausstattung
DIN A5 Softcover
68 farbige Innenseiten

177562.name: Super Motherload
177562.description:
User Summary

A mining game 1-4 players taking place on mars in an alternate Cold War era. Select a character, purchase fuel and upgrades, then dig into the Earth for different materials to sell. Dig up the same kind of resources in a row to create combos for more money and combine certain kinds of material to save storage space and to sell for more money. Learn more about the story and get different endings as you progress deeper underground.

177563.name: Spirit of 77 Rap Sheets
177563.description:
User Summary

The core playbooks for Spirit of 77.

Playbooks include the following Basic Roles...
- The Bopper
- The Good Old Boy
- The Honeypot
- The Rocker
- The Tough Guy
- The Vigilante

And the following Basic Story playbooks...
- All-Star
- Ex-Con
- Former Badge
- Humble Beginnings
- Kung-Fu
- One Bad Mother
- War Vet
- X-Tech

In Spirit of 77 players get one Role and one Story playbook.

177564.name: Wide World of 77 Rap Sheets
177564.description:
User Summary

The additional playbooks included with the Spirit of 77 supplement, Wide World of 77.

Playbooks include the following Roles...
- The Gonzo Journalist
- The Bounty Hunter
- The Stuntman
- The Greasemonkey

And the following Story playbooks...
- The Specialist
- Holy Roller
- The Visitor
- Nature Boy

In Spirit of 77 players get one Role and one Story playbook.

177565.name: Strife: Veteran Edition
177565.description:
User Summary

An updated version of the original Strife that adds new graphic options, new content, and new features. Play as a mercenary attempting to overthrow a cult that has taken over the world with the help of a resistance movement in this FPS RPG made with the Doom engine. Talk to NPC to learn information, buy armor and weapons in shops, improve your skills, and complete quests for people to earn gold.

177566.description:
A good theme park tycoon knows that his or her best chances of becoming not only wealthy, but a legend in the industry is to build a park that is not only profitable, but one that keeps its Parkies happy! In Parkies, you'll strive to do exactly that. You'll compete with 2 to 6 players to build the best theme park possible, while attempting to attract the Parkies. Parkies are the absolute power in the game, so good Parkie management is as important as your ability to construct an interesting park.

In a nutshell, a series of attractions will become available on each turn. You and the other players will bid on those attractions. The winners take those attractions and add them to their park, increasing the park's allure, profitability, and/or satisfaction. Then you use those attractions to attempt to lure an interesting mix of Parkies to your park. The park with the happiest Parkies at the end of the game wins!
177566.name: Parkies
boardgamepodcastepisode: clp006 – cubelove podcast – Strategicon Recap Part 1

177567.description:
This expansion adds thirty-two unique kittens to the game in two new groups, allowing for play with up to six players (or teams). It also has color-reminder cards, and flavors.

Flavors add a new dimension to the strategic play of Kittens in a Blender. If you are having trouble rescuing your kittens, you really really can't keep them out of the blender, throw some vanilla extract or strawberries into the mix and make a smoothie! It's a new way to score points toward victory, and now other players have to think long and hard before sending too many of your kittens toward the evil blender.
177567.name: More Kittens in a Blender

177568.name: Olympus (Issue 5 - Jul/Aug 1983)
rpgissuearticle: Mercury - News in the Gaming World
177568.description:
Editorial (Andrew Oleksiuk)
Monster Population - An Important Part of Creating Your Campaign Milieu (Royce Kallerud)
Do I Make It? Jumping in AD&D (Andrew Oleksiuk)
Review - Dragon Rage Mini-Game
Narkonen - A New Insectoid Race (Scott Roy)
Those Ever Elusive Potions (Andrew Oleksiuk)
Sorry, No Guarantee - Some Thoughts on Breaking Weapons (Stephen Breeser)
Dreams Can Be Fatal (James Baker)
Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Smith - The Long Forgotten Secondary Skills (Robert Wallach)
Keeping RPGs a Challenge - The Essence of the Game (Scott Roy)
Mercury - News in the Gaming World
Spell Reactions, or, What Happens When a Fireball Hits a Cone of Cold? (Jeff Galinkin)
Ads
Contact Information

177569.description:
User summary

Players are all girls fighting a dragon with their swords. On a player's turn, he will roll a die to attack the dragon, and if successful, may add new cards to his sword, making it longer. The player may also play cards for special effects.

The dragon will attack the girls each round. The goal is to remain standing when the Final Round starts (round 7, if not triggered earlier), and defeat the dragon. The player with most points at the end wins.
177569.name: Long Long Long Sword Girl!
boardgameexpansion: Long Long Long Sword Girl!: Girls and Dragon!!

177570.name: Long Long Long Sword Girl!: Girls and Dragon!!
177570.description:
User summary

An expansion for Long Long Long Sword Girl. This adds a deck for the Dragon, and contains 2 extra rules, that can be adjusted for difficulty.

177571.name: Shinsei Maougun ~ VS the triple kingdom alliance
177571.description:
User summary

An expansion to Shinsei Maougun. It adds the Lacour Kingdom to the human side, increasing the difficulty, but also makes the Demon Army a bit stronger.

Contains 32 new Demon cards and 4 new Human cards

177572.name: 猿道 (Monkey Road)
177572.description:
User summary

A party-esque card game, where one plays the human, and the rest play the monkeys who have escaped from zoo. The cards depict various places where the monkeys may have gone. The monkey players will play these each turn, and at the end of each turn, flip them face up. The human player may to a certain extent look at the monkey players' hand cards, and try to block certain cards from being flipped face up, or simply catch the monkey who is in a specific place.

If the monkeys manage to get a certain amount of cards flipped face up, they win. If not, the human wins.

This game was created by everyone at One Draw, which is why there is no specified designer.

177573.name: Idol Conclave
177573.description:
User summary

An idol-themed card game. Players are all a member of an idol group, but while being in the same group, wants to be voted to top idol. Each player has a set of cards with votes and scandals on and will play these onto the other members of the group. Each player also has one member they openly support.

Of the set cards each player has, one is Backstage Deal, which alows the player to play cards on a specific sheet, where each played cards will have various effects.

The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins.

177574.name: Million Hit Chart
177574.description:
User summary

A cooperative game where the players are all members of an idol group, aiming to create a million hit.

At the beginning of the game, a number of Appeal cards are lined up by each member of the idol group. These cards can, during the game, be looked at by players and can also switch places to and fro.

These appeal cards must match the requirements on the popularity sheet and come in a specific order, in order to generate a specific amount of sales. The goal of the game is to get as high sales as possible

177575.name: Idol Conclave + Million Hit Chart
177575.description:
A bundle containing the two games Idol Conclave and Million Hit Chart



Idol Conclave


An idol-themed card game. Players are all a member of an idol group, but while being in the same group, wants to be voted to top idol. Each player has a set of cards with votes and scandals on and will play these onto the other members of the group. Each player also has one member they openly support.

Of the set cards each player has, one is Backstage Deal, which alows the player to play cards on a specific sheet, where each played cards will have various effects.

The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins.



Million Hit Chart


A cooperative game where the players are all members of an idol group, aiming to create a million hit.

At the beginning of the game, a number of Appeal cards are lined up by each member of the idol group. These cards can, during the game, be looked at by players and can also switch places to and fro.

These appeal cards must match the requirements on the popularity sheet and come in a specific order, in order to generate a specific amount of sales. The goal of the game is to get as high sales as possible



MOVIE : https://youtu.be/R3VZEPBlb4A

177576.name: Lifeline (2015)
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
177576.description:
User Summary

Lifeline is an interactive fiction game where the only survivor of a spaceship crash on an alien moon communicates with you (his sole point of contact) through a series of text messages.

177578.name: Nameless Horrors
177578.description:
From the back cover:

SIX REASONS TO FEAR THE UNKNOWN

The Cthulhu Mythos presents horrors far worse than mere death…

You won’t find any ghouls or deep ones, or other named Mythos entities here. The horrors found within have no names, but they are still very much of the Mythos. Your players will not have encountered their like before, and no one will be on safe, comfortable ground.

Nameless Horrors brings you six new scenarios that will frighten even the most experienced of Call of Cthulhu players, giving them reason to fear the unknown.


An Amaranthine Desire—The investigators find themselves in the doomed English seaport of Dunwich, encountering strange echoes of the night that sealed the fate of all who dwell there.
A Message of Art—The investigators are invited to attend the closing party of the Salon de la Rose + Croix, rubbing shoulders with the Parisian elite, while finding out that the cost of truly great art is sometimes death.
And Some Fell on Stony Ground—life in small-town America of the 1920s is not quite what it was for residents of Stowell. Local people are behaving strangely and events are escalating. Can the investigators get to the bottom of the mystery and survive before the entire town explodes in frenzy of blood and crime?
Bleak Prospect—residents of a shantytown in Depression-era Massachusetts find their community under assault from unknown forces. Who or what is preying on them? Will the investigators find out before those they hold dear are destroyed?
The Moonchild—David Barber was driven to make a terrible pact to save his son’s life, allowing a great evil to be unleashed upon a unsuspecting world. Drawn together by a mutual acquaintance, the investigators must work together or fall under the spell of the Moonchild.
The Space Between—What was planned as a fantastic new feature film is turning into the shoot from hell. The leading lady has vanished, the director has retreated from the world, and the police are sniffing around the set. It is up to the investigators to get the film back on track and share its vision with the world.

177579.name: Metrocide
177579.description:
User Summary

A top down stealth action game where you take on the role of a male or female contract killer. Three different city locations and weapons and tools to unlock to help you in your jobs. Avoid police, cameras, vigilantes, and witnesses by killing your targets silently and hiding the bodies.

177580.description:
This map was put together to commemorate the 1 year anniversary of Heavy Cardboard podcast, a podcast about heavy boardgames. The city and town names used on this map are boardgames featured or discussed in Heavy Cardboard podcasts.

This map is intended to be fairly open with plenty of space for route building and goods availability. The Heavy Cardboard hex in the center of the map acts as a cube fountain generating new goods every round making it an important location as there is no production action with this map.

A new special action, "Heavy Lifting", adds the ability to deliver over land between Cities. This adds some interesting decisions for players during the game.
177580.name: Heavy Cardboard (fan expansion to Age of Steam)

177581.name: Goblin Markets: The Glitter Trades
177581.description:
From the back of the book:

Come Buy! Come Buy!

The midnight market is back in town and everone seems to have something to sell. Lost toys? Magic potions? Albums that shouldn't exist, yet do? Look around, dear friend. I'm sure we'll find what you're looking for somewhere...

In a world where commerce is magical, what's the cost of desire? Explore Qwest-Mart, Wicked Jerry's, Shae bal Marah and other strange places. Maybe you'll find out - if you can meet the price!

We're Open For Business!

Goblin Markets - The Glitter Trade is a setting, character, story, and rule supplement for mystic commerce. Compatible with any fantasy adventure setting, this book features...


Legacies and Wyrds
Uncanny merchants
Mysterious markets
Love, lust, loss
Bargaining tactics
Selling your soul
Magical treasures
... And more!


Don't be shy! Come inside...

177582.name: ダイス 木 (Daisuki)
177582.description:
ダイス 木 (Daisuki) is a game in which the players take on the role of lumberjacks, chopping down trees in the mountain forest in order to collect wood and build houses. Along the way, they will run into fires and termites, but the lumberjack who can hold onto the most wood and build the best buildings will win!

The game starts with a mountain made of wood disks. Players take turns drawing a disk at random and revealing what they have "harvested" from the forest. As players start controling more wood, they can use those wood chips to buy better equipment, put out fires, build houses, etc. It's a chance and dice game of press-your-luck with a little bit of attack-your-opponents as well!

177583.name: Dyscourse
177583.description:
Dyscourse is an interactive choose-your-own adventure where you journey through a stylized world of choice and consequence. You play as Rita, an unfortunate art school grad turned barista, who is now stuck on a desert island with a crew of oddball travelers after a plane crash. That last choice you just made? It may end up being integral to your group’s survival, or it may lead you down a path to murder and cannibalism!

Source: The Game Website.

177584.name: Sandmännchen's Abendspaziergang
177584.description:
Simple roll-and-move game.

It's a bedtime game for children - players roll the die and move their pawns, following the directions when they land on certain spaces - e.g. move forward, skip a turn...

Notes:
Predecessor of Sandmann, lieber Sandmann. Different editions were published during mid 1960s

177585.name: Chainsaw Warrior: Lords of the Night
177585.description:
Chainsaw Warrior: Lords of the Night is a new chapter for Games Workshop's cult classic! Based on the original Chainsaw Warrior board game, this sequel adds new layers of intensity to the game's unique formula.

It's the year 2035 and the crazed followers of a near-forgotten God have opened a hole into a nightmare dimension. He saved New York in 2032 - can Chainsaw Warrior now save the world? Not only are there swarms of Aztec zmobies, mutants, traps, Moon Cult Agents and other twisted fiends between him and Darkness, time is the enemy too! Only 60 minutes remain to save the world!

Source: The Game Website.

Chainsaw Warrior: Lords of the Night features three new decks packed with exciting traps and enemies, new weapons and equipment and new gameplay to challenge players at every turn. The game is packed with challenges and difficult decisions plus new mechanics such as the hard-won blessings to help you reach Darkness - or die trying! Equip yourself with new firearms, new chainsaws and the trusty the laser-lance as you once more fight through the hordes to Darkness and on to victory. The game has three challenging difficulty settings, including classic for those who want the truly gruelling experience of the original board game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

177586.name: Commander Zodram and the Cyber­Centaur Legion (ICONS)
177586.description:
From publisher blurb:

Commander Zodram is a member of Krux Morta's Hate Chamber and leads the fearsome Cyber-Centaur Legion. They often serve as shock troops or hard-hitting raiding parties for missions where Morta's Eidolon legions would be ill-suited. The ferocity of the Cyber-Centaurs is legendary across the galaxy and their mere appearance on a battlefield is often enough to break their enemies' morale.

177587.name: Colossal
177587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Monsters: Colossal brings you a dozen and one terrifying titans to shake, rattle, and roll your heroes into submission. From CR 10 to the first CR 30 creatures to appear in the Mythic Monsters series, you'll find challenges fit to shake the foundations of heaven and grind the weak underfoot in your campaign. There are tiny terrors made massive, like the titan centipede and shipwrecker crab, alongside prehistoric gargantua like the colossal dire ape, immense tortoise, and giant brachiosaurus and tyrannosaurus. You will also find fantastic foes that fill the horizon, from planar predators like the astral leviathan and god-cursed zombie titan to an entire family of behemoths to ravage air, land, and sea, and the legendary tarrasque. As if these were not enough, we also bring you the biggest monster of all, the legendary linnorm Jormungandr, the Midgard Serpent! On top of 13 marvelous mythic monsters, we also present alternate rules for creature size and shape and a whole new combat climb system for your heroes to clamber and cling to their colossal opponents!

177588.name: The Elders
rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
177588.description:
From publisher blurb:

A free addon for playing an experienced elder in Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures.

Rules and Playbooks for playing elder characters who influence the development of their pupils.
Six new Character Playbooks, including the Retired Veteran, the Dungeon Delver, and the Dwarven Mentor.
A selection of NPCs and dangers representing elders and their adversaries.

177589.name: Regents of the Roads: Gnomish Archetypes
177589.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s Time to Go Roaming!

Gnomes are an unusual race, who don’t quite seem to belong anywhere. Some are great illusionists with a close connection to the fey, others are mad tinkerers and alchemists, prone to explosions and mishaps, and still others are slaves to an intense wanderlust and known for the vibrant colors of their skin and hair. Though they never quite fit in, gnomes can be found just about everywhere, and they have a knack for always doing things their own way.

Of course, when you choose to make your player character a gnomes, all that you really care about is the +2 bonus to your Constitution and Charisma scores (and who needs Strength, anyway?), so why bother playing a gnome alchemist or druid? Even if a +2 bonus doesn’t really make that much of a difference, it just feels so wrong to knowingly combine a race and class that don’t go well together, and, as a result, many players never bother to consider it.

This book aims to give players who want the fact that their character is a gnome to matter more a way to make that happen, while also providing support for gnome characters of a variety of classes that don’t typically make much mechanical sense for gnomes. Included are the gnomish alchemist, a mad scientist who can create extracts that produce powerful illusions, and can even craft their own clockwork familiars, the gnomish illusionist, a wizard archetype for gnomes devoted heavily to illusion, the gnomish sensationalist, an investigator archetype for gnomes who want to live life to the fullest by experiencing every sensation possible, the gnomish wanderer, a ranger archetype devoted to travelling to new and exotic lands, and the gnomish wildspeaker, a druid archetype for gnomes that want to get in touch with their fey heritage.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
177590.description:
Experience the dense Cold War suspense and scratch that Twilight Struggle itch in only 45 minutes.

13 Days: The Cuban Missile Crisis is a nail-biting, theme saturated two-player strategy game about the Cuban Missile Crisis. Your fate is determined by how well you deal with the inherent dilemmas of the game, and the conflict.

1) Will you push to gain prestige at the risk of escalating the crisis to global nuclear war?
2) How do you best manage your hand of cards to further your own plans while depriving your opponent of options?

Work out these dilemmas in order to emerge as victor of the Cuban Missile Crisis after thirteen suspenseful days.

13 Days: The Cuban Missile Crisis is a meaty filler utilizing the card-driven game mechanics. Rich with history, yet accessible to gamers with no prior knowledge of the crisis. It is targeted specifically at catering to two groups of gamers: the enthusiasts that just don't have the time they used to and the curious newcomers that are scared off by the heavy commitment and long play times of the classics in the genre.

Official FAQ/ERRATA
Designer Diary

177594.name: Strange Magic: Ethermagic, Composition, and Truemagic
177594.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bored of Vancian magic? Try something Strange instead!

In development in one way or another since June of 2013, Strange Magic offers up three brand new magical subsystems with freedom as their modus operandi. Build custom spells from the ground up with ethermagic, compose your own scores with musical composition, and weave ridiculous combos and reverse recitations with truename magic.

The component thirds of Strange Magic, Ultimate Ethermagic, Ultimate Composition, and Ultimate Truenaming, may be purchased separately. An upcoming loyalty program will allow those who purchased these pieces to get Strange Magic at a discount. Additionally, those who purchase PDFs of Strange Magic before the hardcover edition is ready will be able to purchase the hardcover at a discount.

Ethermagic

Ethermagic takes equal parts Douglas Adams and H. P. Lovecraft to produce an 'all day long' system of magic with a cosmic flavor. Spiritual successors to the warlock base class of the 3.5 days, the ethermagus, ethermancer, and etherslinger base classes seek to have improved playability by offering the ability to mix and match spell effects to make custom evocations on the fly. Whereas the warlock simply blasted, the ethermagician can ask, 'How hard?', and can even choose to be an interesting hybrid class rather than a pure-blooded caster.

Thanks to the advent of a rapidly-regenerating spell point pool, players must choose whether or not to spend more than they will regenerate next turn. Incredibly potent effects are indeed possible, but firing them off without a care in the world will reduce the player to single-target ranged touch attacks in a hurry!

Musical Composition

In the real world, great musicians are some of the most creative people that you will ever meet. When sitting down to play one in tabletop gaming, however, musical performance boils down to a short list of canned abilities that are autogranted at particular level thresholds. In short, gaming a musician is not the creative enterprise that actually being one is.

The musical composition system seeks to capture the raw creativity of music with the advent of a freeform composition system. Players combine intros, melodies, and outros to compose custom scores, which are then conducted in much the same way that a bard performs his performances. Each base class contained herein takes a different spin on the concept, combining it with spellcasting, arcane magic, divine magic, or more freeform musical composition, as the case may be.

Composition's transformative archetypes are not mere flavor packages, but instead modify the very root of the composition system itself, to the point that each base class can be made almost unrecognizable by piling on two or three of them.

Truename Magic

We call it the First Language, and anything spoken in this most primal of tongues is law. Be the speaker king or peasant, the universe is compelled to shift the very fabric of its being to conform to that which is said. Complex beyond comprehension, this ur-tongue contains syntax and vocabulary capable of describing all that can conceivably exist in this, or any other universe. Though perfect mastery of such a construct is impossible for even the gods—this is why deities have portfolios—even a mortal can learn enough of the First Language to effectively BE a god with an incredibly narrow focus. These obsessive scholars and phoneticians are collectively called the truenamers, and their efforts to capture the power wielded by the gods themselves upsets everyone from clerics to cultists.

Truename magic features the recitations system, in which spells are cast upon successfully making a truenaming check (same as a concentration check, but a different name so other content can't break it) against the level of the recitation. Each time a recitation is recited, its check DC increases by +2 until the following day. Inflections, effectively a metamagic system that allows for bonus effects in exchange for increasing the truenaming DC faster, makes even the 1st-level recitations useful forever. After all, if you could cast a quickened 1st-level recitation each round, why wouldn't you?

Product Features

Three ethermagic base classes: the full-caster ethermancer, the melee ethermagus, and the cosmic firearms etherslinger.
Four composition base classes: the maneuvers-based breakdancer, the divine cantor, the score-spamming harmonicist, and the arcane maestro
Two truename magic base classes: the classic truenamer and the universe-trolling scion of discordia
Ten ethermagic archetypes, four of which, the healing etherfuser, the insane mad evangelist, the etherbomber, and the stealthy void stalker, are complex enough to be new classes in their own right!
Five composition archetypes, all of which are compatible with multiple composition classes
Eight truename magic archetypes, two of which, the chessmaster and the discordant instigator, may as well be their own classes!
Five truename magic prestige classes
An NPC Codex! Over 30 pages of iconic NPCs for use in your games
Well over 150 pages of manifestations, compositions, opuses, recitations, dance moves, talents, and feats
Favored Class options for all common races, as well as most featured races

177595.name: Nuclear Toxyderm (ICONS)
177595.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manual of Mutants & Monsters: Nuclear Toxyderm for ICONS is on a Nuclear Rampage!

Have you ever wanted a giant, out of control, nuclear monster to toss at your heroes? Well, now you can!

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters for ICONS provides game stats on the Nuclear Toxyderm, an elemental spirit that is drawn to areas of nuclear activity and waste. Upon arriving from their dimension, these energies possess the nuclear materials and transform into a raging monster of nuclear toxins.

Includes game stats for the full-size and lesser variations, along with detailed rules on the risks of radiation exposure, and a radiation extra and radiation quality.

177600.name: Tanith
177600.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Borderland line of Third Imperium books focusses on a single subsector within the Trojan Reach, allowing referees to rely on adventures and sourcebooks that fully scope the region, meaning he can get on with the business of running his campaign!

The Tanith system is a key link on the Imperial-Aslan trade route. Its excellent starport has grown into a starfaring nation in its own right, whilst the rest of the planet is wilderness populated by barbarians and survivors of failed colony missions. These low-tech settlements are preyed upon by raiders and Aslan ihatei groups. Tanith has become a hotbed of mercenary activity as the Port of Tanith attempts to resist these incursions without triggering a full-scale invasion. Borderland Profile: Tanith provides a complete guide to this troubled world and its star system, along with a selection of the finest… and less fine… mercenaries available for hire in the Borderland.

177601.name: Overton
177601.description:
From publisher blurb:

Overton is a medium sized town sitting next to the river Tonbrook, surrounded by rolling hills and calm forests. It makes a convenient stopping point for coach travellers on the River Road and for barge traffic sailing up- and down-river, so it sees a decent amount of coming and going. Money changes hands, people live their lives, and apart from the occasional goblin sighting, it’s the safest and quietest town you could hope to find.

Except of course that’s not true. There are ancient tombs under those hills, and the reason the woods seem calm is because the monsters within have terrified the locals into immobility. Rumours whisper of cultists behind every door, lycanthropes working the barges, and the mayor is a hollow shell occupied by a sorcerous tapeworm. Overton’s placid exterior hides a boiling core of adventure waiting to break loose a band of player characters are just the folk to unleash the chaos and – if the people of Overton are lucky – hang around long enough to shove any genies they’ve released back into their respective bottles.

Overton is a steading suitable for a party of player characters to use as a base camp for exploring the surrounding area. Presented here are details of the town, several locations of interest to adventurers, and a handful of important NPCs. It’s written with an eye to use with Dungeon World but could be easily ported to other fantasy systems.

177602.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 219 - 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
The Deep Gnome Realms of Tellene
177602.description:
"Menace of the Ancient Dice"

Cover by The Fraim Brothers

177603.name: The Harpy
177603.description:
From Introduction:

Look at them. Sniveling weaklings, the lot of them. They take advantage of their money, their looks, their brains, their cliques, but do they really deserve any of that power? What did they do to earn it? When have they ever suffered for what they have?

The free ride ends now. What you can’t snatch away for yourself, you’ll make so foul that nobody would want it anyway. They all wither under your acid tongue. Your tactics may not win you any friends, but given the choice, you’ll always pick fear over love.

177604.name: The Muse
177604.description:
From Introduction:

Christian was amazing in his last game. You knew he would be. All it took for him to shine was your special training...and the coach finding out his video collection wasn’t so secret...and the original quarterback’s awful leg-breaking accident.

But now homecoming is coming up, and Christian has been blowing off your training sessions to spend time with Rhonda.

It’s okay. You have a solution for that. And Christian will thank you when the scholarships come rolling in. You just know it.

177605.name: The Minotaur
177605.description:
From Introduction:

It wasn’t like you set out to be a bully. It’s not your fault you’re bigger than the others, or that you stumble over your words, or that you’re just kinda naturally scary.

But it is what it is. You know your friends aren’t real friends, that they see you as a big dumb tool. But at least if you beat people up for them, they hang out with you. It’s better than being alone.

Sure, sometimes it hurts. Sometimes it hurts a lot. But you know how to fix that. Getting angry fixes everything.

177606.name: The Gargoyle
177606.description:
From Introduction:

You remember being a real human kid once, a long time ago. Before they built the school. Before they stretched you out on the foundation stone and cut out your heart.

But you’re not so angry anymore. Now you go to classes, attend pep rallies, run for student council. You’re on the spirit squad and you’ve lettered in track. They wanted you to bless this school, and you’ve done your job well.

And when vandals or thieves show up in your school at night...well, maybe you’re still kind of angry after all.

177607.name: The Creature
177607.description:
From Introduction:

All that time and energy on the petition - all the convincing, all the seducing, all the threatening - and what do the fuckers do when you present them with a thousand signatures? They tear the papers in half and laugh in your face.

Just a kid, they said. You can’t make a difference here, they said. Stay out of things that don’t concern you, they said.

Well, dumping waste into the river does concern you. And maybe a pissed-off river monster will concern them.

177608.description:
From the publisher's website:

"A great host came out of Angmar in 1409, and crossing the river entered Cardolan and surrounded Weathertop. The Dúnedain were defeated and Arveleg was slain. The Tower of Amon Sûl was burned and razed; but the palantír was saved and carried back in retreat to Fornost, Rhudaur was occupied by evil Men subject to Angmar, and the Dúnedain that remained there were slain or fled west."
–J.R.R. Tolkien, "Eriador, Arnor, and the Heirs of Isildur"

Accompanied by the young Dúnedain Ranger Amarthíul, a handful of Middle-earth's greatest heroes make their way out of the deadly troll-fells and into the crumbling ruins of Rhudaur. Their path leads them past piece after piece of evidence of the region's historic collapse; they cross through tattered cities and make their way around towers of stone and rubble, long forgotten and ravaged by years of disrepair.

At length, even as they can still sense the evils that have pursued them since the dungeons of Mount Gram, the heroes come across the remnants of a keep marked by the same symbol that appears on the pendant that Amarthíul inherited from the captured Ranger, Iárion. They are not safe here, and time is pressing. Still, the heroes realize this ruined keep might hold some clue to the threat currently growing in the North. Despite the dangers, they decide to brave its foreboding stairwells and darkened halls in search of whatever secrets it may yield…
177608.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Treachery of Rhudaur

177612.name: Applied Xenology
177612.description:
From the publisher

Not All Threats Are Born From Nightmares

Until now, GURPS Monster Hunters has focused on the paranormal: Champions, often empowered by magical and mystical abilities, face supernatural monsters from myth and legend. GURPS Monster Hunters 5: Applied Xenology is here to prove that horror meshes with science, too!

Applied Xenology offers choices for your Monster Hunters campaign. Are the heroes masters of tech, the supernatural, or both?
