If magic exists, does it rely on willpower and Hermetic knowledge, or on properly programmed computers? Do the monsters the hunters face hail from our world, the third level of Hell, another planet, or all of the above? Applied Xenology will help you find answers:


"Scientific" character revisions. Every supernatural-themed template from GURPS Monster Hunters 1: Champions and GURPS Monster Hunters 4: Sidekicks is discussed in depth and (where possible) revised to fit a focus on the scientific rather than the paranormal. What happens to the sage if magic doesn't exist? Does Mysticism have a place in a world without demons and undead? How do warriors stay relevant in the face of TL9+ weaponry? Find answers to these and many other questions.
Technomagic. This revamp adds a "sheen of science" to Ritual Path magic -- but it's more than just a reskin! Technomages need computer hardware and software to operate at full power, creating spells as programmed "scripts" they can run immediately, save, or even email to a friend. And it all works whether you're using Champions or the detailed system in GURPS Thaumatology: Ritual Path Magic.
Aliens. Terrifying extraterrestrial threats have always had a special place in modern horror, and now your hunters can protect the Earth from them. From classic conspiracy fodder such as Greys, Nordics, and Reptoids to straight-up monsters like Devourers and Insectoids, there's an alien race to fit any plot the GM cooks up (and suggested "close encounters" to provide inspiration).
And more! Face invisible danger in the form of insidious plagues. Convert supernatural monsters to a more "scientific" form. Play aliens as inhuman PCs. And load up on -- or invent -- new gear.


Applied Xenology provides more options -- for your champions, settings, and bad guys -- so that you can run the game you want. We've given you the tools . . . now go save the world!

177613.description:
The next supplement for the Battlegroup World War II gaming rules covering the invasion of Poland in 1939 and France in 1940.

Designed to be played in 20mm and 15mm, this latest book contains army lists, vehicle data and special rules for the first two years of the war, including France’s command chaos, the Luftwaffe's aerial superiority and the swift German Panzermarsch!

Nine new army lists for the early war fighting. The Polish and German armies for 1939 and German Panzer and Infantry Divisions to fight French Light Mechanized Divisions, Armoured Divisions and Infantry Divisions, the British Expeditionary Force and Belgian army in 1940.

Nine historical scenarios from Poland to Belgium and France. All in a lavish 184 page, hardback book. Heavily illustrated with inspiring miniature photographs, historical photographs and artwork.
177613.name: Battlegroup Blitzkrieg

177614.name: SAVAGE WAR OF PEACE: A Solitaire Game of the Algerian War (1954-1962).
177614.description:
SAVAGE WAR OF PEACE is a solitaire game of Combat during the French-Algerian War (1954-1962). The player assumes the role of a commander of combined French forces in Algeria. As commander, you are responsible for securing your Area of Operations (AOR) by successfully conducting various military operations in order to locate and destroy the enemy. Although there are many units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of SAVAGE WAR OF PEACE is to successfully complete a number of missions and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the French Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (4 Missions), an average game (6 Missions), a long game (8 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

177615.name: Fireforce: Rhodesia – A Solitaire Game of the Rhodesian War (1964-1979)
177615.description:
FIREFORCE: RHODESIA is a solitaire game of the Rhodesian War. The player assumes the role of a Commander of a combined Force of Rhodesian Security Forces, including the Rhodesian Light Infantry (RLI), Rhodesian SAS and the Elite, Selous Scouts. As commander, you are responsible for securing your Area of Operations (AOR) by successfully conducting various military operations in order to locate and destroy the enemy ZANLA and ZIRPA forces. Although there are many units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of FIREFORCE: RHODESIA is to successfully complete a number of missions and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the US Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (4 Missions), an average game (6 Missions), a long game (8 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

177616.name: TRADITION OF GLORY: A Game of Naval Adventure during the Age of Nelson.
177616.description:
INTRODUCTION
The year is 1795 and France is gathering their Forces for their Armies and Navy in a grand attempt to conquer Europe. It is also a time of revolutions, imperialism, piracy and political intrigue. In this game, you start out as a young Officer serving in the British Royal Navy. As you complete missions, you will gain experience, honor and hopefully promotions. In time, you may command a Ship of your own. This game is for fans of the Nautical Fiction Series of Horatio Hornblower, Richard Bolitho and Jack Aubrey.

OBJECTIVE
In TRADITION OF GLORY each player creates a Player Officer starting out in what will, hopefully be, a long and glorious career in the Royal Navy. During, play, Player Officers (POs) will be assigned to Ships and conducting a variety of Missions as they move along the Career Track Game Board. The Career Track consists of Ports, Sea Travel and Ship Duty Assignments. These Assignments will result in a variety of situations and encounters including Naval Battles, Port Assaults, Land Skirmishes, Shore Bombardment as well as a variety of other Missions in which the Player’s Officer must resolve. The outcome of these Encounters and Situations determine whether the Player’s Officer advances along the Career Track. While the Officers conduct Challenges, they might gain or lose Merit Points, which are used to improve their Attribute Ratings and Rank. The Player Officer with the Highest Rank after reaching the Ending Space on the Career Track, is the Winner. If this is tied, then the Officer with the most Merit Points remaining is the Winner. If this is tied then the Officers may conduct a Duel to determine the Winner.

177618.name: d∞ (Issue 7, Apr 2015)
177618.description:
From the Publisher's blurb:

In the real lives of most people, holidays and celebrations of various sorts often provide them with their greatest experiences, and positive and negative events alike tend to be significantly more memorable when viewed through the lenses of festivities. While most game masters and storytellers certainly understand how festivals, holidays, and celebrations can be used to accentuate the action of their scenarios, however, such events are used surprisingly rarely in this way. Several of the features in this volume of d-Infinity are designed to be of use to game designers and authors who want to use holidays and celebrations to a greater extent in their stories.

d-Infinity Volume #7 Contents

Editorial: “Holidays & Festivals”

Fiction: “Introduction to the World of Kos”

LARP/Prop Room: “Swords & Sorcery in the World of Kos”

Digital Dice: “Black Hat Magic”

100 Oddities: “Random Holiday Treats”

Basic System/Mutant Future: “Mutant Plant Monsters”

Basic System/Labyrinth Lord: “Six Festive Spells”

Pathfinder System: “Festivals & High Holy Days”

Pathfinder System/Insults & Injuries: “Alcohol & Other Intoxicants”

5th Edition: “Bard Background: Thespian”

Cards & Quests: “Monsters of Kos”

Chevauchee: “A Cold Day in Hel!”

d∞ (“d-Infinity”) is a multi-platform gaming supplement that covers a wide variety of rules systems and includes content that can be universally applied to many different sorts of table-top, live-action, and role-playing games. It includes both material that can be applied to all or many sorts of games and items that are self-standing and which can be played on their own.

Features of each thematic volume include new rules, stats, and bonus content tying in with several different game systems; paper miniatures; and interviews. Rules systems supported include Pathfinder, OGL v.3.5, Dungeons & Dragons, “Basic” system, Labyrinth Lord, Mutant Future, Cards & Quests, Call of Cthulhu, and Cthulhu Live. It is jointly published by Armorcast, Dagon Industries Inc., Dark Threads, Flying Buffalo Inc., Mindgame Productions, OffWorld Designs Inc., Skirmisher Publishing LLC, and the United States Marine Space Corps.

We believe that the most enjoyable gaming periodicals are not just devoted to single games or even the products of a single company, but also include content that makes a reader interested in other games, material that can be applied to all or many sorts of games, and items that are self-standing and which can be played on their own. For that reason, this publication includes many voices and exclusive material compatible with many rules systems and the products of many different companies.

177619.name: Terminator Genisys: The Miniatures Game – The War Against The Machine
177619.description:
NOTE: The "War against the Machines edition" has a full 128 page manual with future expansions planned and is intended for wargamers. The "Battle for the Future" edition is more intended for the general gaming public.

Terminator Genisys: The War Against the Machines features 31 stunning plastic miniatures designed to be ready for action in minutes. No glue is required, thanks to their push-fit design, and they come in two clear different plastic colour (metallic grey for the Terminators and army green for the Resistance) to make sure you recognise your forces easily amidst the fog of war.

As a bonus, The War Against the Machines includes a superbly sculpted metal Kyle Reese character to join the Resistance fighters, providing them with special command abilities and heroic traits, Kyle Reese is a perfect to lead the brave Resistance soldiers against the endoskeletons.

Terminator Genisys: The War Against the Machines includes a 128 pages rulebook that allows you to explore every game possibility; starting from the contents of the box but allowing you to expand with the upcoming range of heroes, commanders, troop types and vehicles expected during the year ahead. We will keep you well informed about all these new exciting releases.

While you can play on your regular gaming table, we have included a 2’x3′ double-sided gaming mat, cardboard measuring templates and a set of cardboard terrain to make it a game truly ready out of the box, so you’ll be up and running in no time at all.

Finally, the unique dice game system invites you to play without the need of modifiers or tables and the chaotic “Fate activation system” ensure you’re always involved in the action.

Contents:

Full-colour rulebook: 128 pages Exclusive metal Kyle Reese model (brings special abilities, command options and heroic feats) 10 Terminator Endoskeletons (Two different posses, advancing and… relentlessly advancing!) 5 Terminator Crawlers (You thought the ENDO was done?!) 16 Resistance Soldiers (with a selection of weapons from missile launchers to plasma rifles!) Quickstart rules: 16 pages 2 punchboards: Includes all the scenery, tokens and gaming aids needed to play! 1 full colour double-sided 2’x3′ gaming mat 1 full-colour double-sided rules reference sheet 13 colour-coded dice: 2 sets of D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, D20 1 custom made metal colour Fate die

177620.name: & (Issue 11 - Summer 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Creature Feature I: Ecology of the Ogre Mage
Creature Feature II: Undead Ogre Magi
Friend or Foe: The Ogre Berserker Company
Hex Crawls: Two Shores and Torjetty Regions
Mini-Adventure: Blues for the Red Sun
Reviving the Lowly Orc: Two Variants
Spell Caster's Paradise I: Codex Inhumanus – Kobold Shaman Spells
Spell Caster's Paradise II: Leah Cim Disk of Altered Alteration
Tactical Magic: Generating Magic Items and Spells for a Party
The Ranger Requires a Double Take
177620.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Featured in this issue: Humanoids!

This issue includes

Getting More Mileage from Goblinoids
Humanoid Society
Point of View?
Reviving the Lowly Orc

Plus some bonus articles

Ecology of the Ogre Mage
Undead Ogre Magi
Leomund’s Long Coats
Codex Inhumanus – Kobold Shaman Spells
Blues for the Red Sun

And the usual columns, plus some new ones!

177621.name: Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss
177621.description:
This simple roll-and-move-game was published as an insert in a "Toffifee" Box and promotes the second "Die drei ???" movie as well as "Toffifee".
The first player to reach the diamonds and answers corectly a question from the question card wins the game. On certain spaces events occur, that hinder or benefit the player. If a player gets on a space with a picture, he has to perform an action as described on the action card.

177622.name: Brave the Labyrinth (Issue 5 - Dec 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Ampulex the Emerald Jeweler and his Emerald Jewelry
Tools, Keys, and Magic Items for All Characters (who like to Break and Enter)
177622.description:
From the Publisher's Blurb:

Brave the Labyrinth is a quarterly fanzine published by Small Niche Games for the Labyrinth Lord™ roleplaying game community. It consists of fan-created material designed to cover all types of Labyrinth Lord™ and Advanced Edition Companion™ gaming.

In this Issue you get:

-a new demon lord
-new elf variations
-an amazing map of Andrel Castle
-sainted icons of the Church of Law and Order
-tools, keys, and magic items for thieves
-three (3) new monsters
-a green wizard who sought to cheat death
-a review of the Caves of Ortok
-artwork contributions by by JV West and Jim Wampler

177623.name: Schmückt den Baum
177623.description: This game was published on a "Toffifee" Box. The players roll a die. At the result of an even number, the player takes a random christmas Ornament, places it on the christmas tree and gets points awarded, as noted on the ornament. The gameeEnds when all ornaments are placed on the tree. The player with the most points wins the game.

177624.description:
Reclaim Neverland is a strategy game that takes place in Peter Pan's Neverland that is under siege by four pirate captains.

Reclaim Neverland is unlike other deckbuilding games because of the combination of PvP elements and a limitation to the size of each players built deck. Similar to its predecessor, Reclaim Oz, It is a unique tabletop experience that has the play differently than any other games in the same genre. We have added items to the game as well, these will work as multipliers and bonuses for specific characters!

The game takes place in Neverland, home to famous characters such as Peter Pan, Tinker Bell, and Tiger Lily, but at a time when a new band of pirates, including Captain James Hook, are mounting a siege on the inhabitants. All the great Heroes of Neverland have disappeared, and four Pirates from the Mainland have taken over. While J. M. Barrie may have written a much happier world, this is still the same place, with all the characters and places you know and love—but in a time of great terror. The game has several animals, beasts, and mythos from the original book Peter and Wendy including characters from Little White Bird—it is your task to get the World back to the way it once was, with the characters you collect along the way. If you are able to compile the best deck filling each of the categories (HERO, BRAVE, LOST), you win!
177624.name: Reclaim Neverland

177625.name: The Great British Trivia Quiz
177625.description:
A roll-and-move, question-and-answer trivia game with 1200 general knowledge questions about the British Isles. There are six question categories:


History & legends
Famous people
Art & entertainment
General trivia
Geography
Sport

177627.description:
In A Bind Expansions contains 3.5 expansions that can be combined with the In a Bind base game in whatever combination(s) you like. The expansions are:


22 wild cards: Someone will make up part of the card, as in a Mad Lib, when it's played.
10 speech-based triggered binds: You need to say something whenever anyone draws.
10 physical triggered binds: You need to perform a movement whenever anyone draws.
12 communal (physical triggered) binds: These either apply to everyone, or to everyone but the person playing the card, depending on whether you're playing "Fast & Furious" or "Slow & Sadistic".
177627.name: In A Bind Expansions

177628.name: The Regiment: Colonial Marines
177628.description:
User Summary

The Regiment: Colonial Marines is an Apocalypse World hack that primarily emulates the genre of futuristic squad-level military action.

The following playbooks are part of this hack:
- Trooper
- Officer
- Medic
- Sergeant
- Synthetic

The Regiment also contains special player moves to emulate military life and action.
Player Moves
Combat Moves: Assault, Attack, Hit the Deck, Push Yourself, Combat Action, Keep It Together
Support Moves: Assess, Aid.
Peripheral Moves: Critical, Will, Petition, Scrounge, Letters Home.
Engagement Move: Engage

Various factors effect combat scenarios like Volume of Fire, Cover, etc. Some weapons are familiar, but many are speculative (Rail Gun, Impact Cannon, Sentry Gun, etc.). Vehicles are also futuristic, like the UD-4L Cheyenne Dropship.

The GM toolkit contains various principles of play that are part of the familiar Apocalypse World Engine lexicon, along with some new concepts (Immerse them in the chaos of war and Give them downtime).

Another innovative feature is the use of Battle Plans. The Battle Plan allows players to pick a mission without getting bogged down in planning. The plans are: Recon Patrol, Combat Patrol, Fire & Maneuver, Ambush, Hold Ground, Pincer, Defense in Depth, Infiltration.

Colonial Marines also contains a write-up for a dangerous “Alien-style” Xenomorph along with a short scenario, Outpost Epsilon.

Changes from the The Regiment

Aside from redesigning and modifying the playbooks (and creating a new playbook), there are several differences between ‘’The Regiment’’ and the ‘’The Regiment: Colonial Marines.’’

A Changelog in the rules indicates these changes were made… the volume of fire table was rebuilt, a new Stress system was implemented, a new Wounds system was implemented, and several Moves were revised or completely new.

Also, the authors indicated that the new game had been streamlined to make it a simpler game with more difficult choices.

177629.name: B-Sieged: Heroes Set 1
177629.description:
B-Sieged: Heroes Set 1 introduces three brand-new Heroes to defend the Citadel of Modhelm: Seren, the Trickster; Axel, the Engineer; and Eyra, the Thief!

Seren, the Trickster
As a seasoned artist, Seren, the Trickster boasts a very unique and powerful starting Special Ability: Chicanery! Through Chicanery, Seren is allowed to draw 1 Resource card from the Seasons Resources at the beginning of each of her turns, and she can choose from any of the four types (Armory, Tavern, Market or Sorcery). This ability frees her up from visiting the Citadel's buildings as frequently as other Heroes, and gives the Heroes a way to get at least one Resource card per turn. Note that unlike Kador's Archmastery or Orobox's Intimidation skills, Seren may only draw from the Season Resources, which drains from the Heroes' common resources and makes her options limited if the Season resource decks are depleted.

Axel, the Engineer
As an Engineer, Axel comes with the Royal Artilleryman starting Special Ability. With it, Axel gets a free action per turn to either Rotate or Shoot the Catapult, and it can help the Heroes in crucial moments! Each Catapult shot may kill up to three enemies and it has a Strength of 4, so it can kill Mölens or severely damage the Avatar! The option to rotate the catapult is also important because Axel may use it to aim the catapult for another Hero, allowing him or her to shoot twice with the catapult in their turn if they wish to do so!

Eyra, the Thief
Last, but not least, Eyra the Thief brings two starting Special Abilities that emphasize her roguish nature: Filch and Archer's Discipline. With Filch, Eyra "accidentally comes by" one Market resource card at the beginning of each of her turns. These Tavern Resource cards come directly from the Tavern Resource pool, so she may get a card even if the Tavern is damaged or destroyed. With her trusty one-handed crossbow and Archer's Discipline, Eyra is able to shoot with better precision at enemies in Zone 2, making her a valuable asset to help control Krohns and Gargohs and filching Tavern cards every turn!

177630.name: Swop It
177630.description:
Back cover text (translated):

"Swop it" means "to trade", and that's exactly what this game is about -- trading clothes with each other! First, let the clothes-spinner determine who you will challenge, and which item of clothing you two will exchange with each other, then the countdown begins. Let the clothes fly! The person who first succeeds at removing their piece of clothing and putting on the exchanged piece gets to go forward on the gameboard.


The game is played to 23 points (with more points given out in a round if the winner finishes trading clothes before the timer runs out).

177631.name: Phantasy (Issue 6/7 - Mar 1982)
rpgissuearticle: The Making of a Game - Bounty Hunter
The Mis-Adventures of Cuthbert - Zombie Hackers
177631.description:
Phantasy "Double Issue" 6/7, 32 pages.

Magic Mouth - Better late... with more pages, art... (Evan Skolnick)
The Making of a Game - BOUNTY HUNTER (Mike Vitale)
National Profiles (R. Dennis Warren)
Art Folio (Micheal Zelonis)
Indian Artifacts - Fiction (Lee Enderlin)
Spotlight - Dealing with Phantasmal Force (M. Anthony Kapolka III)
The Sky Lords (Brett Palmer and Evan Skolnick)
Dragon's Hoard - Magic Items
The Misadventures of Cuthbert - Zombie Hackers (R. Dennis Warren)

177632.name: An Ideal Necklace: A Victorian Gabbing and Gifting Game
177632.description:
Victorian Ladies are on the hunt for fashion and husbands, each seeking to achieve her own personal ambition in An Ideal Necklace, a quick-moving game for one to four players.

Social engineering or by-the-numbers logical deduction are equally valid strategies as is everything in-between. Cards are visible to all, who may talk and influence other players' actions. Alliances may be made, or broken. Each turn, a Lady may: (1) select an event or a necklace from the Store; (2) attend Charm School to gain Charm; (3) gift a necklace to another Lady to earn Favor; (4) teach another Lady Charm in return for a necklace; (5) use Favor to prevent another Lady from acting.

Events are opportunities that may be acquired in lieu of selecting a necklace and they provide special powers, like the ability to recover Discarded necklaces or to Woo a Suitor twice, acquiring him as a husband.

Ladies gift necklaces to others to earn Favor, which is used, along with Charm, to Woo a Suitor, of which there are four. Once a Suitor has been Wooed twice, a Lady acquires him as a husband and if she has also achieved her Ambition, she earns bonus points and ends the game. Ambitions are goals, like acquiring the most necklaces, or gaining the most Favor.

Points are earned for: achieving an Ambition, ending the game, capturing a husband, possessing Charm, and for owning necklaces--some of which are especially valuable! The Advanced variation, also included, adds Suitor Traits, which vary Suitors' point values and which add special abilities.

Throughout, each player gabs and gifts their way to success, wooing Lords and giving necklaces to each other, attempting to attain An Ideal Necklace and An Ideal Husband as each Lady quests for An Ideal Victorian Life.

177633.name: Ciak! Il gioco di carte
177633.description:
Ciak! is a card game where several pictures companies fight for the dominance of Lollywood, recruiting actors, crew members, all-time-legends in order to "pillage" other companies and eliminate them from the game, by making then loose all their "dominance" points.

Classical LCG mechanics are reimplemented in this new setting, and several game modes are available: team game, free for all, one against all.

The game is played in turns, divided in phases:

Phase 1: the active player draws a card from the pile and gains 1 million.
Phase 2: the active player recruits from his/her hand actors, crew members, all-time-legends, paying their cost in millions, when present. Other players can use "istant speed" abilities and cards.
Phase 3: The active player chooses an opponent to attack him/her. After performing a successfull attack roll, the attacking player sums all the attack values of his/her recruited cards, while the defending player adds his/her defence values. Istant speed abilities and cards can be used to modify such results. If the attacking player wins, he/she performs a pillage action: the defending player will loose one o more dominance points. If the defending player wins, he/she can damage one of the attacking payer's recruited cards.
Phase 4: same as Phase 2. At the end of this phase, all damage and activeted abilities are cleared off.




A company which looses its last dominance points is eliminated from the game.

177634.name: Trodox (Issue 35 - Nov 2013)
177634.description: Issue 35 contains a scenario for Malmsturm, as well as a review/ introduction to the game. Also included is a short story alongside a few ideas how to use or build on it in a game of Private Eye.

177637.name: Trodox (Issue 34 - Apr 2013)
177637.description: Issue 34 contains a Private Eye scenario, short story, and historical background information on the Vienna police force at the end of the 19th century (useful for Cthulhu, Private Eye, Midgard 1880...). It also includes a short article on a PhD thesis on RPGs, Zwischen Simulation und Narration by David Nikolaus Schmidt.

177638.name: Trodox (Issue 1 - Apr 1989)
177638.description:
User summary
The inaugural issue of Trodox, the successor to the Pegasus fanzine, contains an interview with Thomas Finn, reviews, and a new character class for DSA. It also includes a short story and a comic.

In recent years (at least since 2013) a scanned version of Trodox #1 was included on the Trodox discs (collecting all Trodox materials).

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2016 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Nominee
177639.description:
Mamma Raptor has escaped from her run and laid her eggs in the park. A team of scientists must neutralize her and capture the baby raptors before they run wild into the forest.

Raptor is a card driven boardgame with tactical play and some double guessing. Players use their cards to move their pawns (scientists on one side, Mother and baby raptors on the other) on the board. Every round, the player who played the lowest ranked card can use the corresponding action, while his opponent has movement / attack points equal to the difference between the two cards values. The scientists can use fire, can move by jeep on the tracks, and can even call for reinforcements, while the mamma raptor can hide in the bushes, yell to frighten the scientists, and call for her babies.
177639.name: Raptor
boardgamepodcastepisode: BRUNO! - Part 2
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 017 – Our Podcast Subscriptions
DJ123: RAPTOR (2015) Bruno Cathala + Bruno Faidutti
Episode 17 - Kanban: Automotive Revolution Review
Perfect Information Podcast Episode 19 - Stories We Play
The Dice Steeple - Episode # 9 - Bruno Faidutti
The Game Pit: Episode 50 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 2
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 60!!! Contest and More!!!

177640.name: Ring Pass Not
177640.description:
User Summary

In this puzzle game you will need to fit the tiles in the magic ring to prevent the dragon from incinerating you. There are some aids you can use along the way and special combinations of tiles will give you more points.

177641.description:
Tinker Tailor is a role-picking and set-gathering card game for 3 to 6 players suitable either as a general family game or as a light 'filler' game. The aim of the game is to get the most points.

Points are collected in the form of money cards or goods cards, and the more goods cards a player owns (up to a maximum of eight) of a given type, the greater the value of the cards. Players also get a bonus for collecting all five goods: Bread, Fish, Cloth, Wine and Gems.

Each turn, each player selects one role that defines the action they can take. The players who make the best choices and uses their actions to the greatest advantage will win the game.
177641.name: Tinker Tailor
boardgamepodcastepisode: Perfect Information - Episode 1: On Theme

177642.name: Trodox DVD-Rom v4.x (2015)
177642.description:
This item collects all DVD versions starting with v4.x. Since frequent small updates occur, not every disk version warrants its own entry.

This DVD replaces older disk versions of previous Trodox material. The disk collects almost all content from Trodox isses 1-36 (25 years of fanzine content) in cuecard format, younger issues are also offered in PDF format. The first five issue is scanned as PDF, too, as are issues 1-7 of the predecessor, fanzine Der Pegasus.

Several other goodies include an old radio show with Trodox members, a collection of audioplays and many free German RPGs in electronic format.

177643.name: Stone and a Hard Place
177643.description:
From the back of the book:

Dead Men Walking!

Death rules this land. From the sun-scorched earth to the empty noose swinging in the hangman's tree to the bloodstained buzzards circling overhead... the Wild Southwest thirsts for souls. Make sure it don't get yours, partner.

Stone and a Hard Place details the strange locales and odd characters of the American Southwest, provides new Edges and abilities to gussy up your Harrowed or hexslinger, new Setting Rules to emulate Death's grip on the lang, Savage Tales galore, a passel o' terrifying abominations and an epic Plot Point Campaign that pits a posse against Death's red right hand—the one and only Stone!

177644.name: Alba dei Re: Saga Completa
177644.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sfidando secoli e conquistatori, le Terre Rubate rimangono una delle zone più feroci di una nazione già di per sé selvaggia. Situata lungo il confine tra i Regni Fluviali e il Brevoy, questa distesa di foreste, paludi, pianure rocciose e montagne ondeggianti resiste da molto alla conquista, sembrando divertirsi a giocare letali tiri mancini a tutte le civiltà. è una terra di accidentati territori selvaggi, bestie mortali, pericoli imprevedibili e cupe leggende. Ora, due fazioni, gli agenti assetati di potere di un paese espansionista e i servitori di una disonorata principessa di un regno al di là di ogni immaginazione, si trovano destinati a uno scontro mortale per poter realizzare i loro piani di conquista di questo aspro territorio.

Da questo conflitto nuovi eroi sono pronti a emergere e dalle terre selvagge si prepara a sorgere un nuovo regno.

Questa edizione originale ed unica riunisce in un solo volume una delle campagne più amate dai giocatori di Pathfinder Gioco di Ruolo, dando il via ad una nuova linea di Pathfinder Saga creata apposta per il mercato italiano che porterà sul vostro tavolo da gioco oltre 400 pagine ricche di pathos, emozioni ed avventure!

L'Alba dei Re contiene:

Tutti i sei capitoli della Saga originale: Kingmaker.
Articoli sui principali luoghi di Alba dei Re: il Pitax, la Iobaria e le terre del Primo Mondo.
Le regole per creare e gestire un regno, e tutti i dettagli per tener conto delle esplorazioni per tutta la campagna.
Un bestiario con 18 mostri della Saga originale.
Le spoglie e dei re, oggetti e artefatti mai visti prima, mappe e molto altro ancora!





Translation courtesy of Google:

Defying centuries and conquerors, the Stolen Lands remain one of the fiercest areas of a nation already wild. Located along the border between the Kingdoms River and the Brevoy, this expanse of forests, marshes, rocky plains and undulating mountains it resists long to conquer, seeming to enjoy playing pranks lethal to all civilizations. It is a land of rugged wilderness, deadly beasts, unpredictable dangers and dark legends. Now, two factions, the power of an expansionist country thirsty agents and servants of a disgraced princess of a kingdom beyond all imagination, are destined for a deadly confrontation in order to realize their plans of conquest of this harsh land.

From this conflict the new heroes are ready to emerge and the wilderness is preparing to raise up a new realm.

This original and unique edition brings together in one volume one of the most popular campaigns by Pathfinder players Roleplay, giving way to a new Pathfinder Saga line created specifically for the Italian market which will lead to your gaming table more than 400 pages full pathos, emotions and adventures!

L ' Dawn of the Kings contains:

All six chapters of the original Saga: Kingmaker .
Articles on the main places of the Kings of Alba: the Pitax, the Iobaria and lands of the First World.
The rules for creating and managing a kingdom, and all the details to take account of the explorations throughout the campaign.
A bestiary with 18 of the original Saga monsters.
The bare and and kings, never seen before objects and artifacts, maps and much more!

177645.name: Project Octopia
177645.description:
From the publisher website:
Project Octopia è un volume dedicato a chi ama il gioco di ruolo horror di grande respiro, e in particolare ai cultori di Lovecraft.

English translation:
Project Octopia is a book dedicated to those who love the horror role playing game, and in particular to Lovecraft lovers.

177646.name: Les Cloches d'Erildan
177646.description:
From the back of the book:
DULTUR est assiégée! Le barbare LILITH a massé ses hordes sous les murs de la capitale. Le seul espoir des défenseurs réside maintenant dans le succès de l'expédition que le magicien GRIM'LAWK a conduit dans le Nord.

English translation:
DULTUR is under siege! The barbaric LILITH massed his hordes under the walls of the capital. The only hope of the defenders now resides in the success of the expedition that led the wizard GRIM'LAWK in the North.

177647.name: La Caverne Oubliée
177647.description:
From the back of the book:
"Aujourd'hui, des patrouilles sont sorties du palais avec une mission bien précise et accompagnées chacune d'un prêtre. Leur but est de ramener au palais certains aventuriers dont la présence est instamment souhaitée..."


English translation:
"Today, patrols are out of the palace with a precise mission and each accompanied by a priest. Their goal is to bring in the palace some adventurers whose presence is strongly desired ..."

177648.name: Le Pays des Voleurs
177648.description:
From the back of the book:
Il y a une trentaine d'années existait encore, 40km environ au Nord de MIRASTUL, un bien étrange "royaume".
English translation:
Thirties years ago still existed, about 40km north of MIRASTUL, a strange "kingdom".

177649.name: Les Chemins de Marbre
177649.description:
From the back of the book:
Tout commence dans le village de LORENDAEL. Chaque année, lors de la NUIT DU SACRIFICE, un adolescent est conduit dans LE VERT, une plaine située au Nord du village. Au matin, on n'en retrouve nulle trace!

English translation:
Everything starts in the village of LORENDAEL. Each year, during the Night of Sacrifice, a young person is brought in the GREEN, a plain located north of the village. In the morning, no trace id find!

177650.name: Le Secret de Candeliarn
177650.description:
From the back of the book:
Mais quelle est donc la cause des troubles du village d'Erruyn Hann?

English translation:
What is the cause of the village of Hann Erruyn disorders?

177651.name: Dragonlands #1: I Draghi
177651.description:
From the interior cover:
Dragonlands 1, i Draghi, è la traduzione parziale del volume Dragons, edito dalla Mayfair Games nel 1986 per la collana Role Aids.

English translation:
Dragonlands 1, the Dragons, is a partial translation of the book Dragons, published by Mayfair Games in 1986 for the series Role Aids.

177652.name: Dragonlands #2: I Signori dei Draghi
177652.description:
From the interior cover:
Dragonlands 2, i Signori dei Draghi, è la traduzione parziale del volume Dragons, edito dalla Mayfair Games nel 1986 per la collana Role Aids.

English translation:
Dragonlands 2, the Lords of the Dragons, is a partial translation of the book Dragons, published by Mayfair Games in 1986 for the series Role Aids.

177654.name: Six Gems of Xantree
177654.description:
From cover of the book:
Six Gems of Xantree is a universal Fantasy Role-Playing Gaming (FRPG) adventures usable with most FRPG systems with little to no alterations

177655.name: Little Beaver's complete 3 game set
177655.description:
Compilation of 3 games for children -
Game 1: see Little Burro Chase Game
Game 2: Falling off... : move according to die around the board; last player who survives (doesn't 'fall off' - see board) wins
Game 3: Prospecting... : first player who obtains an uranium mine wins

177656.name: Domain of Xantree
177656.description:
From cover of the book:
The Domain of Xantree is a universal Fantasy Role-Playing Gaming (FRPG) adventures usable with most FRPG systems with little to no alterations

177657.name: The Role-Playing Game Primer and Old School Playbook
177657.description:
From the Back of the Book

Are you interested in classic paper-and-pencil role-playing games, but you have no idea where to start? This is the book for you! The Role-Playing Game Primer starts from the very beginning, first showing you how to play, then giving you hints and tips on how to do it better. Later chapters provide guidance for beginning Game Masters, to get you up and running even if you have little or no experience as a player. The RPG Primer is aimed at players and GMs of "Old School" paper-and-pencil role-playing games and their modern "retro-clones." It features several of the earliest and best known of the Old School Renaissance games, including Basic Fantasy RPG (by the same author), OSRIC, Labyrinth Lord, and Swords & Wizardry.

177659.description:
20 years after the end of The Manhattan Project, the superpowers of the world are embroiled in another vicious arms race. Manufacturing nukes is no longer an obstacle; all nations are now capable of churning them out at a rapid pace. The challenge of this era lies in the development of various delivery systems called the "Nuclear Triad:" strategic bombers, ballistic subs, and land-based ballistic missiles.

Each player represents one of the superpowers in the arms race. At staged intervals, scoring is conducted in one of 4 categories:

- Strategic Bombers
- Ballistic Submarines
- ICBMs
- Short-range missiles deployed to third world nations

In addition to earning points for deploying nukes during the scoring rounds, players can also earn defensive bonuses for mitigating the risks imposed against them.

The game ends after all of the scoring events have been completed. The player with the most points is the winner.

To help along the way, you will recruit 4 different kinds of workers:

- Laborers, which operate your buildings
- Spies, which operate your opponents' buildings for your gain
- Politicians, which produce tax revenue and gain control over third world nations
- Generals, which deploy your bombers, subs, and overseas missiles

You will also construct and operate 6 different kinds of buildings:

- Factories, which produce submarines and aircraft
- Research Facilities, which allow you to improve your position in 5 different technology tracks
- Reactors, which produce nukes
- Silos, which are armed with ICBMs
- Test Sites, which allow you to detonate nukes in your own territory for points
- ABM Launchers, which earn defensive bonuses against various threats

Minutes to Midnight is a standalone game. It is part of The Manhattan Project line from Minion Games.
177659.name: The Manhattan Project 2: Minutes to Midnight
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Episode 10: The one about 2016 and 2017
Episode 1: The one about us and our Gen Con recap
HLG 3: Explosief Materiaal

177660.name: Kreative Kocken
177660.description:
Swedish cardgame about cooking.
Basically all about a card deck with 101 different ingredients, where the players plays ingredients from their hands in turn, trying to be the first player without cards. The game comes with rules for three different game styles tucked into the card deck.

From the publisher:
"Ta fram den Kreative kocken i dig!
Detta kortspel utspelar sig i ett kök med välfyllt skafferi. Men Kreative Kocken handlar inte bara om att kombinera ingredienser till spännande nya maträtter. Det är också ett lagarbete där flera kockar måste samarbeta och argumentera för de ingredienser de lägger till. Så vad du än kokar ihop, så måste du också lyckas övertyga medspelarna om att smaka på det…"

177661.name: Ring: Telling the tales of trees
rpg: Ring: Telling the tales of trees
177661.description:
User Summary

Ring is a game poem about the life of a tree, designed to play with a small group in about 15 minutes with no prep or materials.

It was created as part of David Schirduan's 200 word challenge

177662.name: Bloody Business
177662.description:
From the publishers homepage:

Wounded Fury

A scared megacorporation does not run and hide in the shadows. Instead it lashes out, swiping with sharp claws, not caring who is hit by the blows. Many of the megacorps are currently reeling, hit by multiple harsh wallops. NeoNET and Evo are dealing with the fallout of the CFD virus, Ares has powerful forces eating it away from inside, Horizon backed the losing side of the Aztlan-Amazonia war, and the Japanacorps are rearing back to take on the world—and each other. When the corps get aggressive, shadowrunners get called, and blood gets shed.

Bloody Business is a campaign book giving players the chance to earn piles of money from the megacorps as they reel through troubles and crises. It’ll take a lot of good shadowrunning moves to earn that cash—and even better moves to survive long enough to collect it. With short adventure outlines that can be played independently or linked into a longer campaign, and NPC stats to suit a wide variety of situations, Bloody Business plunges Shadowrun teams in the middle of corporate chaos.

Bloody Business is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

177663.name: The City of Lost Children
177663.description:
Back of Box (PC)

Kidnappings, robberies, dark characters and stolen dreams are just part of the fantastic landscape in The City of Lost Children.

As a 10 year old orphan, you must rely on your street smarts to solve the mystery of why the City's children are vanishing one by one...and where in this eerie labyrinth of back alleys and foreboding warehouses will the plot take another wickedly clever twist?

Prepare yourself for a brilliant flight of the imagination and a breathtaking graphical experience. Because in the City of Lost Children, there are no dead ends. Only more adventures.


A complex interactive adventure based on the award-winning international art-house film
17 wildly imaginative characters brought to life in fully motion-captured animations and high resolution 3D graphics
Stunning rendered sequences advance the story
Intuitive controls make it easier to get into and play the game
Explore 30 different interactive locations with 360° range of movement
Amazingly detailed backgrounds with atmospheric lightning, shadows and special effects
Non-linear gameplay expands the challenge of the game
Multiple camera angles heighten the cinematic experience

177664.name: National Network Game
177664.description: The National Network Game is played on a wooden board printed with a 5x5 grid. Each player has five pawns of the same colour. The game starts with a row of pawns in alternating colours on opposite sides of the board. Players alternate turns, moving one of their pieces one square at a time in any direction (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.) The first player to manoeuver four pieces in a square or continuous straight line (in any direction) is the winner.

177665.description:
This is the third game in the TPS of the Pocket_Battle_Games from LPS, Inc.
It covers the Marne Campaign of 1914. One player is the German and other play with the Entente (French and British troops).
German Player wins if there is a German unit in or adjacent to Paris at end of any turn and he can trace a line of connected squares, free of Entente units. Otherwise, the Entente players win.
Counters need to be cut from around the edge of the card. Die-cut counters are available from Turning Point Simulations with any purchase at no additional charge.
177665.name: Fateful Days: The Marne Campaign of 1914

177666.description:
"The VE-Day Scenarios commemorate the last battles of 1945. Relieve the men of the 79th US Infantry trapped in the two encircled towns of Hatten & Rittershof; take command of the 44th British Brigarde and its flamethrower tanks during Operation Veritable; cross the Rhine with the men of the 'All American' 82nd Airborne; or gather your friends to assault - or defend - the infamous Seelow Heights, last line of defense before Berlin, in a massive Overlord battle."

Erratum: In scenario #1, "Hatten & Rittershofen" the Mobile Artillery Unit (bottom left of the board) should be an Allied unit, not an Axis one (the Special Rules text is correct).
177666.name: Memoir '44: VE-Day Scenarios

177667.name: Albedo: Eyes from Outer Space
177667.description:
User Summary

This game combines first person shooter, action adventure, and even puzzles. Set with a 1960s space film atmosphere, you are seeking to rise in your building after being blown into the basement. You solve puzzles to make progress, exploring rooms, gathering materials, and crafting solutions with combinations of materials. There are a few intricate puzzles from picking locks to reconfiguring plumbing.

177669.name: Alcazar
177669.description:
User Summary

Alcazar is an abstract logic puzzle game similar to sudoku and picross. The goal of each puzzle is to create a single, continuous path which fills every square in a rectangular grid and which does not cross itself or any walls, entering and exiting the grid through designated doorways.

177670.name: chibiMob
177670.description:
The world's most powerful criminal organisations have come together in a struggle for control of a rich and corrupt city. Hire Goons, make alliances, and hit the right Bosses to install a new Kingpin and win this game of strategy.
Hiring Goons gives you more cards to use.
Making alliances with Bosses lets you use their Ally Powers (many powerful combinations are possible!).
Putting out a hit on a Boss gives you points (unless it is from the same family as the Kingpin.)
At the end of the game, each player gets 1 point for each Goon they control, 2 points for each Ally they have made, and Bosses they have hit are worth points equal to their hit number (unless they are from the kingpin's family). Most points wins.

chibiMob is a modular game. The base game includes 6 modules;
(Yakuza, Mafia, Triads, Posse, Jewish Mob, and Russian Mob)
Include more modules for more players or to increase game length. Use fewer modules for a quicker game or fewer players.
1 module : 2 players 10 minutes
2 modules : 2-3 players 20 minutes
3 modules : 2-4 players 30 minutes
4 modules : 2-5 players 40 minutes
5 modules : 3-6 players 50 minutes
6 modules : 3-6 players 60 minutes

177671.name: The Little Big Game of Moocho Sudooko
177671.description: The Big Little Game of Moocho Sudooko turns sudoku puzzles into a board game. The board is a 9x9 square divided into 9 grids of 9. Each player gets 27 tiles (3 sets with the digits 1 to 9) in one of four colours. At the beginning of each turn the player rolls the dice and uses the result to decide which tile to play. A tile can be placed in any spot as long as there are not two identical numbers in the same row, column, or grid square. If the player cannot make a legal move, or the player does not play before the timer runs out, play passes to the next player. Play continues until there are no legal plays that can be made. (Alternatively, players may shift (but not remove) tiles to allow further plays.) The player with the fewest remaining tiles is the winner. In case of a tie, the numbers on the remaining tiles are added and the player with the lowest total wins.

177672.name: Hobbit Magazine (Issue 0 - 1990)
177672.description:
La Casa del Hobbit presenta Hobbit Magazine

Sumario
Editorial (La Redaccion)
¿Que es la Casa del Hobbit?
¿I.C.E. o Tolkien?
Kiosko Comic
Adventura Helada en Hoth (Star Wars)
Nuevas Armas para Aquelarre
Ads

177673.name: Hobbit Magazine (Issue 1 - 1991)
rpgissuearticle: HAWKMOON, un juego de rol en un futuro medieval
Modulos - Las Civilizaciones Olvidadas la Piramide de Humatk
Pequeñas ventajas para personajes de RUNE QUEST
Tabla de objectos para RUNE QUEST
177673.description:
Editorial (La Redacción)
Pequeñas ventajas para personajes de RUNE QUEST
Tabla de objectos para RUNE QUEST
Reglas de Justas para AQUELARRE
Amplicaciones - JAMES BOND
Escenarios y Complementos
HAWKMOON, un juego de rol en un futuro medieval
Pesos Pesados - Sueños Metalicos
El Verdadero Espiritu del Vampiro
Modulos - Las Civilizaciones Olvidadas la Piramide de Humatk
Modulos - STAR WARS

177675.name: Secret Files: Sam Peters
177675.description:
Bigfoot, the Abominable Snowman, the Loch Ness Monster - cryptozoologists are trying to track these creatures down and research them. One also appears in the legends of the Ashanti people in Ghana. These tell of human-like creatures that lurk in the trees at night and take their victims off to their caves to suck their blood: the Asanbosam. Right after journalist Sam Peters has escaped from a volcanic eruption on an Indonesian island caused by terrorists, her boss sends her to Africa. Soon enough, strange things start happening at Bosumtwi, a mysterious crater lake. Could the Asanbosam really exist? Sam Peters is searching for the answers in this thrilling tale of the Secret Files series.

Source: The Publisher Website.

177676.name: Weg mit dem teuren Brennholz
177676.description: Promotional game for "Individ Kohle" (brown coal briquettes) from the 1930s. The game can be played as a simple roll-and-move-game with event spaces, that hinder or benefit the player, or as a Pachisi variant (Heraus mit ihm!).

177677.name: City Country World
177677.description:
In this game, the children learn countries, capitals, flags and continents in an enjoyable game, while enriching their knowledge and memory skills!

Similar to matching pairs memory game.

Contents: 27 country cards & 27 city cards

boardgamehonor: 2015 Jocul Anului în România Advanced Finalist
177678.description:
Italy during the 15th century was a country full of intrigue and magnificence. The tumultuous political conditions created the perfect breeding ground for the birth of a new form of government (called Signoria) and the rise of the most ambitious noble families. After having acted in the dark for a long time, the time has finally come for them to take control of the cities and shape Italy’s future. Their stories will go down in history.

In Signorie, you will play the role of a Signore, a Lord of one of the most prestigious families of the Renaissance. One at the time, players choose one die from a common pool. (Twenty dice in five colors are rolled at the beginning of each round.) You place it on your player board (your city) and perform one of the possible actions. The color of the chosen die determines the action, and the number on the die is a discount on the cost of the action.

During a round, each player can perform up to four actions. At the end of the round, if the sum of a player's chosen dice is equal or lower than 13, he can obtain a reward.

The dice mechanism is easy and innovative and gives players a simple, but challenging choice. Money is always tight, so there is a temptation to choose a high valued dice, but that needs to be balanced with obtaining the reward.
177678.name: Signorie
boardgamepodcastepisode: clp008 – cubelove podcast – Strategicon Wrapup Part 2
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 009 – Top 10 Games of 2015
Episode 45 – Interview with Jamie from The Secret Cabal and Patrick from Blue Peg Pink Peg
Episode 52 - The Prodigals Club
Episode 66 Part 1 : Totally Gaming (I say Xenon, you say Zion)
Episode 66- Dark Moon and Relationship Games
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 12
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 18
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 22
Garrett's Games 500 - Best of 2015 + Contest Resolution!
Heavy Cardboard Episode 41 – Lignum
Low Player Count - Ep 13 - Luck in Games
Low Player Count - Ep 16 - It's BGGcon Y'all!
Low Player Count - Ep 23 - Game Weight
Strange Assembly 205 - 2016 Wrap-Up
The Game Pit: Episode 68 - Picking Over the Bones
Vox Republica 121: Meeples (And Humans) Included
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 45!!!

177679.name: The Tombstone Seven
177679.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Big trouble is brewing in Tombstone…and the Tombstone Seven might just save the day!

Designed for Deadlands’ Stone and a Hard Place, these pregenerated characters are ready for action and updated with the newest rules introduced for After the Cackler.

As those familiar with our other archetype characters know, each page features one character with art by three-time Hugo award winning artist Cheyenne Wright, background, and statistics–perfect for a convention game or even to help kick off your Stone and a Hard Place campaign! They are:

Luke Pitt, Harrowed
Carmen Valenzuela, Hexslinger
Virginia Ann Earp, Gunslinger
Warren Earp, Texas Ranger
Ned Harkness, Former Outlaw
Matilda Loomis, Shaman
Cooper Grannon, Mad Scientist

Grab these heroes before “trouble” comes knocking…

177680.description:
The aim in Ninja Dojo Fight! is to prove you're the best Ninja by participating in unsanctioned battles. To help you win, you must break into the dojo and look for the best weapon you can find at the break of dawn. The game is made up of five rounds with each round consisting of three turns followed by a battle phase. Each turn has three phases:


Select: Each player secretly chooses an action.
Reveal: All players simultaneously reveal their chosen action.
Resolve: Actions are resolved in ascending order.


After three turns, a battle occurs and a new round begins. The player to win the most battles after five rounds is declared the winner. In the event of a tie, the players tied play one additional round, called the showdown; whoever wins the showdown wins the game.

---

Ninja Dojo Fight! is a micro game inspired by Entropy. You play as a ninja from one of four rival disciplines. As a ninja in training on your final test, your goal is to win the most battles using the weapons at your disposal.

The game play has similarly to the main counterpart Entropy, through the use of simultaneous action selection, but it's not quite the same game. With only 42 cards, it is more thematically and technically accessible than Entropy. The visual design is minimalistic and the cards do not have any text.
177680.name: Ninja Dojo Fight!

177681.name: Merchants of Kaidan
177681.description:
User Summary

A fantasy trading game with some RPG elements.

177682.name: Metal Drift
177682.description:
Metal Drift is a vehicular sport combat game set in a distant future. As the player, you command an agile, high powered hover tank in a futuristic sports arena. Core game play centers on intense tank-on-tank team combat seen through an immersive, first person cockpit. Layered on this, a goal-oriented game type that allows for high level strategy and team dynamics. Players can level up to unlock new ranks, weapons, skins, and upgrades.

Source: The Game Website.

177683.name: Citadels
177683.description:
From the Publisher / Developer Website
A vast army has gathered in front of the castle gates and is preparing to attack King Arthur! How has it come to this?

Witness important events in the history of the legendary king and accompany him and his army on the path to an uncertain future. It is up to you to restore the honor, the glory and the reign of the Arthurian line, and rewrite the course of history!

Good or evil? The decision is entirely yours! Two extensive campaigns give you insight into both sides of the war.

177684.name: Goblin World Player Handbook
177684.description: From back cover: Welcome to GoblinWorld! Enter the world of live-action role playing. You decide the outcome in this game with your skill and wits. Game action takes place in real time as the players physically interact with each other. Goblin World spans across cultures and technology from Aztec to high-tech. Games can be set in classic fantasy/medieval, cyber/dark future, or Gothic horror genres.

177685.name: Millie
177685.description:
A joyful, casual puzzle game that will tease both your wits and your memory!

You've always dreamt of flying. Roaming high in the clouds, free from all worries. Just gliding through air like a bird. Unfortunately, you were born as a millipede, and your best chance of launching to the sky is probably in some crows mouth... or is it? Rumor has it that the local Aviation School is accepting new recruits for a pilot course. Seeing an opportunity to make your dreams come true, you seize the moment and embark on a journey of your life. Your path is full of dangers, mazes and obstructions, but the end goal is more than worth it!

So rise on your feet, all 100 of them, and get going!
Control a millipede, roaming through over 90 diverse levels. Solve the elaborate mazes laying on your way. Gather and use multitude of power-ups that will help you with your struggles. Enjoy three types of immersing mini games. Grow bigger and bigger; and remember: try not to eat your tail.

Source: The Developer Website.

177686.name: The Kanar: A guide to Live-action Role-playing
177686.description:
From the back of the book:

Can you see yourself as an elven, wizard, a knight from the royal court, a fur-clad barbarian, or any other fantasy denizen?

177687.name: Teddy Floppy Ear - Kayaking
177687.description:
Send your kid onto an unforgettable journey with the world’s most charming bear.

Based on a famous polish cartoon, Teddy Floppy Ear stands out as a great entertainment for younglings. Prepared by an experienced team, Teddy Floppy Ear – Kayaking mixes fun adventure game with a healthy dose of learning, perfect for young minds.

In this episode our main character takes advantage of beautiful, spring weather and goes on a kayaking trip with his friend Piglet. There he finds out that there is a problem with Mr. Catfish who acts a little too bossy, and needs to be taught a lesson in kindness. During his trip, our hero solves numerous puzzles testing child's mathematical skills, eye-hand coordination, logical thinking and perceptiveness.

Source: The Developer Website.

177688.name: Shades of Nightfall
177688.description:
From the back of he book:
An alternatve live-action vampire system designed specifically for live-action roleplaying

177689.name: 16-bit Trader
177689.description:
Take revenge on your father’s killer, and become the richest merchant in the kingdom! Immerse yourself in this old-school nostalgia-inducing trading experience.

Step into the shoes of a medieval travelling merchant, whose life boils down to one simple sentence: you got to buy cheap, and you got to sell high. Travel between the cities and villages of the realm in search of cheap goods to acquire, various quests to accomplish and wealth to accumulate. Visit local taverns for latest local gossip. Gain influential friends who may help you along the way. Hire companions to assist you if you run into vile bandits or unpredictable events. Pursue rumors of great harvest and goods shortages to find the best deals. Search for local people in need and they may reward you handsomely for your help. Expand your company, invest in it, and get rich in no time! And if you’re for a bit of a thrill, visit ancient landmark and search for valuable artifacts.

Source: The Developer Website.

177690.name: Teddy Floppy Ear: The Race
177690.description:
Fling yourself into the cutest racing action ever. People of Animalville got a karting fever and you must help one of them succeed. Take the wheel, choose a kart, decide which character from 'Teddy Floppy Ear’ universe you want, and start the wild ride! Compete all day long on nightly and daily tracks that span around the beautiful and colorful countryside. Play in one of many modes including Time Attack and Racing Season. Use power ups to gain advantage or slow down your opponents. Improve your vehicle’s appearance by tuning

Source: The Developer Website.

177691.name: On Stage! Epico
rpg: On Stage!: Metodo di improvvisazione teatrale nel mondo di William Shakespeare
177691.description:
From the publisher website:
La prima espansione DaS per On Stage! è disponibile! Con On Stage! Epico sarete in grado di ricreare l'ambiente e gli intrighi di Re Artù e dei Cavalieri della Tavola Rotonda.

English translation:
The first DaS expansion for On Stage! it's available! With On Stage! Epic you will be able to recreate the environment and the intrigues of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.

177692.name: Roommates
177692.description:
From the Publisher / Developer Website
Welcome to the halls of Latin House!

The best dorm (that you can afford) at the greatest college (that would accept you) in the entire country (Not counting the parts that aren't here). Okay, maybe we're overselling it.

Either way, you're invited along with either Max or Anne as they make their way through the first year of their college experience.

177693.name: Oni
rpg: On Stage!: Metodo di improvvisazione teatrale nel mondo di William Shakespeare
177693.description:
From the publisher website:
On Stage! ONI porta la tradizione del Giappone medievale sul palco.

English translation:
On Stage! ONI takes the tradition of medieval Japan on stage.

177694.name: Manuale del Regista
rpg: On Stage!: Metodo di improvvisazione teatrale nel mondo di William Shakespeare
177694.description:
From the publisher website:
Il Manuale del Regista non cela tra le sue pagine formule magiche capaci di trasformare chiunque in abili intrattenitori, né rivela segrete alchimie capaci di far ricordare tutte le regole in un batter d'occhio.

English translation:
The Director's Manual does not hide in its pages spells that can turn anyone into a skilled entertainer, or reveal secret alchemy that make you able to remember all the rules in a jiffy.

177695.name: Oltre le Mura del Sonno
177695.description:
From the book cover
Avventura Universale di ambientazione horror - sorannaturale utilizzabile con tutti i sistemi di gioco

English translation:
Universal Adventure for supernatural horror settings usale with all game systems

177696.name: The Rifter (Issue 69 - Mar 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Dead Reign Tampa Bay – Optional source material for Dead Reign
From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
Heroic Hot Spots – Optional NPCs and adventure ideas for Heroes Unlimited in the Century Station city setting
Living through the Great Cataclysm, one day at a time – Optional source material for Rifts Chaos Earth
Rifts Arenas of Atlantis – Optional Source Material for Rifts
The Long Gull Islands – Optional source material for After the Bomb
177696.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rifter® #69 is packed with exciting and fun material for Rifts®, Chaos Earth®, After the Bomb®, Dead Reign®, Heroes Unlimited™ and more!
The Rifter® #69 – Winter, 2015:
Rifts®: Arenas of Atlantis by Will Erwin.
Rifts® Chaos Earth®: First Responders of New Mexico by Daniel Frederick.
After the Bomb®: Long Gull Islands by Michael J. Osborne.
Heroes Unlimited™: Adventure ideas by Glen Evans.
Dead Reign®: Tampa Bay by Eric Sturm.
Rifts® Short Story: Clean, Part One, by Irvin Jackson.
News, coming attractions, product descriptions and more.
Rifts® cover by “Madman” Mike Leonard.

177697.description:
The Walking Dead Bang! Dice Game allows players to face off against one another in this fast-paced stand-alone version of Bang!

Roll, shoot Bang! Test your survival skills with this fast moving version of BANG! The Dice Game: The Walking Dead. Based on the world's best-selling shoot 'em up card game Bang!, where players battle one another for supremacy! With each roll of the dice, Walkers get closer to overrunning the Survivors, can you survive?
177697.name: Bang! The Dice Game: The Walking Dead
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 61 - Mansions of Madness 2nd Ed. Halloween Spooktacular

177698.description:
Karnivore Koala is a cards´n´dice game set in a post-eucalyptic world in which 2-6 players are on the hunt for mutant animals.

Each player controls one koala king and builds up a tribe by placing workbears, villagebears and huntbears in it. Rolling and re-rolling the 5 special dice allows a player to activate their koala's special effects.

Backstabbears will be used to foil each player`s plans and deny their victory.

The first player that was able to hunt an appetizer, a main dish and a dessert pleased their king and wins the game!
177698.name: Karnivore Koala

177699.name: Block Party
177699.description:
Ambush Mission 17: Block Party – A complete January, 1945 campaign scenario and insert cards.

This scenario originally appeared in Battleplan Magazine (#4) September / October 1987.

Errata and corrections appeared in Battleplan Magazine #7.

Includes:
4 Mission cards
12 German Soldier Cards
2 German Vehicles: Panzer V (Panther) and Halftrack
1 US Sherman Tank Card
10 Pages of Paragraphs

177700.name: Chemicus: Journey to the Other Side
177700.description:
User Summary

The player explores, solves puzzles, and learns a little chemistry to get through the city of Chemicus.

177701.name: Physicus: Save the World with Science
177701.description:
User Summary

The player explores and uses knowledge of physics to solve puzzles and save the earth.

177702.description:
The year is 2038. After decades of borrowing money from the rest of the world, the USA finally went bankrupt. In a last desperate move, the federal government decided to auction its most secret treasures: the artifacts and relics stored in Warehouse 51. And there's serious stuff in there, such as Aladdin's Lamp, the Hammer of Thor, the Golem, and the Philosopher's Stone.

In Warehouse 51, players are multimillionaires from across the globe who want to buy these artifacts for their collections, but most of the items have strange paranormal effects that can influence the game, and many of them are fakes...
177702.name: Warehouse 51
boardgamepodcastepisode: BRUNO!  - Part 1
Dukes of Dice - Ep. 42 - Kyckshyft
Ep. 28 – The Grizzled & Tides of Time | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 107-- Gen Con 2015 Wrap up and La Granja Review
The Dice Steeple - Episode # 9 - Bruno Faidutti
Vox Republica 114: The Staying Power Of Codenames

177703.name: Night Mysteries: The Amphora Prisoner
177703.description:
User Summary

Portugal, 1972. Natalie, a young writer, misses the steam ship to America. She manages to find a place on board a cargo ship which is transporting olive oil and a collection of antiquities.

On her first night she is awoken by a strange noise and begins to explore the apparently deserted ship to find out what has happened to the crew.

177704.name: Basra
177704.description:
Basra is a fishing standard deck playing card game similar to Casino. The game plays with 2, 3 or 4 players. 4-player game are usually played in partnerships.

Each player is dealt four cards and four cards are played to the table making the "floor". Jacks and 7's of diamond from the floor are shuffled back into the deck and replaced. Players take turns playing one card to the floor and capturing cards if possible. When each player has played all four cards, the dealer deals out four more to each player, unless the deck is empty in which case the round is scored.

Captures can be made by playing a card of the same rank or a card that sums to two or more cards. Multiple captures are possible, for example a 10 would capture a 3, 7 and 10 from the floor. Queens and Kings do not have numerical value so the only way to capture them is by playing the same rank or a special card.

Players earn a Basra, worth 10 points, by capturing all the cards remaining on the floor . Players keep track of this by keeping the capturing card face up in their point pile. Jacks capture all cards on the floor, but do not count as a Basra. Jacks played on an empty floor capture nothing and remain on the floor. The seven of diamonds plays just like a jack except it earns a Basra if the captured cards add up to 10 or less. After the last card is played, remaining cards on the floor go to the player who made the last capture.

Scoring
The player (or team in partnerships) with the most cards receives 30 points. Ties are pushed to the next round (so 60 points could be earned).
Jacks and aces are worth 1 point.
The two of clubs is worth 2 points.
The ten of diamonds is worth 3 points.
Basra's are worth 10 points each.

A new hand is dealt unless someone has a total score of 101 in which case the player with the highest score wins. In case of a tie a new hand is played.

177705.description:
This expansion for ARCADE allows players to create larger maps.

Components:


Two 3x5 terrain tiles
One 1x5 terrain tile
9 'ice' squared walls
20 terrain destruction cards
VHS box


The terrain tiles are made of 3mm thick laser-cut acrylic (lines engraved). The walls are made of 8mm thick 'ice' acrylic.
177705.name: Arcade: Terrain pack

177706.name: Heileen 2
177706.description:
User Summary

The game continues from the desert island on which Heileen was stranded in the first game. The plot line is dominated by a tarot deck and the ideas of the Seven Deadly Sins and the Seven Cardinal Virtues. There are 15 endings this time and 20 quests within that.

177707.name: The Immortals
177707.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Extensive Mission for characters of levels 8-9, ready as stand-alone or for easy insertion into an existing campaign

Go under-cover and investigate the mysterious cult of the Immortals. Become one of the criminal underworld to discover the truth—a horrifying answer that will take you and your team beyond the very edge of known space!

Features:

An exciting mission that puts characters among hardened criminals, where they must keep their cover while investigating to discover what the cult knows about a dangerous alien race
Combat, dialogue, vehicle and starship encounters, plus hacking challenges
Face uniquely dangerous lifeforms while searching for the cult's hideout on planet Belorheron
Violate the law to stay under-cover and impress criminals
Design, build, and fly a customized starship
Face new situations and threats in space
Use your wits and skills to survive in a number of challenging scenarios
A fun mid to high-level mission that introduces an enemy that can easily become a looming threat in future missions
Lots of player handouts, including mission intel, ship cards, a shopping list for starship systems, and insurance information for a rented vehicle
Extra artwork, including an art piece by Corefun's newest artist, John Fell
For 8th to 9th level characters

177708.name: Elven Dervish
177708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call forth the howling warriors of the sands!

With the Elven Dervish, a new 11 level elven variant class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can play these devout elven warriors in just about any OSR game. Unlike their normal breathren, these elves are dedicated to faith and possess a small amount of skill with divine magic as well as using the blade and the arcane powers inherent in every elf. Includes two new spells!

177709.name: Elven Shadowmage
177709.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sing the song of darkness, and master the shadows!

With the Elven Shadowmage, a new 10 level elven variant class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can play these arcane shadoweavers in just about any OSR game. Elven shadowmages specialize in using the darkness to do their bidding, and can perform many of the tasks that a human thief would, only using their unique magic to do so. They also learn a small number of 'normal' magical spells along the way, and are often confused with elven nightblades as they function as scouts and infiltrators.

177710.name: Wild Elven Ranger
177710.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn the secretive ways of the wild elves!

With the Wild Elven Ranger, a new 13 level elven variant class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can play these mysterious elven race in just about any OSR game. This class introduces the wild elf, a slight twist on the normal elves in old school games, and presents a variant interpretation of the elven ranger class, with a greater emphasis on mystical abilities, like speakiing to animals and eventually gaining a totem animal. These elves are even more reclusive than their high elven breathren, but now you can peak into their world!

177711.name: Home Raiders
177711.description:
Home Raiders is a game played with small scale models. These models represent the combatants that travel from a dimension known as the Inner-space to your very home, in order to battle for the dominance of your space. These fighters are little folk (which means that the scale of the models is actually 1:1) which exist in dimensions parallel to ours, and crash our world in order to thrive in theirs.

The basic game is very easy to grasp, and is a great option for a fast game that takes place in your actual living room coffee table, your office desk, or even around your kitchen sink. It takes no time at all to set up, so you can get your dice rolling in a breeze. If you are an experienced gamer, Home Raiders is a great choice for an improvised gaming session or even a well laid out match amongst a bunch of friends. If you want to play with your younger brothers and sisters, cousins or even your children, you won't find a better option to getting them started with this amazing hobby.

177712.name: The Unsung Weave: GM's Full Background
177712.description:
From publisher blurb:

Accompanying the serialized adventure campaign for the Wyrd system and setting, The Unsung Weave can be found in Forever Folio, a digital PDF ezine released regularly by the Forever People indy games publishing company.

This file is a short but essential aide memoire and background spoiler for the GM only and reveals the bones of the campaign.

177713.description:
The Road is a post-apocalyptic survival card game set in the zombie-infested Australian outback.

It is a 3-5- player game which explores the social-dynamics of balancing group welfare against self-interest. You need to help each other in order to survive, but at the end of the day you must make ruthless decisions about who lives and dies.

As the name suggests, you are travelling down a road through the outback, attempting to reach the airfield which is your hope of escape. The game proceeds in a series of "days". Each day you choose the next location to explore, fight some zombies and scavenge for useful items. Each night you must decide who you can trust to stand guard while the others sleep.

As the days wear on, hunger and tiredness build, supplies run short, and you face a difficult decision: whether to remain loyal to the group, to run, or to turn on your fellow players (before they turn on you).
177713.name: The Road

177714.description:
The Archmage is dying... a successor must be found from the 4 schools of magic, so a contest is afoot. The Principal of the school with the most Prestige will be the next Archmage.

Each player controls 10 wizards of one of the 4 different schools (on the base game they would be fire, earth, water & air). In the beginning players start with 4 wizards and add more to their ranks as the game progresses.

Each turn players will have to choose different locations on the board that suits their strategies from gathering resources, to recuiting wizards & heroes, going into quests, creating potions and spells they can use later, and fighting in the terrible DARK TOWER.

Since this game is euro styled, all of this elements are somewhat abstract, so in order to go into a quest you place a wizard on one of the adventure cards and if you pay the resources needed and have all the requirements for the quest to be successful you win the card and any reward that is given.

Heroes are an important part of the wizard guild as they provide extra abilities to combat and enhance how the resources are gathered. They can go up levels (up to 4) and with each level they grant more to the school they work for. Up to 2 levels can be earn in the usual tavern brawls... but the other 2 must be gain in quests or challenging the DARK TOWER.

Archimago has several elements shared by traditional Eurostyle games that use worker placement but at the same time potions and spells provide and interaction with the other players that if mastered can be of a great assistance to the School, events change game conditions, Characters can appear and add a new location to go to, etc.

The base game comes also with 1 scenario that is made of a set of cards that are mixed with the adventure cards and that when are dealt change the conditions of the game or offer sudden opportunities for the players that have the resources to risk or the desire to count on fate for better possibilities.

The game is modular so it is highly expandable in several directions that will add to the system new possibilities and the feeling of adventure, starting with new scenarios that will make each game feel different, characters that will appear in the different locations to assist the players, events that will happen when creating potions and more sudden apparitions that will contribute greatly with the atmosphere of the world.

The game ends on 1 of 4 conditions:


The adventure cards spots cannot be filled.
2 or 3 lines of potions/spells are depleted.
Sometimes a Scenario Card will end the game when certain conditions are given.
When all the Dark Tower Cards are gone.


In the end Archmage is more than an eurogame, an experience that is worth trying. Each adventure card has been carefully designed so the title leads to the story below. Beyond the abstract elements there is a story going on in the game that those players that are fan of the detail will certainly love.

Spanish description:
El Archimago esta muriendo... un sucesor debe ser encontrado de entre las 4 escuelas de magia, asi que un concurso se realizara. El Rector de la escuela con mayor Prestigio sera el siguiente Archimago.
