177714.name: Archimago

177715.description:
Object: Capture the Joker. The first player to fly from Wayne Manor to the Joker's Flying Fortress wins.

Playing the Game: All players start a Wayne Manor. (green start square) The youngest player spins first and then moves his/her playing piece the number shown on the spinner. Play continues with the next player on the left. The first player to reach the Joker's Flying Fortress (red finish square) wins.

Flying: Players move in a straight line (left-right, up-down, diagonally) one direction per turn. Player may pass each other, but they cannot occupy the same space at the end of the turn. If a player lands on an occupied space, he/she must move one space less in another direction. Players CANNOT fly through buildings, they must fly OVER them.

The Spinner: The spinner is divided into six parts. The five numbered sections (2,3,4,5,6) show how many spaces a player can move during his/her turn. The Joker spinner section activates the "Plane Scrambler" forcing ALL PLAYERS to land on the building space directly below. Player resumes when the next player spins.
177715.name: Batman: The Joker Air Race Game

177716.name: Naturalogica
177716.description: (Summarized from back cover.) Bestiary containing new creatures, special rules for large creature combat, templates for large animals, a new skill (Fur Trapper), adventure seeds, and a conversion chart to use Naturalogica in other systems.

177717.name: Military Races
177717.description:
(Paraphrase from back cover.) Seven additional races, which had been created for use in warfare in the Third Cycle, and which now have their own nations or live on the fringes of human society. Also includes an adventure seed for each race, adds the wrestling skill, and expands the artillery skill with descriptions of various siege devices.

Also includes some errata for the original core book.

177718.name: Séance
177718.description:
JOIN THE CIRCLE:
During the mid-nineteenth century, spiritualism became increasingly popular. Mediums would gather a group of believers for a séance as they attempted to contact the spirits of their dearly departed relatives. Now it’s time for you to create your own circle around the table as you attempt to contact these wispy spirits.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:
Play cards onto the séance circle to “make contact” with Spirits – contact your spirit by matching its incantation or steal another player's spirit by spelling out the word “Séance”. Use special chain cards to "lock" incantation cards in place or scare the other players silly with game-changing "fright" cards. Collect Spirit cards for points.

CONTACTING SPIRITS
There are two ways you can contact spirits:
Capture your spirit by matching the Spirit’s incantation
Steal another player's spirit by spelling the word Séance

HOW TO WIN: The player who captures 3 spirits wins. For a more challenging game, collect 13 points of Spirit cards to win.

VARIANT PLAY
For a more challenging game, discard one Séance card from your hand to use its unique ability

S – Steal a random Séance card from any player's hand.
é – Expel any player's Spirit from the circle and replace it with a new card from the Spirit deck.
A – Alter the circle by discarding a Séance card and replacing it with a new card from the Séance deck.
N – No - Chosen player gets one less action on their next turn.
C – Change a Seance card on the circle with another Seance card on the circle.
E – Exchange your hand with another player’s hand.

177719.name: Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor – Lord of The Hunt
videogameseries: J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings
videogamecompilation: Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor – Game of the Year Edition
177719.description:
User Summary

Lord of The Hunt adds a large new story, area, and enemies.

177720.name: Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor – Game of the Year Edition
videogameseries: J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings
videogamecompilation: Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor – Lord of The Hunt
Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor – The Bright Lord
177720.description:
User Summary

The Game of the Year Edition contains both the Lord of The Hunt and The Bright Lord story Packs as well as the Dark Ranger, Captain of the Watch, Lord of the Hunt, The Bright Lord, Power of Shadow and Lithariel Skins.It has Guardians of the Flaming Eye, The Berserks and The Skull Crushers Warband Missions, new Challenge Modes and runes and a new photo feature.

177721.name: Golem Academy
177721.description:
The goal is simple. Choose 1 of 4 unique characters, each with his or her own Golem companion, and beat the ever-loving bejesus out of your friends. The last player left with any bejesus being the winner!

Each character’s arsenal will include the following card types to help them achieve victory: Combat, Combo, Reflex, and Fusion cards. Most of the damage you’ll deal will be in the form of Combat and Combo cards.

177722.name: Disneyspin
177722.description:
Each player chooses a Disney character He puts the character’s picture in front of him and pushes out all the pieces; eyes, gloves, pants, shoes, hat and jacket.
Players take turns to flick the Spinner round the Disney Circle. If the pointer comes to rest on a jacket, the player places the jacket on his character. If it comes to rest on a shoe, he puts one shoe on his character and so on. If the character already has the item on which the pointer has come to rest, the player doesn't score that time round. If the pointer comes to rest on a star the player may choose any one item and put it in position. The first player to complete dressing his character wins the game.

177725.description:
Description from the publisher:

Submarines and surface fleets battle for dominance of the seas! One team must use submarines to sneak troops into enemy ports and destroy vital strategic targets, while the other team deploys a surface fleet to hunt down the subs and protect their crucial supply lines.

Designed by retired Royal Navy Officer and submarine commander Andrew Benford, and developed deep beneath the waves, They Come Unseen is an asymmetrical strategy game of bluffing and deception that uses two boards: one for action on the surface, seen by both players, and one for movement underwater, seen only by the submarine commanders. The game also comes with specially designed control panels to aid each player in tracking vital information such as fuel, ammunition and current cruising depth.
177725.name: They Come Unseen
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 012 – Essen 2015 Highlights Show
Ep 016 – BGG Con 2015 Recap Extravaganza!!
Episode 105 Gen Con 2015 Preview top 11 to Try and Buy with W Eric Martin

177726.name: RALLYE PAŘÍŽ-DAKAR
177726.description:
All around him, as far as you can look, you see huge sand dunes and arid country with only here and there as if randomly strewn around rocks and scrubby bushes. From the clear blue sky of September and burning sun,shadows here and there is a unbearably hot. But you do not have time to devote to watching these natural phenomena, because You must quickly navigate the terrain and to keep in mind only one thing: to be first in line! As it has many times proved Karel Loprais and his Tatra. Take care not to straying or not fit in the sand and go forward as quickly as possible.

Players throw the dice and move their pieces around the board. Along the way they must cope with fields having different kinds of effects (malfunction, ford ...). Crowned the winner is the player who first reach the finish with everyone figures.

177727.description:
In the two-player-game Haus der Sonne, players are building statues on the slopes of a volcano to honor their gods. The higher the statues are built up the volcano the more they score in one of the two scoring phases, but of course the closer they are build towards the crater the danger of being destroyed by volcanic eruption is higher as well.

By playing numbered chips (1-5) to the beach, you move a ship clockwise. The sector in which the ship is moved will be evaluated. If a player has placed a numbered chip into this sector, he may gain a card from this sector. Cards are required to build statues, buy bonus score cards or to influence the direction of the lava when the volcano finally errupts (two times in the game - right before an evaluation).
177727.name: Haleakala
boardgameexpansion: Haus Der Sonne: Lava Tiles Mini Expansion

177728.name: Carcassonne: We Go to Carcassonne
177728.description:
Каркассон: Мы идем в Каркассон ("We go to Carcassonne") is a little expansion (2 tiles) for Carcassonne, made by the Russian editor of the Carcassonne game and was a present for the participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league 2013, 2014 and also for 2015.

One tile represents the house of Baba Yaga the Witch, from a Russian folktale. The second tile represents Bogatyr, a Russian hero, at a crossroads.

The Baba Yaga tile scores as an anti-cloisters: 1 point for the tile and 1 point for each tile missing around the tile, for a maximum of 8 points.

No special rules for the Bogatyr tile.

The text on the stone on the Bogatyr tile is:
If you go to the left - you'll find death.
If you go to the right - you'll lose your horse.
If you go straight - you'll live, but will forget who you are [or forget yourself].

177729.name: Permia - Duels
177729.description:
User Summary

Permia – Duels is fast paced online collectible card game for people who value games that require thinking, but still want to keep the games under 5 minutes. Players duel by flipping each other's units to gain control of the battleground. Changing battlegrounds, unit development and special powers mean that games are always different and interesting. The prehistoric world of Permia is populated by strange creatures, unique peoples and full of engaging stories.

177730.name: Unlimited Adventures
177730.description:
Join a brave party of adventurers in search of treasures and fame! Explore consecutively three dungeons filled with wandering monsters, traps and treasure, and survive to get the honor and glory.

Unlimited Adventures is a dungeon delve for 1-3 players and 20-30 minutes long, with a great deal of planning, bluffing and memory.

In Unlimited Aventures, each player takes the role of a different adventurer. You'll need to work together to survive until consecutively three dungeons, but only one of you will make it out with the enough treasure and win the game! The dungeons are different each time you play, offering new surprises as you collect treasure, trigger abilities, and fight off horrible wandering monsters!

It is a game where you have to be able to plan your incursion into the Dungeon optimally to avoid ending up dead or vilified by your opponent.

Unlimited Adventures can also be played as a solitaire game.

PnP (spanish):
http://labsk.net/wkr/archives/16251/
http://labsk.net/index.php?topic=150531.0

177731.name: 6 Little Postmen
177731.description:
A funny game that helps children to understand the job of post office men, and the different kinds of letters, parcels etc.

The game is played with 2-6 players. At the start of the game you receive some cards which represent the letters and parcels. The number of the cards depends on the number of players. Then you have to roll the dice and move in the board, in the direction which is the fastest and more convenient for you to deliver the letters. But some times you may land on "best" spots, which might not be the best for you! The winner of the game is whoever delivers all that he's got and get back to the post office first!

177732.name: Wasteland 2010
rpgseries: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Series Book
177732.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 series book by Cynthia Celeste Miller, a group of bold adventurers travels across a dangerous post-apocalyptic landscape, carrying out missions for the Utopian League, an organization of scientists, civic leaders and scholars who seeks to rebuilt society. Can the heroes make a difference in a world filled with sorcery, strange civilizations, mutated creatures and other hazards?

This 24-page PDF contains:

The backstory of how this fictitious series came to be
Information about the setting, including its technology, magic, interesting locals and more
“Did You Know?” sidebars that offer insider information about the series
4 episode seeds to get your group into the action
Guidelines for creating your own Player Characters
Exhaustive table for rolling your own mutations (with 72 different results)
4 ready-to-use Player Characters
6 allies
6 villains
5 types of villainous Goons
6 critters of the wastelands
2 Playsets
Numerous illustrations that bring the series to life

177733.name: Star Temple of Saturgalia
177733.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your team have been sent, or forced to go, to the Star Temple of Saturgalia. There you hope to find the fabled Star Amulet that may turn the tide in the Space War. Ignite your Star Saber, strap on your blaster, and prepare to avoid the Imperial Customs - you're going on an adventure. Prepare to enjoy a couple of hours of FUN!!!

An adventure crafted for OSR games, and is compatible with Sword and Wizardry and White Star.

177734.name: Pathfinder Chronicler
177734.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the prestige class Pathfinder Chronicler, those adventures who explore the world for truth, knowledge, treasures and more.

The feats inside this volume:

Deeper Pockets - The Deep Pockets ability is more effective
Greater Aid - Aiding others grants a larger bonus
Inspirational Combat - Improve your allies minimum damage
Inspirational Effectiveness - Improve your or another effective level
Improved Bardic Performance - Bardic Abilities based on levels are better
Improved Pathfinding - Survival checks are improved
Longer Life - Certain saving throws have an improved chance of success

177735.name: Recluse
177735.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes what your campaign needs is a hero of legend, who everyone recognizes, even though they've never met him before.

Recluse (PL 10) is a young, idealistic hero granted the powers of the spider, which are great when facing a villain, and of no use whatsoever when dealing with every other aspect of life.

boardgamepublisher: テンデイズゲームズ (Ten Days Games)
boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
177736.description:
Using the central board in A Feast for Odin, players have to hunt, gather basic materials, refine those materials, develop their production-buildings, build/buy ships, and raid settlements.

The resulting earnings are placed on the players' board in the best possible pattern to produce income and (later) victory points.
177736.name: A Feast for Odin
boardgameaccessory: A Feast for Odin: Painted Elk
boardgamepodcastepisode: #33: Captain Sonar on tap; Extra Life & MACE gaming weekends
#36: 2016, A Year in Review
#40: A Feast for Odin six-pack; Burger Up on tap; New York Slice & More
1p 121 - Odin Games (A Feast For Odin)
22 Devon Dice podcast Another VAST episode controlled by Turtles and Mechs
A Feast for Odin Review
Ep 042 – Essen Spiel 2016 Preview
Episode 100 -- Just Doin' What We Do
Episode 14 - Gaming Like it's 1999
Episode 32 - The Essen Games We Have to Have
Episode 33 - Discussing Area Control/Majority with Two Players
Episode 36 :: Essen 2016 Preview + Stephanie Straw Interview
Episode 37 - Our 2016 Enthusiastic Seals of Approval!
Episode 39 :: Islebound Review + Questions with Cat and the Hat
Episode 89- Great Western Trail and 2017 Predictions/Resolutions
Episode 99 -- Between a Box and a Nearby Wall
Heavy Cardboard Episode 59 – December (2016) Briefing
HLG 7: Op de foto
I postumi di Spiel 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #12
Low Player Count - Ep 23 - Game Weight
MN 0140 Hot Games and News from BGG.Con 2016
RDTN Episode 106: Great Western Trail, A Feast for Odin, and a conversation with FunAgain about Essen
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 73 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 3
THE GAME PIT: EPISODE 81 - PICKING OVER THE BONES
The Good The Board and The Guy Who Can’t Come Up With Something Witty: Episode 89 “Licensed Games”
The Good The Board and The Man Who Hates All Of It: Episode 96 “Joe’s Top 10 of 2016″
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 78!!

177737.name: Planetouched Feats III
177737.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planetouched Feats III brings you 9 mythic feats for your planetouched paragons of glorious good with their angelic ancestry: aasimars! Unleash your celestial power with feats from Channel Force to Angelic Flesh and Metallic Wings to Heavenly Radiance!

177738.name: "J" is for "Justice"
177738.description:
From publisher blurb:

Law & Order

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at the role of the legal system in superhero adventures, including:

Superheroes and the Law
Gathering Evidence
Arrests
Legal Identities
Trials (including "Heroes on Trial")
Prisons

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
177739.description:
Imperial Settlers: Atlanteans, an expansion that requires the base game to play, adds the option for playing Imperial Settlers with up to five players. The expansion includes a new faction board, the Atlanteans faction deck, technology tokens, and expansion cards for the original factions that complement the Atlanteans abilities.

The Atlanteans bring a new resource to the world of Imperial Settlers with technology that can unlock special abilities on faction cards and transform common buildings into powerful allies. The Atlanteans must use their abilities to find unique ways to score because their faction buildings sink at the end of the game and do not score points! While the other factions do not have the knowledge to use the technology of the Atlanteans, some buildings for each faction allow them to use some of that technology to their advantage.
177739.name: Imperial Settlers: Atlanteans
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 86 - Our Second Birthday!
Episode 15 - Our 2015 Enthusiastic Seals of Approval!
Episode 4: Imperial Settlers & Underrated Games
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 9

177740.name: The Opportunist (New Base Class)
177740.description:
From publisher blurb:

This special May issue presents a new base class, the Opportunist. Focusing on the more finesseable combat maneuvers including disarm, feint, steal, and trip the Opportunist is nearly as skillful as the rogue while gaining access to a special opportunity pool which empowers many of his class abilities. This issue also introduces the Armor Cutting combat maneuver and several new feats for use with the opportunist class but available to others as well.

177741.name: Old School Samurai (New Samurai Archetype)
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
177741.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new samurai archetype based on the old school samurai. This archetype is built on the abilities of the original samurai class found in the grand father of fantasy RPGs. The old school samurai is the masster of katana and wakizashi, horse, and arts.

177742.name: Wardenhale Docks
177742.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Wardenhale, the city with a thousand names. City of Shadows. CIty of Trade, City of Justice. Wardenhale is like every city, and yet like no other"

Wardenhale Docks is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Wardenhale Docks is a geomorphic set, comprising 11 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. The set features 6 unique tiles; 5 of which are also provided with an alternate version showing the tide out.

The Mermaid's Tale: A small dockside tavern, serving grog to crews that have shoreleave.
Dock Corner: A small section of dockside, strewn with cargo
Dockside Warehouses: Two warehouses situated beside the water, used for storing cargo
Dockside Pier: A short pier that reaches into the water, and steps down to the water
Harbour Master Office: Situated at the end of a long pier, the Harbour Master watches who enters the harbour.




The set can be used on it's own, or joined with any of the Wardenhale range to make a huge and diverse city.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and non-gridded versions. (n.b. gridless version only available as full jpeg)

177743.name: Encounter Decks 1
177743.description:
From publisher blurb:

What would happen if you crossed the Book of Lairs (single page mini-adventures) with cards? Encounter Decks. (Deck one features black & white maps, but all the content is different from deck two.)

Each of the 54 encounter cards helps you build a dynamic mini-adventure! Draw a card for an adventure outline. The outline includes backstory, ways to get the PCs involved, several encounter ideas, and two suggestions to wrap up or follow up.

Draw other card(s) for a map. If it doesn't fit the story, draw another. Maps are buildings, dungeons, caves, or wilderness. Some maps are designed to connect to others and can also connect to DungeonMorph Cards.Draw other cards for trap ideas or plot twists as needed.
If you don't like the suggestion on the card you pick, draw another.
Tired of giving out another 100 copper pieces? When the situation arises, look for the "Trivial? Treasure" suggested on a card.




Encounter Decks are perfect for stocking a hex crawl or developing a side trek on the fly!

177744.name: Encounter Decks 2
177744.description:
From publisher blurb:

What would happen if you crossed the Book of Lairs (single page mini-adventures) with cards? Encounter Decks. (Deck two features color maps, but all the content is different from deck one.)

Each of the 54 encounter cards helps you build a dynamic mini-adventure! Draw a card for an adventure outline. The outline includes backstory, ways to get the PCs involved, several encounter ideas, and two suggestions to wrap up or follow up.

Draw other card(s) for a map. If it doesn't fit the story, draw another. Maps are buildings, dungeons, caves, or wilderness. Some maps are designed to connect to others and can also connect to DungeonMorph Cards.Draw other cards for trap ideas or plot twists as needed.
If you don't like the suggestion on the card you pick, draw another.
Tired of giving out another 100 copper pieces? When the situation arises, look for the "Trivial? Treasure" suggested on a card.




Encounter Decks are perfect for stocking a hex crawl or developing a side trek on the fly!

177745.name: Alarmstufe 6
177745.description:
The title refers to a 'level' of an alarm. Level 1 might be helping a cat down a tree but Level 6 might be a massive fire at a chemicals factory.

The board is a track of 60 spaces and, in that regard, it is a 'Goose-Type' game. Throw the die and move along the track and if you land on a space with instructions, you must obey those instructions. It has a few differences to common games of this type. Some spaces 'attract' other players' pieces to come to help you with an Alarm. This in effect means that other people will be helped forward if they are behind or brought back if they are in front. First to get to space 60, wins.

The playing pieces are small metallic fire-engines.

177746.name: Breachworld Breach Creature Folio #2: Fly Catcher
177746.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fly Catcher is another dinosaur that finds itself on Breachworld, and a unique one at that. Representing a failed evolutionary branch on prehistoric Earth, this winged creature now flourishes across the Civilized Lands both in the wild, and as a valued addition to many communities.

This mini-expansion for the Breachworld RPG, includes avenues for adventure beyond the simple addition to the bestiary.

Included in this supplement:

The Fly Catcher, described and illustrated, with full game stats
New Hot Zone Environments to dazzle or threaten your players
A new twist on a familiar Epic Perk
A new NPC to serve as an ally or enemy, complete with beginning, advanced, and elite stats
Six new adventure hooks

177747.name: Mata Hari
177747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon Games is happy to make your life a bit more horrible…

Margaretha Geertruida Zelle MacLeod is an exotic dancer famous throughout Western Europe. For the past six years, she has gained great acclaim under the stage name, Mata Hari. She performs in “authentic” Eastern costumes that are both ornately decorated and extremely revealing. Her routines combine exotic eastern dances she learned in the Dutch East Indies with her own individual style. Her popularity stems from both the European fascination with all things oriental and her willingness to shed off clothing on stage.

In Winter of 1911, Mata Hari is performing in La Scala Theatre in Milan, Italy. There she captured the eye of a certain Prince Carlo and was invited to do a private rendition of Salome in his manor. Upon her return, she complained of general malaise and was soon too ill to continue performing.

Adventure Summary

Mata Hari's booking agent, Gabriel Astruc, alarmed at the possible breach of contract with La Scala and disturbed by the nature of Mata Hari's illness, contacts the hunters to look into the matter. The party soon learns that Prince Carlo is a vampire who has become obsessed with the famous dancer. He is also intrigued by the fact that Mata Hari's social circle includes several highly placed military officers, politicians and industrialists. He has thus decided to convert Mata Hari into a vampire under his control. Though her, he intends to extend his influence throughout Europe.

177748.name: Infinite Threats 02
177748.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a few alien critters to kill off in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with blasting droids and robots? Well Avalon has just the thing, new threats to encounter. Each threat is a fully detailed creature, usable in any game you want or as part of the Fringe setting.

Explore the danger of space with new threat expansions, so keep your eye out for new releases and expansion for the Infinite Futures system.

Inside you will find fully detailed stats and information on…

The Bloodmingler, a deep space pets
The alien Headsnapper, a real nasty beast
The Iberion Hellhounds, an illegal pet you don’t want to be around
The Horned Drake, a snake like beats
The Render’s Beetle, a huge bug

177749.name: How to Game Master like a F****** Boss
177749.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the accumulatd wealth of my 30 years playing, designing, and (most importantly) Game Mastering paper & pencil roleplaying games. I wrote a book that I would want to read, something I could refer back to again and again. Not every suggestion or recommendation is worth its weight in gold, nor will they be to everyone's taste. However, I believe there's enough personal wisdom shared to change the way you run games forever... if you want to start Game Mastering like a boss, that is.

Readers will get the most use out of this book if they're running or intend to run fantasy RPGs. Nevertheless, almost half this volume is genre-neutral and should be applicable to science fiction, horror, super heroes, etc. It's full of general advice on running games, specific elements that should be included, lots of tables for cultists, monsters, magic items, etc., and a brutal-sounding, sorcerous language you may borrow from whenever you need something suitably arcane or foreign.

To wrestle with the dragon and win... that is what I shall teach you! This book is a door to a parallel world of Game Mastery, a world where Venger Satanis whispers strange and frightening things into your ear... AND YOU HAVE NO CHOICE BUT TO LISTEN!!!

If you enjoy this book, you'll probably get a kick out of my others: Liberation of the Demon Slayer, The Islands of Purple-Haunted Putrescence, and Revelry in Torth. Eventually, Crimson Dragon Slayer will be added to that illustrious roster. Thanks for taking a chance on this old demon and his eldritch scribblings.

177750.description:
A 3-card game of hilarious feline deduction

Wild Cats is a social game for 3 players. Players are one of three cats riding in a police car back from an arrest. There’s a Good Cat, Bad Cat and a Wildcat. A scuffle ensues and someone is getting thrown out of the car. The Good Cat wants the Bad Cat out because he’s annoying. The Bad Cat wants the Good Cat out because he wants all of the credit. The Wildcat just wants to get out.

Deal out the 3 cards randomly and follow the rules on the cards. Do whatever! Interrogate your opponents. Grill them (not literally). Maybe you'll make bold statements that coincide with your role? There is so much room for exploration, but remember to follow the rules on your card and don't look at your opponents' cards.

As the Good Cat, you need to suss out the Bad Cat and get the Wildcat to also vote for the Bad Cat. If you're the Bad Cat you want the opposite. But if you are the Wildcat, you need to get someone to vote for you, and figure out exactly who it is to create the three way tie.

When you are ready to vote, count to 3 and point at the player that you want out. The player with the majority of the votes is eliminated. Reveal your cards to see who won!

The deluxe editions contain 3 additional roles to allow for up to 6 players.
177750.name: Wild Cats
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 51!!! ft Patrick Hillier, AnnaBeth and Kerensa

177751.name: Random Encounter: Plains of the Troll King
177751.description:
Random Encounter is a strategic, number-based, pixel-art card game for all ages. Players build encounters made up of various creatures, then try to win as many battles as possible at the table in the pursuit of loot! Each fully customizable deck is made up of basic number creature cards along with several trick creature cards to throw your opponents off guard. Two or more players compete to reach five loot before other players by either winning the most battles or stealing loot from the coffers of their fallen enemies.

The game and pixel art is being created by Jamie Keddie (creator of Jackpot! and artist on Minecraft: Console Editions) of Joyride Games who has extensive experience with both card and video games design. Random Encounter combines these things in a new, fun, package for everyone to enjoy!

The game also contains a one-player adventure mode in which the player tries to find keys so that they can open a boss room and defeat the final encounter.

177752.description:
This first expansion for Hero's Journey Home - Gods of Man and More - adds more Quests, Quest Items, spells, enemies, and items along with all new gods and race options.

Now when you choose a Hero for your party you receive their patron god who provides additional abilities. Choose to pray, smite, or utilize the special ability specific to the god like you would any other ability.

Additionally, when you assemble your party in the setup phase, you can opt to spend some of your starting papergold on assigning a race to your adventurers. Choose from Elf, Dwarf, Gnome, Half-Orc, or Halfing; each race has their own special ability to add another layer of customization to your team.

This set contains 72 cards, featuring 45 unique illustrations, along with the rulebook.
177752.name: Hero's Journey Home: Gods of Man and More

177753.description:
The Footlocker is stuffed full of all kinds of Warfighter goodness: extra cards (including some revised cards from both the core game and from Expansions 1, 2, and 3, featuring new traits and rules), more counters, a scenario book, and version 2 of the rulebook, to add to your copy Warfighter.

The Footlocker introduces night combat and mini-missions to Warfighter.
177753.name: Warfighter Expansion #9: The Footlocker
boardgameexpansion: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

177754.name: Warriors of the Red Planet: Rules for Fantastic Adventures Set on Other Planets
177754.description:
A roleplaying game in the tradition of classic 70's style RPG's also known as OSR. Warriors of the Red Planet captures the "Sword and Planet" genre of science fantasy romance, inspired by the works of Burroughs, Vance, Moorcock, Kline, Norman and others.

This beta edition is well edited and playtested, and it is a very compelling and fun read full of great ideas that will inspire your imagination.

177755.name: Devils in the Details
177755.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 16 party!

Rivermarch Keep use to be a place of law and progress - the meeting grounds for the prestigious Iron Conclave. That all changed when the members of the Iron Conclave mysteriously disappeared the night of their 144th meeting. No ranger could track them, nor oracle divine them, and their disappearance has been a mystery for two decades now.

As it stands, the region is on the verge of war. Each noble house blames another for the disappearance of the lords that comprised the Iron Conclave. The PCs need to explore Rivermarch Keep for clues to discover what caused the lords to vanish that fateful night, and keep peace in the region!

Devils in the Details includes PLAYER SAFE MAPS - maps you can show your players for each encounter area that does not reveal important details like the locations of traps, treasure, or hostile creatures.

177756.name: The Space Monkey Player Character
177756.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Space Money Player Character is a challenging roleplaying option for players looking for something a bit different to play. Written to be compatible with White Star but it should be an enjoyable class in other OSR compatible games.

177757.name: ARK: Survival Evolved
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Early Access Game of the Year Winner
2015 Global Game Awards Best Survival Game of the Year Winner
2015 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2015 PAX Curse Award Best in Show Winner
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Early Access Game of the Year Winner
2016 Global Game Awards Best Survival Game of the Year Winner
2016 Golden Joystick Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2016 PAX Curse Award Best Booth Winner
2016 Steam Awards Best Use Of A Farm Animal Nominee
177757.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Ark is a sandbox survival game with dinosaurs. You begin as a man or woman stranded naked and starving on the shores of an island in an area called the ARK. Dinosaurs roam the land and you must use skill and cunning to kill or tame the dinosaurs and other primeval creatures with which you share the island. Begin by crafting stone tools for yourself, learn to create a shelter, and gather food. As you gain experience in survival, you will be able to craft better tools and weapons, better shelter, and prepare heartier food. Form a tribe with other survivors to gain experience together, build a common shelter, tame herds of animals, and possible raid other tribes.

177758.name: HAM-TEL
177758.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a HAM-TEL, a Heavy Artillery Missile - Tractor Erector Launcher vehicle.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as illustrations.

177759.name: The Spell Book of the Gremlins
177759.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a gamemaster supplement intended for Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls (although it will work with any version of the rules). Ken St Andre has decided that each of the kindred (Dwarves, Elves, Fairies, Trolls, etc) should have its own spell book, and this is the one for the Gremlins. Gremlin magic is all about naughty thrills and supernatural spite. It can grow warts on your tongue, rot your dinner, and give your favorite milch-goat bad ideas! Gremlin magic isn't evil, but it is BAD, very bad.

177760.name: Save the Day: Test Drive
177760.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is designed as a quick play introduction to Save the Day, a super role playing game. Including four sample characters that just can't seem to get along and a rollicking adventure that involves robots, science, fine art and crowd control. This is a sample playtest product designed teach you the basics of Save the Day in no time. Kid friendly and quick to play, Save the Day is also compatible with Darkfast Dungeons. You can have your superhero battling legions of goblins in no time.

177761.name: Save the Day: Ninja Clan Glitter
177761.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is designed as a quick play introduction to Save the Day, a super role playing game. Including three sample villains and an adventure designed to test the limits of what makes a hero a hero. This is a sample playtest product designed teach you the basics of Save the Day in no time. Kid friendly and quick to play, Save the Day is also compatible with Darkfast Dungeons. You can have your superhero battling legions of goblins in no time.

177762.name: Star Wars: Return of the Jedi: Ewok Adventure
177762.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Although it was completed, the game was never released for sale, as the marketing department of Parker Brothers considered the controls too difficult to master. A prototype cartridge surfaced in 1997. Only one physical copy of Ewok Adventure is currently known to exist. Because the game's controls were more complex than has been the norm on console games at the time, Parker Brothers persuaded designer Larry Gelberg to change the controls to a more common 8-direction lay-out. However, Geldberg was convinced of the abilities of the players and Parker Brothers shot the project down. Larry Geldberg gave the only known prototype of the game to his son in 1997, who later sold the game for $1,680.

In Ewok Adventure, the player takes the role of an Ewok in the hang glider corps with the mission to destroy a shield generator of the Imperial army. The player can control a hang glider with the joystick and has to evade enemies. Depending on the game mode, the player can either make the hang glider climb and decent by pulling back and forth the joystick, or he can reverse the vertical directions. Hitting the ground results in a game over, but when flying high, one can fly over enemies. The height of the glider is displayed by the location of the shadow of the ship. Furthermore, the player can pick up rocks to drop on enemies when flying over them.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars: Return of the Jedi: Ewok Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

177763.name: Metroid Dread
177763.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Metroid Dread was to be the next entry in the Metroid series of video games and a sequel to the 2002 Game Boy Advance title Metroid Fusion. In May 2010, Craig Harris confirmed that the story for Metroid Dread was fully written and that he had seen it. He claimed that Nintendo was able to "bring it back at any time." Metroid Dread is the only game on the internal software list that has not yet been released.

Source: Wikipedia, "Metroid Dread", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

177764.name: Loaded Up & Truckin'
177764.description:
All across America trucks rumble across the interstate carrying products from manufacturers to retailers. As a small start-up company with a truck, an office and a dream you are throwing you hat into the ring to challenge the big boys. The freight has to be moved and there is competition for who can get to loads first and who can make the most profitable routes. But watch out, Smokey is on the prowl. So put the hammer down and let it all hang out. You have to get loaded up & truckin’.

As a player, you represent a small but growing trucking company seeking to pick up and deliver goods in the most efficient manner possible. Amassing money is one way to achieve victory, but there are other ways to score as well. It is important to dominate a region or two with the most deliveries while not ignoring the other regions. In the end, your deliveries will be compared to the other players to determine which company has the best overall presence in the US.

Players gain presence by moving their trucks from city to city across the United States picking up and dropping off deliveries along the way. You can specialize in high profit cross-country runs or you can make numerous short routes. On each turn the vagaries of the business will be determined by a deck of event cards. Each player will then get to buy new hubs and trucks before setting out to scoop up goods before a rival comes along and 'steals' the load.

177765.name: Metroid 3DS
177765.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

In a short 30-second prototype video, Samus ran through a series of corridors until finally getting into a boss fight with a monster that very closely resembled Kraid. The project reportedly had a slightly different art style than usual and Samus was depicted as more thin and athletic. The mystery studio pitched its concept to Nintendo, but it was shot down as Nintendo didn't want to take the series in a 2.5D direction at the time.

177766.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 113 - Jul 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Legions: The Future of Miniatures Gaming
Cooperation and Competition: An Introduction to Comuni
Get Schooled at the Jedi Academy
World of Darkness: The Golden Watch

From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177767.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 111 - May 2009)
rpgissuearticle: A Game of Thrones LCG: Kings of the Sea Expansion
Wings of War: Fire from the Sky
World of Darkness: Immortals — House of Avalon
177767.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177768.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 112 - Jun 2009)
rpgissuearticle: A Strategy Guide to Roman Taxi
Countdown to the Pathfinder RPG: 3.5 Thrives!
Night Horrors: The Wicked Dead — Dampyr
Space Alert from Rio Grande Games
177768.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177769.name: The Little Big Game of Word Maven
177769.description:
The Little Big Game of Word Maven consists of 6 letter dice, a dice cup, paper money and a sand timer. One die is a vowel die, with a e i o u and an 8-ball on the faces. Five dice have a mix of consonants, vowels and wild sides. Players roll the vowel die to determine who goes first. Each player receives starting money from the bank and a Jackpot Fund is started.
On their turn each player rolls all 6 dice. The goal is to make the longest word possible with the letters on the face of the dice. The player may roll up to 3 times per turn, but must keep at least one die per roll. The first roll is free; money must be paid to the Jackpot Fund for each extra roll. If the 8-ball face is rolled the player's turn is immediately over. Each turn must be finished before the timer runs out.

Scoring is based on the length of the word the player makes. Longer words pay more money. The Jackpot is won when a player makes a 6 letter word without using any wild sides. The winner is the player who has the most money at the end of a predetermined time, or the player who reaches a predetermined amount of money first. Additionally, each die has an orange letter on one face that spells the word “MAVENS”. Spelling MAVENS instantly wins the game.

177770.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 114 - Aug 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Legions: The Powers Are In Your Hands
Geist: The Sin-Eaters — One Foot in the Grave
Killer Bunnies and the Journey to Jupiter
Warhammer: Chaos in the Old World
177770.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177771.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 115 - Sep 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Exalted: The Compass of Terrestrial Directions Volume 5 – The North
Grind: The Full Metal Battle Sport
Killer Bunnies Weapons List & Vengeance Chart
Warhammer: Invasion The Living Card Game
Wits & Wagers from North Star Games
177771.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177772.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 116 - Oct 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Chaos in the Old World from Fantasy Flight Games
World War IV: One World, One King from Ziggurat Games
177772.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177773.description:
A 2-4 player board game that combines elements of Tower Defense and Dice Rolling to see who rules the seven seas. The name of the game is eliminating your opponents and getting the most loot as possible while in the process of taking over the Caribbean. You will sail throughout the board, discovering treasure, obtaining island defenses, and trying to survive a War on Piracy--all while avoiding the dreaded Curse of Neptune.

Each player is dealt a Pirate Captain and a Ship--which will give you a total hit point value for the game. Avoid the cannons, find the treasure, defeat your opponents.
177773.name: Pyrates: Curse of Neptune

177774.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 117 - Nov 2009)
rpgissuearticle: How To Host A Murder Kills the Competition!
Sherwood Forest from Rio Grande Games
Small World from Days of Wonder
Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay: The Adventurer’s Toolkit
177774.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177775.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 118 - Dec 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Marvel and Upper Deck: Get Ready to Blastoff!
177775.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177776.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 119 - Jan 2010)
rpgissuearticle: The Army Painter: Get More Time For Gaming!
Warhammer: Invasion TCG — The Corruption Cycle
177776.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177777.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 120 - Feb 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Judge Dredd: Mega-City One Archives Volume 2 – Lawbringer
177777.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177778.name: Werewolf: The Forsaken Second Edition
177778.description:
From the product description:

"The need to hunt burns in your heart and in your soul. To chase down prey with your blood pumping fire through your body. Yesterday you didn’t know what that felt like, but today you’re sitting in a room with the bodies of your family and you need to hunt.

You are a human, a wolf, a killer, a monster. The ultimate predator.

You must hold the balance between the moon and the wolf. Between the flesh and the spirit. Between the pack and the prey. Your blood rises. The wolf must hunt.

What are you going to do?

You are a hunter now, one of the Uratha who inherit the blessings of Moon and Wolf. You conduct your sacred hunts in the shadows of the ordinary world, trying to maintain the boundaries. Driven by the need to hunt, you must keep the forces that would sway you in harmony rather than giving in to your instincts.

But the hunt isn’t easy. Your werewolves think they can hunt any prey, but they now face the return of the idigam — incomprehensible spirits of things that never existed, imprisoned at the dawn of time. Now they’re back, and they want to kill their jailers.

They hate you, and they’re coming for you. Time to show them that your senses — and your teeth — are as sharp as ever.

This book contains:

- The complete guide to playing a werewolf in the World of Darkness.
- Reimagined tribes, auspices, and spirit magic to create the ultimate predator and her pack.
- A brand new look at werewolf hunting grounds around the world, from Basra to Tokyo.
- Rules for the werewolves’ prey, and five examples of the idigam."

177779.name: Into the Red
177779.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 3.5/Pathfinder compatible adventure for four to six PCs of levels 7 - 8

Following the clues gained from ancient elven writings, the group journeys ever onward to the inhospitable Scorched Lands in search of the Fist of Heaven, a powerful artifact. Once there, they must brave the Tower of Mek'Madius the Sun Lich. Will the party find the ancient elven artifact or meet their doom in the fiery desert? One thing is certain, only the most enduring and steadfast adventurers will survive the blazing hot wastes of the Scorched Lands to tell the story.

Prepare for the adventure of your life and delve "Into the Red":

The Scorched Lands of the Aventyr Campaign Setting revealed for the first time in print!
Brave the passing of the earth-scorching orbiting Sun Shard
Explore the dreaded Tower of the Sun Lich
Climb the tower and dare to confront the indomitable defenses therein
Confront Mek'Madius's enigmatic creation, the Shard Golem

177781.name: Warriors of the Americas
177781.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor: Warriors of the Americas presents new armor, equipment, and weapons based on the medicine societies and elite warriors orders of the Americas. The Dog Soldier, Eagle knights, False Face Society, and Jaguar knights prestige classes are presented here.

177782.name: Book of Wishes
177782.description:
From the back of the book:
Anyone looking for more magic has finally found the perfect book. Book of Wishes introduces you to countless spells and fresh schools of magic not found anywhere else. Add to that, more magic items and alchemicals, and you have a wonderful new source on the workings of magic.

From the makers of Legend Quest comes this premiere magic supplement. Book of Wishes will sweep you into a world of magic and mystery where only your imagination sets the limits.

177783.name: NaissanceE
177783.description:
NaissanceE is a game, a philosophical trip and an artistic experience.

The game is constructed along a linear path punctuated by more open areas to freely explore, some puzzles to solves and some more experimental sequences.

Going deeper and deeper in a primitive zone from “Naissance” world, the player will meet entities or mechanical systems. Whether those entities are life forms or pure machines, they react to player presence, to light and shadow and they may open access to the following.

If most parts of the journey will require only curiosity and logic, a good control and coordination on running, breathing and jumping actions will help to go through rare but exigent sequences, as an homage to old school die an retry games.

The main idea behind the game is to make the player appreciate the loneliness, the feeling to be lost in a gigantic unknown universe and to be marvelled by the beauty of this world. A world which seems to be alive, leading the player, manipulating him and playing with him for any reason.

Imagination is an important key to enjoy and understand NaissanceE. Walking in an undiscovered abstract structure brings questions about the nature of this world, about the meaning of this trip. Evocating and symbolic, the architecture and events will lead player’s imagination to find an answer, if it only matters.

Source: The Game Website.

177788.name: Oubliette Issues 5-8 Compilation
177788.description:
User summary:

This book collects issues 5-8 of Oubliette, including their covers. It's a straight-up compilation: four separate tables of contents, no index, and no unified set of page numbers -- just the issues as originally presented, in order.

177789.name: Samurai Rundown
177789.description:
The fortress has fallen. The battle lost. The forces are scattered. You're on the run! You can't tell who is friend or foe. Suddenly you hear a noise! Your enemy is upon you! You have to attack! But with what? You've forgotten his weakness! No matter, attack with all you have! Pray you'll go down with honor and your ancestors will be forgiving. Attack!

Samurai Rundown is a tile based player versus player game with card based battles. Players start on a tile based map and go around collecting items and weapons, and revealing map tiles. When a player thinks they have enough weapons, they go after their enemy to attack them. When they are adjacent to their enemy, they initiate a card battle. The loser of the card battle loses a heart. When a samurai loses 3 hearts they die.

Be the last samurai standing to win.

Samurai Rundown also has a showdown mode. When all the weapons are found and drawn. All samurai drop their hearts to one from being exhausted and head to the nearest temple to duel. The samurai then battle to the death. The last samurai standing here is the winner.

Be the last samurai standing.

177790.name: MLB Full Count Baseball
177790.description: You're the manager playing against your division rivals, selecting pitches, organizing batting lineups, and developing a winning strategy. Each at bat begins with a 3-2 count and one pitch decides the outcome of the play. Full Count Baseball features exciting scenarios, including stolen bases, double plays and pickoffs. The game features four logoed game pieces for all MLB teams. The game board resembles a real ball park with fans in the stands and dugouts. A dry-erase scoreboard and marker are also included. Instructions are simple and easy to learn for players of all ages.

177791.name: Interregnum (Issue 5 - August 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Tales From the Electronic Underground #1, Vol I
177791.description:
Editorial (Peter Maranci)
The Log That Flies #5 (Peter Maranci)
Session Notes #19 (Doug Jorenby)
Refugee #42 (George Phillies)
Strange Sands #3 (Gilbert Pili)
Who Is John Galt #5 (Curtis Taylor)
Shepherd's Pie Slice #1 (Andrew R. Howes)
Tales from the Electronic Underground #1 (Dale Meier)
Aye, Matey! Vol I #5 (Scott Ferrier)
The Eight-Track Mind #5 (Virgil Greene)

177792.name: No Quarter (Issue 35 - Mar 2011)
177792.description:
Wrath Rules: Battle Engines
Warmachine: Wrath Preview II
Power Progression: Legion
Forces of Distinction II
Guts & Gears: Gun Carriage
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Deathjack
Battle Report: Engines of Wrath
Concept Carnage!

177793.name: The Estate Dossiers
177793.description:
From publisher's website:

A clever prop can add a sense of veracity and mystery to your game. The Estate Dossiers can be printed or copied, maybe tossed into a manila folder, then given to players at just the right time: when their characters ransack an NPC’s office or get handed a folder of documents to prepare for their next Estate mission.

The package contains the following dossiers and other props, written by various operatives within the Estate:

Welcome message for new Estate recruits
Threat assessment of the quickened creatures Estate operatives might face
Report on how an operative should approach translation
Reports on Ardyn, Ruk, and Crow Hollow (each suitable as a translation connection)
Report on the dark energy network of the Strange
Estate letterhead to create your own dossiers or official Estate communications
A template for an Estate ID badge
A copy of the Estate campus map

177794.description:
41 (or Forty-One) is a traditional card game commonly played in Syria and Lebanon. It is a partnership trick-taking game, in the same family as Whist and Boston, with a substantial difference from most such games: players bid and score individually.

Bidding and play is counter-clockwise, and traditionally trumps are always Hearts. In turn, each player bids a number of tricks they expect to take. The dealer, who bids last, can potentially cause the hand to be re-dealt by the next player if the total bid score count is less than 11. Play is as in most trick-taking games: match suit if possible, otherwise trump if desired or throw off; highest card of the suit led wins, unless trump is played, in which case highest trump wins, and winner leads to the next trick.

A player scores a number of points equal to their bid if they get at least that many tricks on their own (so 3 points for bidding 3 and winning 3 or more tricks), and loses that many points if they fail to get their bid (so -3 points for bidding 3 and winning 2 or fewer tricks). A bid of 7 or above is for double stakes (14/-14 for 7, 16/-16 for 8) and guarantees that the hand is played.

The winning partnership is the first to have a player reach at least 41 with their partner's score above 0.

177795.name: CLANG
177795.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

CLANG was intended as a historical Medieval game. It had a successful KickStarter and a prototype was created and delivered as a donor reward.

It was cancelled because the prototype was technically innovative, but the game-play was poor. Too much focus was put on historical accuracy and not enough on making it sufficiently fun to attract additional investment. Additional fundraising efforts failed and forced the team to cut their losses and disband in search of steady work.

177796.name: SHROOMS
177796.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

You must mutate your body and survive in an exotic fungi-covered world.

177797.name: Slasher Flick Director's Screen
177797.description:
Description From Publisher's Website

These eight inserts can be slid into a customizable landscape-oriented GM screen or printed directly onto cardstock to create a dedicated stand-alone screen. In addition to the PDF offering, the inserts are also available printed on very sturdy cardstock. When added to the cart, you will be given the option to also include a customizable, plastic GM screen.

177798.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition – Dragonslayer
177798.description:
User Summary

Dragonslayer is an expansion for multiplayer that will allow you to craft an item called the Dragon's Call, which allows you to face off against various dragons. The DLC also adds a new Ferelden castle and three new agents: Isabela, Skywatcher, and Zither: The Virtuoso.

177799.name: Taboo Buzz'd
177799.description:
An electronic version of the hit party game Taboo. Get your team to say the secret word without using the unmentionable words.

Unlike its predecessor, Electronic Taboo, Taboo Buzz'd has only 1,000 taboo words instead of 2,200, it has no skill-level setting and displays only four taboo words per guess word, and it includes only one six-round game mode. The Taboo buzzer button is no longer a separate component and is built into the main unit, which now has an illuminated display.

177800.name: Pathways (Issue 49 - May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Twenty Questions with Greg A. Vaughan

177801.description:
The Far Space Federation has discovered an uninhabited system in the Ether region of space. The Federation Engineers have determined that a new foundry will be built near the system's rich asteroid belt. A specific batch of asteroids have been found to have deposits of unusual elements. Can you help the Federation benefit from this serendipitous discovery?

The Ether Ore Expansion adds these new items for even more variability in Far Space Foundry:
(4) Ore Cards
(40) Ore Tokens
(3) Product Cards
(18) Product Tokens
(2) Cloth Bags
177801.name: Ether Ore: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry

boardgameintegration: Smash Up: Pretty Pretty Smash Up
Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
Smash Up: The Obligatory Cthulhu Set
Smash Up: What Were We Thinking?
Smash Up: Pretty Pretty Smash Up
Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
Smash Up: The Obligatory Cthulhu Set
Smash Up: What Were We Thinking?
177802.description: Smash Up turns over the wheel to all of you! Through a huge nomination and run-off process, players from all over the world helped choose four of the factions that take part in Smash Up: It's Your Fault!. The winning four factions were Sharks, Superheroes, Mythic Greeks, and Dragons - with the "Shark Delivery System" Tornado faction thrown in as a bonus!
177802.name: Smash Up: It's Your Fault!
boardgameexpansion: Smash Up: The Big Geeky Box
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 70 - Gamer FAQs: New Essential Games for a Collection
MN 0077 Smash Up

177803.description:
A dark age approaches the Realm of Atheria –- the vast ancestral lands of the Amurelden people are under siege by countless hordes of mana-infected beasts.

While cold steel and piercing iron may help defend the Kingdoms and Empires that stretch across the sub-continent, their only real chance for surviving rests in the hands of wizards.

The passing of the Lorelias comet signalled the coming of a new era –– one marked by a relentless battle for survival.

The sapphire colossus was last seen more than three centuries ago – it torched the skies, spilling its mana-filled insides across the entire planet. Many believed that the mystical messenger of doom would never return --

Some of the more ancient wizards still remembered the chaos of its last passing -- they themselves witnessed the horrors and death that unfolded in its wake -- things they had hoped never to see again.

Wizard Survival is a card game for 2-4 players. The games mechanics were specifically designed to assure that every game is a new and unique challenge.

One of the games two modes is survival - a free-for-all match that is won by being the last surviving Wizard in the game. Players use magic spells to defend against marauding monsters, and are limited by the scarcity of resources.

The other game mode is cooperative, in which players join forces in order to vanquish the 4 powerful bosses. This mode has four difficulty levels, especially designed to push players to their limits.
177803.name: Wizard Survival

177804.name: S Jakubem na rybách
177804.description: Players throw the dice and moves his pawn along the board. They have a several destinations where they try to catch as the most valuable fish. Crowned the winner is the player who is at the end of the season for the most points earned catches.

177805.description:
A fully cooperative survival miniatures board game. Mission-based with a highly modular game board.

Every player takes the roll of a survivor to fight against the reavers and horrifying mutants, causes through the outbreak 5 years ago.

Blood Fall: The Last Days offers a great combat system where positioning is the key to survive. You have to find Items, weapons, crafting upgrades with components to manage your character. You can learn skills to improve your chances to survive.

Beside the combat system one of the great and innovative game features is the enemy AI. Every enemy acts by itself. They have movement paths and smart combat mechanics.

The game design has finished to 90%. The artwork is about 90%. Actual focus is on mission design for great adventures.

Play Testers Voice:
"So complex, but not complicated."
"Highly cooperative. Don't split the group!"
"The best weapon system i've played with...a shotgun feels like a shotgun and a kitchen knife -puh- feels like that. Great."
"Very smart A.I. system. The routing of the enemies is great and acts as a natural timer. If you had the chance to test it. Test it!"

We want to be on Kickstarter in late 2016.
177805.name: Blood Fall: The Last Days

177806.description:
Shadows over Europe is a two- or three-player game simulating the diplomatic, economic and military development leading up to and eventually being unfolded in World War II.

Players assume the roles of Germany, the Soviet Union and the United Kingdom. Players attempt to outperform each nation’s historical record in the world’s most gigantic struggle. The game starts in 1935 and ends by an automatic victory or in the summer of 1945.

Shadows of Europe is played over 11 years, 1935-1945. Each year is represented by three turns; a Between Years turn (diplomacy, resource collection and research), a Winter turn (land operations), and a Summer turn (land and naval operations). Further each turn is divided into several phases.

A fundamental part of the game design is that actions rather than units are hidden from the enemy. This captures the game’s ambition to reflect a strategic rather than tactical level. In WWII the concentration of larger forces was often known to the enemy, whereas their strategic intent was not.

Units are Infantry and Mechanized/Panzer armies, Leaders, Surface raiders, U-boat flotillas, Escort Groups and Convoys. Air forces are abstracted to a combat modifier for each front.

The game facilitates two kind of resources: Minerals used for production and Oil for operations.

Rulebook and Playbook:
The 20-page rulebook is clearly written with many examples and designer notes. Also included is a 14-page playbook with extended examples of play, strategy hints and a card index.
177806.name: Shadows over Europe

177807.description:
England in the Middle Ages is seeking a King. Knights from across the land go on exciting and adventurous quests with one goal in mind: to pull the sword Excalibur from the stone and claim the throne. As in the story, the game lets players take the role of knights wandering from town to town and adventure to adventure. While doing so, they encounter the saga's heroes - bridge guardians, generous barkeeps, successful noblemen - who influence the events of the game.

As part of the “Smart Play” series, a smartphone mounted over the board keeps track of the players actions and plays the voices of friends and foes. Another difference to the original game (King Arthur) are the dice to determine the result of fights. The players can gain strength to get additional dice. The free app also explains the rules.
177807.name: King Arthur
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
boardgamepodcastepisode: King Arthur Smartplay (Ravensburger): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 233

177808.name: Forever Folio (Issue 1 - May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Exploring the World Wide Web of Wyrd
Mazes, Maps & Monsters Adventure Scenario #1: The Ruins of Peril
177808.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ezine for the indy RPG publisher Forever People and friends. This issue:

World Wide Web of Wyrd - an online chat room interview with the author of Wyrd, the genre-busting fantasy setting by David Sharrock.
The Dwarves of Demrel - a staff pick Kickstarter project you'll want to get in on at ground zero. Aiming to make 2015 the year of the dwarf, this crowd funding project is a movie worthy of Hollywood level success.
The Unsung Weave - a full serialized campaign setting for the Wyrd game. Featuring an introduction scene-setter in this issue with 10 adventures planned (and already written) for the next ten issues of FF. An essential for GMs running a Wyrd campaign.
Things That Go Bump in the Night - Introduction to Forever People's latest release, EVP, a new-genre game system which puts players into the shoes of paranormal investigators then hurls them into the midst of some of the world's most terrifying locations. Gizmos, gadgets, ghosts and worse...
Mazes Maps & Monsters - a fully realised roleplaying game system, accompanied by adventures, written for parents who want to introduce their kids to gaming, or for mentor GMs who would like to bring roleplay to a younger audience. Using a mixture of fun, miniatures, Lego and a rule system designed to grab their attention, MM&M will be serialized in unabridged format only in FF.

177809.name: The Case of the Scrupulous Pawnbroker (Pathfinder)
177809.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4 Characters Level 3

The PCs may have used the services of a local half-elven pawnbroker, Latricus. known to be stern, cold but fair in his dealings. Now they find his store open, none of his assistants present, and the door to his basement office (where serious transactions took place) invitingly ajar. Maron, a nasty sorcerer, and her thugs have recently decided to change the nature of their transgression with the pawnbroker and the PCs are just in time.

177810.name: Ghastardly Deeds (Pathfinder)
177810.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4–6 Characters Level 6–7

Torren and Jelax are brothers who came to town about 6 months ago after adventuring abroad to open an inn. The brothers mostly keep to themselves and seem cordial, but rumors have started to spread throughout the town of adventurers disappearing that use the brother’s services. The local magistrate has discreetly hired the adventuring group to investigate these disappearances.

177811.name: Buta No Shiro (Pathfinder)
177811.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4 Characters Level 10

A warthog-headed rakshasa, Achellios the Glutton, has gained influence over a town’s magistrate. The creature uses its powers to uncover illegal activity and read wrongdoers’ minds, then with its message ability it whispers the details to the magistrate while he’s alone—resulting in a remarkably crime-free town. When the PCs enter the picture, either traveling through the area or perhaps returning to their once-quiet hometown. Achellios recognizes the threat the adventurers pose and immediately starts turning the magistrate against them with every scrap of information it can think of.

177812.name: Nekh-ta-Nebi's Tomb (Pathfinder)
177812.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4 Characters Level 5

This complex is set inside a small pyramid or ancient burial site, deep within the desert. It is home to the remains of Nekh-ta-Nebi, a minor nobleman whose lust for power maintains him and his dusty retinue, centuries after their unholy deaths.

177813.name: The Soul of a Prince (Pathfinder)
177813.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4 Characters of Level 9–11

The party is sent to retrieve the soul of Prince Remlek, which has been located in a hidden underground complex, accessible from the sewers. A devourer holds the soul and while trying to come back to this plane to get a more powerful soul, became trapped underground.

177814.name: Torment at Torni Tower (Pathfinder)
177814.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4–5 Characters Level 5–6

Somervel’s autumn rains lasted longer than usual, and the resulting winter floods impacted more than expected. Some distant pale-forts haven’t been heard from in months, being cut off by the linking of frozen rice paddies, flood meadows, leas usually inhabited by cattle, and rivers that run though Somervel’s territory. Parties are charged with taking supplies to these border posts and bringing anyone severely injured home.

Somervel’s pale-forts are like beaver lodges; earthen mounds on islands in the marshlands. Each covers a wide area, is surrounded by a wooden palisade, has quarters below ground, and has a single central watchtower. Torni’ s tower fell in the recent storms, and the guards missed Akka, who infiltrated the fort and killed them all. Now this is her home, and she is recruiting...

177815.description:
Burger Boss is a fast-paced, dice-rolling, worker placement tactical game for 3-5 players.

Players take charge of a small burger shack and are responsible for hiring workers, obtaining ingredients, and cooking and finally selling their juicy burgers at the highest price possible. Do you have what it takes to turn your small burger shack to a global empire? Do you have what it takes to become the burger boss?
177815.name: Burger Boss
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 004 – Essen 2015 Diary!

177816.name: Volume 1: Classes
177816.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outer Space Raiders Volume 1 contains six new classes for your old school space opera games.

Be an odd Alien from the other side of the galaxy. Warp reality to your will as an Astromancer. Save the day with some bubble gum and duct tape as an Engineer. Slauguther your foes and exlpore strange worlds as a primite Lost Worlder. Shoot first as a Scoundrel. Harness the powers of a dark star as a Warp Ninja.

Outer Space Raiders Volume 1 is compatible with White Star: White Box Science Fiction Rolelpaying by Barrel Rider Games.

177817.name: 101 Forest Spells
177817.description:
From publisher blurb:

You can't grow two trees next to each other without someone enchanting them.

101 Forest Spells enhances the range of spellcasting options for players and gives GMs exciting new ways to challenge the forest-exploring adventurers in their campaigns.

Want to take on the shape of a golden gorger? Any interest in calling a hamadryad to aid you? Want more ways to enjoy creatures from bears to unicorns?

Entirely compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, 101 Forest Spells is brought to you by the same folks that brought you 1001 Spells, and expands the spell lists of casters in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Player’s Guide, Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Magic, and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide.

177819.name: City of the Lich
177819.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Osgurith, a sun drenched city of sultry warmth and light. Where smoky eyed women with raven hair sing as they harvest oranges from the trees. Where olive-skinned men are as quick to laugh as they are to challenge you to a drinking match. Your appearance in this fair city is cause for celebration; its not every day they receive visitors such as yourself! Look around you--no hunger, no illness, no crime--a community where your name is on everyone's lips. Speak with any citizen and you'll see, Osgurith is a little slice of paradise!

Or is it?

Every paradise has its price...

City of the Lich is an expansion to [Ryubix Manor], yet suitable as a Stand-Alone Adventure for characters of all levels.

Written in a system-neutral style, City of the Lich can be used with any Fantasy RPG system. Great attention has been given to creating a setting with internal consistency: its history, NPC personalities, and local flavor. As written, this is a fully realized location for players to interact, explore, potentially exploit, and eventually escape from.

177820.name: Ryubix Manor
177820.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ryubix Manor is a 300+ area haunted house adventure, written in a system agnostic style (OSR/OGL compatible), and is suitable for most fantasy role playing games. For 4-8 players, scalable up to 20th level.

Three brothers – Staunton, Segar, and Severin – founded House Ryubix four centuries ago atop the windswept hills of the southern coast. The Ryubix brothers were respected Lords of Order, who ruled fairly (and taxed lightly) the small but thriving community under their protection. Unfortunately, the descendants of Ryubix Manor would begin down a path that would ultimately lead to their own destruction. Born into a life of idleness and ease, the subsequent Ryubix lineage slowly descended into wickedness, each successive generation subtly worse than the last. A unique curse lies on Ryubix Manor, one tied not only to the Manor, but to the Ryubix line itself. The haunting of the Manor has endured for 111 years. It is now up to you to break the curse and cleanse Ryubix Manor once and for all.

177821.name: Liber Elixirium
177821.description:
From publisher blurb:

Liber Elixirium (The Essential Guide to Potions and Oils) is written as an ancient textbook, discovered and reproduced by the publisher. This volume contains one hundred recipes for potions and oils, their ingredients and properties, an extensive guide to equipment for the brick and mortar laboratory as well as the adventuring mobile laboratory. As well, you will find step by step instructions on ingredient preparation, helping the adventurer put a realistic spin on their profession as a Potion Maker.

Great for the Game Master, what was once a simple road between two kingdoms becomes abloom with Echeveria, Henbane, Hart's Tongue and Butterbur. The section on Items of Legend creates exciting adventure hooks for your players.

For players, take along the volume to your game to help you gather ingredients, both flora and fauna, during your adventure, mix potions that will help your fellow adventurers and yourself in times of trouble, and hone your craft.

177822.name: Rescue from Tyrkaven (5E)
177822.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dangers of a Forgotten Past Awakened in the Deep

When hobgoblin raiders kidnap a caravan full of workers and supplies, the adventurers set off to get them all back. But neither the raiders nor the adventurers know what terrifying horrors await them in the depths of their cavern hideout. Now, the adventurers must risk it all to prevent the minions of an ancient enemy from visiting death and destruction upon the land. Can the heroes rescue the captives from the hobgoblins and deliver them from this ancient foe—or will they all perish, ushering in the rise of a forgotten deity?

Rescue from Tyrkaven is the first adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves series for the Fifth Edition of the World‘s Oldest Fantasy Roleplaying Game. This 19-page adventure is designed to challenge four to five 2nd-level adventurers who thirst for heroics... but they may find more than they bargained for in the process! Inside this volume, you’ll find:

8 fully-developed monsters for your Fifth Edition campaign
A sinister new magic item, the book of dark obedience, that can set your adventurers onto an entirely new campaign
A full-color map of the caverns from which the hobgoblins terrorize the locals
Enough content to get a group of 2nd-level adventurers to 3rd level, with ideas to extend the story even further once you’re done exploring the caves




Dangers Unknown. Treasures Untold. Adventure Awaits.

177823.description:
The Devil's Run: Route 666 is a fast-moving and hard-hitting vehicular combat board game (for 2-6 players) set in a post-apocalyptic America.

Devil's Run uses a rolling board mechanic, to ensure all players feel like they are on the edge of their seat; fall too far behind and you are out of the race, get too far in front and you could open yourself to an airstrike or an unexpected obstacle in the road. Live fast and die hard on Route 666. Can you survive the Devil's Run?
