There are four types of vehicles: Bikes, Trikes, Buggies and Cars. Each of these vehicle types play differently due to how they drive, their weapons and their arcs of fire. The game has story driven missions which are a mix of full throttle racing and maximum carnage vehicular battle, with an immersive ruleset to make you feel like you're a part of the post-apoc action. We use six and ten sided dice, statlines and modifications to represent every aspect of the game, from scenery effects, shooting, ramming and sideswiping, to using equipment like Nitros, Oil Slicks and Smoke Screens.
177823.name: Devil's Run: Route 666
boardgamepodcastepisode: 18. Devon Dice Podcast - Warring colons
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen

177824.name: Die verlorenen Lande
177824.description:
(from the back of the book)

Finally, the middle epire is taking the field against the great enemy, Prince Helme Haffax, representing the festering thorn in the side of Raul's Empire.

Almost 20 years have passed since the betrayal of the former archmarshall. Now finally the Empress wants to punish the Heptarch and hold him accountable. The goal is to liberate the oppressed Duchy Tobrien and drive the last heir of the Demon Master back into the sea, from which he landed in 1019 BF and the invasion of Tobrien began.

The Middle Empire has long been waiting for this opportunity, and in recent years, all provinces have done their best to prepare for this final campaign against the Shadowlands. Die verlorenen Lande (the lost lands) describes this imperial campaign toward Mendena and ends with a surprise when the army finally charges this old city.

The lost land is the first volume of the two-part campaign to the former archmarshal, Prince Helme Haffax. Many seeds for the future of the Middle Empire are laid, and the heroes can offer all support to wrest Tobrien off the clutches of the black thugs once and for all. The events of this book will find their completion in the sequel The Shadow Marshal.

177825.name: Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul: Quick Bio – Cliffhanger
177825.description:
Information From the Publisher's Website

The iconic comicbook artist, Herb Trimpe, passed away on April 13, 2015. In addition to all the stellar work he unleashed upon the comicbook world, Mr. Trimpe drew an illustration for our now out-of-print Silver Age superhero setting book, Omlevex. He was an amazing artist and a true gentleman.

To honor him and his impressive body of work, we have statted up Cliffhanger (the character he illustrated in Omlevex) for Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul. They are presented here in a free PDF mini-supplement, along with a summary of the Omlevex Universe.

177826.name: Bild-A-Word Picture Puzzles
177826.description: A spin-off of the then-popular game Bild-A-Word, meant for very young players. It includes 36 cards each with a letter, color band, and part of a picture. The object is to match cards by their bands, assemble the picture on the included easel, and see the spelling of the animal pictured.

177827.name: Manuscripts: The Quest for Knowledge
177827.description:
Manuscripts is a 3-dimensional medieval game. You lead a search party of three characters into a castle to retrieve your kingdom’s stolen manuscript. Your search party consists of a Warrior who is strong and fast, a Wizard who has three game changing magic cards, and a Princess who is responsible for retrieving her secret Manuscript that is on a face down card selected at the start of the game.

Each board you enter requires summoning a Monster that is controlled by the player on your left. You will face an Orc, Ogre, Minotaur, Werewolf, Knight of Doom, Dragon, or the Grim Reaper. Occasionally you will be confronted by a hostile search party. The monsters cannot follow you on to another board and your magic only works in the room you are in. You can battle with the strength of your character, use a magic weapon, use a magic spell, or run (honorably of course).

To win your Princess must acquire the correct Manuscript and your search party must have acquired the most jewels of all Princesses who escaped the castle. The game ends when all Princesses have exited the castle, dead or alive.

Manuscript's Castles are carved from blocks of wood and the Starter Pack 1 includes 2 boards, 7 monsters, 7 jewels, two search parties, and three Manuscripts.

177828.name: Blaas-Balspel
177828.description:
Cute old Dutch game.

Components in my edition:
2 Spoons
4 Balls
Insert that acts as the board
Rules inside lid

The game is intended for children and was designed to help children with their mathematical skills. Game 1 is for the youngest children. Game 2 is for slightly older children. Game 3 is intended for much older children, say, 8 to 10 year olds.

The board is punctuated with holes and each hole has a value next to it. The cute spoons have a long handle and a 'bowl' into which you balance a ball. Hold the spoon over the board and blow the ball off. If the ball is in a hole, do the same with the 2nd ball. If, at any time, a ball does not roll into a hole, the player may blow it again.

Game 1. Add the two numbers together after both balls are in holes. The highest total wins.

Game 2: Start with a base total of 5. Add the value of the hole where the first ball lands. Subtract the value of the hole where the 2nd ball landed. Highest total wins.

Game 3: Use all 4 balls. Again, start with a base total of 5. The first ball's value multiplies the base score. The second ball is added to the running total. The third ball is subtracted from the running total and the 4th ball is divided into the running total after the third ball has been computed. Highest total achieved, wins.

177829.name: Races of the Command Fleet
177829.description:
From publisher blurb:

Galaxy Command is Otherverse America’s space-fantasy setting, a retro-future based on the tropes of bad TV sci-fi rather than realistic concerns. In contrast to the serious and almost plausible Otherverse America, or the ultra-violent, espionage action of Psi-Watch, Galaxy Command is an all ages setting with a focus on galaxy spanning adventure and exploration.

Galaxy Command fully embraces the bad science, lazy alien design and superficial world building common to 70s sci-fi. All the available player races are humanoid, most are sexually and culturally compatible with Earth born humans, and most display distinctive planetary monocultures.

Races of the Command Fleet expands on the racial options found in the Galaxy Command Campaign Setting (Otherverse Games, 2009) and its related sourcebooks. Inside you’ll find new racial traits, new feats and tons of new cultural details. In addition, you’ll met a few new races, including human offshoots like the glamorous, proud Athenians or the rag-tag Survivor Fleet, as well as some interesting new aliens commonly found aboard Command vessels. New information on the WARSTAR regime will let you play a crimson-skinned behemoth form behind the Iron Curtain of Space, and have your play experience be dramatically different than if you chose to play as a Galaxy Command spacer.

177830.name: The Adorable Avenger
177830.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planet Pacifica.

Rainbow ringed jewel of Galaxy Command, a world with a heritage of peace and freedom dating back nearly 1800 years. One of the first and greatest of the human colony worlds, the men and women who tamed Pacifica have built a world that is the envy of their galactic neighbors, a world that is a utopia even by the high standards of 35th Century existence.

The citizens of Pacifica eliminated crime, war and disease centuries ago. The multispectrum radiation from the planet's spectacular ring system energies human cells, reversing age and giving the body the energy it needs to fight off even the worst disease. On their homeworld, Pacificians are virtually immortal- centuries old philosopher/hedonists with the bodies of teenagers. Pacifica's ruling council allows grievously wounded from across the galaxy to rest and recover on the paradise. However, though Galaxy Command and its agents are welcome on the pleasure-world, their weapons (even the non-lethal wonders Command marshals use to fight off WARSTAR hordes) are not. Nothing capable of inflicting harm is allowed on Pacifica, and clouds of intelligent mist, possibly the most amazing micro-bots in the galaxy, roam the world seeking out and nullifying any weapons smuggled on-planet.

Pacifica enjoys a reputation as the most lavish resort world in known space, but is also renowned for its serene, meditative temples. Diplomats, brilliant artists and famous courtesans all hail from this lush world, and so do the quirky, courageous and relentlessly cheerful adventurers nicknamed, only half-jokingly, "Adorable Avengers". Cute, lovable and resolute, these (in)famous women end wars, broker lasting peace-treaties between mortal enemies. Sworn to do no harm to any life form, Adorable Avengers are unconventional heroes, who solve problems with wit, with affection and with charm, not with blasters. Even the latest WARSTAR atrocity can't break their resolve, nor end their quest for justice.

This Advanced Class is intended for the Five-Star Rated Galaxy Command RPG today!

177831.name: Stars & Nightmares
177831.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stars and Nightmares is a supplement for Otherverse Games’ Galaxy Command campaign setting. Inspired by the weirdest and coolest bad sci-fi you can name, the future of Galaxy Command plays like 80s cartoons and 70s comic books. This 29 page supplement describes a trio of new races for the Galaxy Command setting, which can be allies or enemies for your players. Darklighters and Starchildren are fierce rivals with similar star-based super abilities. One faction aids Galaxy Command for the sheer fun of adventure; their rivals aid WARSTAR and oppress the galaxy.

The conflict between the peace loving and heroic Galaxy Command organization and the brutal WARSTAR regime defines the setting, but those two powerful factions aren’t the only forces in the galaxy. This short supplement describes Planet Nightmare, a dangerous fringe world rocketed to galactic prominence by the export of a pair of very dangerous drugs. The monsters of Planet Nightmare certainly live up to their reputations, and the three new sentient races that call the fog-shrouded world home are even worse… especially the cruel Quille Kathrix overlords.

177832.name: The Planetary Champion Advanced Class
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
177832.description:
From publisher blurb:

Answer the call of duty!

Protect your people, protect your world!

Defy WARSTAR and rebuff star-pirate incursions with the strength of both conviction and your strong arms. Become a Planetary Champion, a breed of hero powerful enough to be truthfully called a one man army! Planetary Champions are psionic superwarriors who are taught to unlock their true potential, and are empowered by their planet's ruling body to dispense justice, and to lead the world' defenses in times of crisis. Unbelievably confident and often tactically brilliant, Planetary Champions tend toward (justified) arrogance. Their self-assurance is the source of their powers. Morale-fed super abilities draw strength from the Champion's courage and conviction.

Many worlds have their own Champions and each is as unique as the world that created them. Some worlds dispense with conventional militaries entirely, depending on either one lone and incredibly powerful Planetary Champion or a small team of dedicated heroes. Other worlds place a Planetary Champion near the top of their world's military hieachy, allowing these legendary warriors to command armadas and vast hordes of conventional troopers. No matter if they fight alone or with a legion at their back, a Planetary Champion's courage never wavers.

177833.name: Synths: Building Very Human Androids for Galaxy Command
177833.description:
From publisher blurb:

‘Synth’ is a collective term for an array of extremely human-like androids manufactured and programmed by various galactic mega-corps. Galaxy Command reluctantly tolerates the creation and employment of Synth servants in a variety of fields. Synths do work too dangerous or ultraspecialized for humans; Synth engineers work in hazardous waste disposal, maintain starships and plot their course while human crewmembers are in coldsleep, terraform inhospitable planetoids. In dark corners of an otherwise bright galaxy, sex-Synths work as prostitutes and strippers, occasionally escaping into a new and more dangerous life as a criminal or space pirate. Synths allow players to create android in the same spirit of Seventies sci-fi that informs the Galaxy Command campaign setting as a whole.

177834.name: The Black Star Commando
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
177834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Black Star Commandos are the galaxy's foremost fighting force. A nearly unstoppable, impeccably trained cadre of cyber-enhanced supersoldiers, the Black Star Commandos are answerable only to KOMAND ONE, a planetary artificial intelligence as ancient and potent as the Adam Intelligence itself.

Black Star Commandos are the most elite soldiers serving Galaxy Command. These implacable, robotic Spartans guard Galaxy Command's most important sites and leaders, serve as ceremonial
guards for the Galactic Senate and lead commando incursions deep into WARSTAR territory.

The Black Star Brigade is the best of the best, with a tour of duty as a Black Star Commando only availbe to the most skilled, dedicated and loyal of Galaxy Command's soldiers. In addition to skill and loyalty, prospective Commandos must possess a killer instinct bred out of the human majority by two millennia of peace. Unlike the peacekeeping Galactic Marshalls, Commandos are just what their name implies- they are soldiers, killers and an offensive force. Their presence often makes the clean-cut, heroic men and women of Galaxy Command nervous, but noone can question their heroism, or the necessity of the Black Star Brigade's existence.

This Advanced Class is intended for the Galaxy Command setting and includes all the information needed to add the Black Star Commando to your game!

177835.name: The Magno-Star
177835.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Advanced Class for the Galaxy Command Campaign Setting

Magno-Star is the hottest sport of the 35th Century- a fast-moving, thrilling, three dimensional combination of soccer and rugby played by technologically enhanced magnetic manipulators. The first Magno-Star leagues started up during the 32nd Century, by bored ore miners on the remote colony world IronClad.

The four hundred day planetary night on the remote mining world was long and arctic, but nothing outside the tolerances of the tough, cyber-enhanced colonists. What 32nd Century cyber tech couldn’t fix, though, was boredom. When off duty, the colonists needed something to keep their minds occupied: the local VR chambers got old after a while, and IronClad was too remote for regular imports of booze. So the miners found a disused shaft, and refitted their work-suits and cyber-implants to have a little fun. A few thousand bruises and broken bones later, actual rules were laid down.

Today, Magno-Star is a multi-trillion credit sport. Every world in civilized space has a local team, and virtually every citizen of Galaxy Command bets on big matches. The sport of today is fast moving and high tech, and its supped-up stars are revered as some of the galaxy’s greatest heroes.

177836.name: Space Cases!
177836.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Galaxy Command rulebook, I mentioned that in the spirit of 70s sci-fi, players can re-skin baseline humans as human-like aliens. These re-skinned humans keep the human racial traits, but have the kind of minor physical alterations that a low budget TV show might use to create its aliens. These ‘aliens’ might just be human actors with elf ears glued to them, painted skin or fake pair of antennas added.

Spacecases takes this reskinning concept a few steps farther. You’re not just building a one shot alien race for your campaign, you’re building the bumbling kind of extraterrestrial comic relief that 70s and early 80s TV was known for. Spacecases makes use of tons of random trait charts. The goal of this sourcebook isn’t a freeform humanoid alien creation systemrather you’re building a fun to play sidekick from an alien culture you make up as you go along, and that is played mostly for laughs. The feats, racial abilities and cultural quirks are designed with screw-ball space comedy in mind.

177837.name: One Planet, One Power
177837.description:
From publisher blurb:

Galaxy Command was heavily influenced by the classic sci-fi comic, Legion of Superheroes.

This sourcebook allows you to custom build a similar galaxy: an incredibly bio-diverse universe filled with super-powered humanoid and near human aliens, each with a memorable planetary monoculture. Each new race in this book has taken a Powered Hero class talent and modified it into a racial trait all the members of that species are known for a single racial super-ability, and this power has formed the cornerstone of their planet’s society, defining the races’ place in the galaxy. Heroes hailing from a super-powered planet are distinguished from their fellow citizens not genetically, but by their courage, fighting spirit and the precision or raw power they display when activating their alien abilities.

177838.name: The Macromorph
177838.description:
From publisher blurb:

Macromorphs are size-changing super soldiers, able to grow to giant size with a corresponding increase to strength and durability. Macromorphs are physical powerhouses, and their sheer size allows them to dominate any battlefield. A Macromorph’s size shifting powers give them tank-like durability- they’ll need it because as the single biggest target on the battlefield, Macromorphs draw more fire than any three smaller heroes. Most Macromorphsconfident in their ability to take a shot that would turn a smaller comrade into a fine red mistwouldn’t have it any other way.

The Macromorph Advanced Class can be used in any of Otherverse Games’ unique D20 Modern campaign settings. Macromorph mercenaries battle psi-capable terrorists in Psi-Watch, and explore uncharted space as members of a superheroic legion of space opera adventurers in Galaxy Command. Activist Macromorphs trade fire with cyber-enhanced terrorists in Otherverse America and battle perverse, skyscraper sized kaiju in Black Tokyo. A modular set of abilities and entry requirements allow you to custom build Macromorphs designed to fit into one of these settings, or Macromorphs can be imported to any D20 Modern setting that incorporates fantastic powers.

177839.name: Sexually Transmitted Future
177839.description:
From publisher blurb:

By 2020, genetic engineering was THE hot new military science, and the first Powered super-soldiers had been decanted. Today, it's 2107 and decades of urban warfare, xeno-immigration and post-human evolution have fundamentally altered the human genome.

As gene-tech advanced, civilian genetic alteration became increasingly common. While genetically altered supersoldiers dominate the battlefield, and display amazing, inhuman powers, even the ordinary citizens of the future are genetically different from 21st century mankind. Many of the ordinary men and women of the future- the teachers, the stockbrokers, the school kids and Enclave block-moms, the wage-slaves and porn stars, the street scum and the swing voters- possess genetic gifts which straddle the line between baseline homo sapiens and Powered.

Each future human being is a species of one- a custom built human being designed to survive the rigors of a segregated planet.

Sexually Transmitted Future is a sourcebook for the Otherverse America campaign setting, but can easily be used with other near-future sci-fi and cyberpunk settings, including Psi-Watch and Galaxy Command. Sexually Transmitted Future includes:

Expanded racial traits for playing baseline human characters.
Complete rules for genetic modification, engineering the unborn and cloning.
New affiliations focused on post-human culture.
Over 80 new gene mods that grant the recipients unique new racial traits.
A new kind of feat: Gene Feats, which let genetically engineered characters hack their genome and the DNA of their victims to make the biologically impossible look easy.

177840.name: Puppet Heresy: Artbook - Gioco di Ruolo - Ambientazione
177840.description:
From the back of the book:
Anno 7435, la terra è dominata da esseri in parte umani e in parte elementali chiamati Puppets

English translation:
Year 7435, the earth is dominated by a race of mixed human/elemental beigns called Puppets

177841.name: Psi-Watch
177841.description:
From Introduction:

Psi-Watch grew out of dissatisfaction with the D20 Modern psionic rules, which I felt were complex without being compelling, overly technical without being overly interesting. Worse, the existing psionics system didn’t accurately model comic book psionics: fearsome and nearly unstoppable if they’re clever. Instead of focused competence and overwhelming, unique powers, you have unfocused classes like the Battlemind who is forced to choose a variety of random abilities each level. Since the Psionics system is modeled on the D20 magic system, not psis as they appear in comics and sci-fi, it doesn’t model psychic warriors with any particularly passion or depth.

When I first began producing psi-war classes for Skortched Urf Studio’s D7ACU line, I dealt with the problem by producing psions built around a single tightly focused theme. Comic book inspired heroes like the Gravity Slinger and Cold Bringer, not to mention the new classes in Psi-Watch, are built around a logical progression of linked abilities, not wide (but unrelated) powerlists. To me, that’s closer to the ‘reality’ of psychics in comics and sci-fi.

While nothing prevents Psi-Watch psions from multiclassing, for the most part, pyrokinetics stay pyros, time travelers focus on improving their time talents, and nano-sculptors focus on improving their cellular engines.

In addition to selecting psionic classes, players in a Psi-Watch campaign can choose psionic feats which grant powerful natural mutations and mental talents. Designer mutations, alien heritage and random mutation can produce a whole campaign filled with powerful psi-soldiers.

Psi-Watch presents a slick, stylish new way of looking at psionics, not to mention modern espionage and supers gaming. The campaign setting owes a major debt to my life-long love of comics, and is inspired by my generation’s comic book renaissance.

When Image Comics debuted in 1992, it was a hyper-violent, vibrantly colored underworld of government conspiracies, cybernetically enhanced mercs, psionic super soldiers, covert corporate strike teams and subtle alien invasions. While all too many of the early Image issues were crudely written and amateurishly plotted, their passion and intensity and vibrant imagination drew me in. Comics like WildC.A.T.s, Cyberforce, Stormwatch and Younglood drew on the best in comics, military fiction and cyberpunk to create an entirely new genre of comics. Innovations in art and storytelling fed back into the industry, spurring creative revolutions at both Marvel and DC. Many of the best artists working in comics today got their start aping the beloved styles of superstars like Lee, Liefeld and McFarlane. The design tropes and political savvy of the best Image comics inspired later ‘mainstream works’. “Image style” costumes revolutionized the look of everyone from the Legion of Superheroes to Batman to the Avengers, and a thousand more. Mark Millar’s Ultimates and Civil War are thematic outgrowths of Jim Lee and Warren Ellis’s early image storylines.

Psi-watch is designed to emulate the thrill of those early Image comics, to allow players and gamemasters alike to bring some of their sleek style and overwhelming firepower to the gaming table. Psi-Watch is designed with the player in mind, presenting an assortment of new powers, advanced classes, weapons, power armor and vehicles….
New tactics for a new kind of war game.

177842.name: Paradigm Shift
177842.description:
You awake from a terrifying nightmare to discover that your home city of River Lake has been devastated by an explosion at a neuroscience laboratory..

A hidden object game with a post-apocalyptic theme and infected humans (i.e. zombies) on the loose. Zombie apocalypse! A very darkly drawn art style.

Source: The Developer Website.

177843.description: Mix It is a mix-and-match monster game, but you're not just trying to build any monster; you want to create ones that's exactly the same as the one shown on your secret goal card: same eyes, same mouth, and same legs. Unfortunately we all share the same laboratory and have space to build only two monsters at a time, so there's total chaos in the lab! Players never stop adding new parts and moving them from one monster to another. We also need to pay close attention to the monsters on the table because they change constantly and our monster can appear at any time, even on another player's turn...
177843.name: Mix It
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

177844.description:
Sector 6 is an abstract strategy game for 1 to 4 players, with a playing time of 30 minutes. Each player controls two prisoners as they make their way through the winding labyrinth of a space prison, trying to collect enough oxygen to survive while denying their opponents the same. The goal is to collect as many points as possible (represented by oxygen tiles of different colors and values), located inside a maze formed by hexagonal tiles. Players must move across the maze and collect the points before their opponents.
The game has 2 phases: construction and competition. In the construction phase, players take turns placing tiles and creating the the board (maze). Then the competition phase begins, where players move around the maze attempting to collect more points (oxygen) than their opponents. Where players place their tiles is of utmost strategic importance in the construction phase: Sector 6´s building system allows strategic planning while the maze is being created. In the absence of a predefined configuration, each game takes place on an entirely new board. There are essentially an infinite amount of setup configurations which allows for high replay value.
But building a good maze and moving quickly will not be enough to achieve victory. During the game, Sector 6´s maze will be in constant motion, as players can rotate the tiles, thereby changing the layout of the maze, potentially allowing players to lock their opponents or create new pathways to reach the points faster. So it won't be the fastest player who wins, but the one who learns how to best use the intricacies of the maze to their own advantage and to the detriment of their opponents!
177844.name: Sector 6
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

177846.name: War Blades
177846.description:
From the RPG website:
“War Blades” è il gioco di ruolo di ambientazione Fantasy autoprodotto dall’Associazione Culturale “La Centuria” con pagine riccamente illustrate da Marika Boero - autrice del manga italiano Il Cerchio del Destino - e Giorgio Cavagnaro.

English translation:
War Blades" is a fantasy role-playing game self-published by the gamer club "La Centuria", illustrated by Marika Boero - author of Italian manga Circle of Doom - and Giorgio Cavagnaro.

177848.name: House of Nightmares B-Movie Edition
177848.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A horror B-Movie inspired game with visuals and game play from the creators childhood.

177849.description:
A total of eight promo cards included with Eminent Domain: Microcosm for play with Eminent Domain. The cards include three Politics cards and five different Scenario Cards. By name, the Scenarios included with these promos are Bountiful Harvest, Mobilized, Network Admin, Terraformer, and War Path.

These scenarios can be used with the base game of Eminent Domain, no expansions are required. Of course, they can also be used if playing with any/all of the expansions as well.
177849.name: Eminent Domain: Base Game Scenarios Promo

177851.name: A Knight At The Opera
177851.description:
Horatio D'arven's new play "Jolene and the falcon" breaks women's hearts coast-to-coast. But they are not the only ones with a soft core, because the legendary Holy Order of the Bulky Knights decided to come and see the latest performance, too. And strangely nobody wants to sit next to them and their spiky elbow-guards.

A Knight At The Opera is an abstract game for two to four players, utilizing mechanics like tile placement and area control to simulate the tumultuous processes at the opera house. Players will need to seat male and female audience members next to each other to score points. But perhaps the ladies will fall in love with one of the valiant knights in the end?

177852.description:
User summary:

Become the head of a mole household and explore for treasure in a nearby cave.

Each turn, players may either draw from the tile bag and place their spoils in the "search pile", or move the entire contents of the "search pile" to their home for safekeeping. Just be sure to watch out for ghosts tiles which cause a player to love everything they haven't stored at home.

The first player to get 10 points worth of treasure to their home wins.
177852.name: Father Mole Looks for the Treasure

177853.name: Mythic Mortals
177853.description: Mythic Mortals is a game of normal people wielding Ancient power. Inspired by Avengers, Devil May Cry, X-men, and 300; Mythic Mortals aims to bring that kind of over-the-top action and adventure to the table. Utilizing a unique card-based loadout system, players can customize their powers and weapons in mid-combat; switching from a ranged sniper to a close-up brawler in between turns. Mythic Mortals is perfect for a quick game of epic combat.

177854.description:
The Ginger Wars is a game of battling gingerbread people. Each player has 5 character pieces in which they protect and battle others for their pieces. The first person to complete a brand new gingerbread person wins the game.

It's fast paced where you're constantly attacking and defending with your battle cards. You have to be smart and pick your opponents wisely, manage your revolving deck of cards and keep track of what others have played. You need to get your bluffing game going. Get people to waste their strength and attack them when their momentarily weak.

The Ginger Wars aims to appeal to the casual and more experienced gamers. It doesn't take long to learn the rules, but playing your opponents like a fiddle will take time.
177854.name: The Ginger Wars

177855.name: No Quarter (Issue 36 - May 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Painting Challenge: Let the Banners Fly
177855.description:
Warmachine: Wrath Preview III
Forces of Distinction III
Guts & Gears: War Hog
Studio Secrets: Minimalist Mega-Army
Unbound Rules
Power Progression: Circle Orboros
Strategic Academy: Cygnar
Modeling & Painting: Gemstones

177856.name: Dinosaur Math
177856.description:
Dinosaur Math consists of 1 double-sided game board, 4 dinosaur counters, 2 number dice and 1 operations die. Each side of the game board is a different game.

Dino Tracks: Each player chooses a dinosaur marker and places it on the same colour start space. The youngest player goes first. Both number dice are rolled and the player adds the numbers together and moves that number of spaces on the board. The first player to move their dinosaur to the home space is the winner.

Dino Stomp: Each player chooses a dinosaur marker and places it on the same colour start space, and rolls the two number dice. The highest number goes first. Players roll all 3 dice and use the numbers and operation shown to determine what number of spaces to move. Some spaces have instructions on them. The first player to reach the finish space is the winner.

177857.description:
Explore a fascinating world similar to that of ancient Greece, full of magic, technological development, and weird customs; in a kingdom mired in court intrigue, seductive women and sword fights; a world of a bloody revolution in which your ancestry no longer matters. It is all about survival and spilling blood in the struggle for the throne in the kingdom of Troy.

Achaia is a tactical game with only one goal: Become the ruler of Troy. Each player represents a noble house, and you try to survive at all costs by use of all kinds of manipulation and foul play. But beware, you will need to avoid the scheming of your envious, vicious and relentless enemies...
177857.name: Achaia

177858.name: Ovocníci
177858.description:
Game based on the animated TV series for children Fruittis.
Players roll the dice and move their token through the board. Their goal is to collect as many cards that can be obtained for stepping on the field or by passing the circuit through playing plan. The game ends at the moment when the first player gets the cards to all eight characters, winning player with the most cards.

177859.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Mark of Madness
boardgameexpansion: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
177859.description:
Description from the publisher:

"There is a whole secret cult of evil men (a man of your mystical erudition will understand me when I link them with Hastur and the Yellow Sign)…"
–H.P. Lovecraft, The Whisperer in Darkness

The Mark of Madness is the tenth deluxe expansion for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, introducing 165 new cards (three copies each of 55 different cards) that explore those depths of insanity that lie near the core of the Lovecraftian mythos. Devoted primarily to the Hastur faction, The Mark of Madness introduces a great number of deranged Artists, Cultists, and Lunatics, as well as the terrible, ancient powers that spur them forward. As Hastur's secret cult expands its powers, you'll also find a maddening array of new characters, support cards, conspiracies, and events, most of which lend new strength to the game's Terror struggle and mechanics for insanity.

Additionally, as Hastur's madness reaches outward to all of the game's eight factions, each gains a powerful new character that enters play insane and reshapes the game when it is restored. It's unknown whether or not these new characters will be able to prevent Hastur's followers from plunging the world into a new age of terror and chaos, but they gain additional support from other characters, events, and support cards.

177860.name: A Golden Game of Biology
177860.description:
A children's game that teaches about the development of life on earth. Players spin the spinner and move their dinosaur-shaped pawn that number of spaces, which correspond to different species. They progress from micro-organisms through plants to invertebrates and then vertebrates, each time doing ocean life and then land life. There are numerous squares that make you go back 2 if you land on them, and the last 5 spaces must be landed on by exact count, all giving a catch-up mechanism.

The back of the board has family trees for the plant and animal kingdoms, and charts showing forms of life appearing during different epochs of earth history.

boardgameintegration: Normandy, The Beginning of the End
Normandy, The Beginning of the End
177861.description:
Paths to Hell (PTH) (Volume III) is a stand-alone game in the War Storms series. Recreates the events of those days and allows the players to reproduce the most famous battles of the Blitzkrieg on the East Front at a tactical level. Players take command of either the Allied or Axis forces (or can play solitaire) in the tactical battles of each scenario.

PTH while utilizing "La Bataille de France, 1940" base rules, incorporates new and adapted rules and additions for this new front. The WSS promises many hours of fierce fighting between the infantry, tanks, artillery and aircraft belonging to the armies enveloped in this conflict. Just a few of the additions include:


Human wave attacks
Battalion officers
Communist Commissars
Recon rules
Flamethrower tanks
Motorcycle recon
Waffen SS
Rumnanian
Gully
Rail Roads
One 8'5 x 11" chart with many overlays


PTH has a moderate complexity with good solitaire suitability. The system emphasizes the role of officers. Officers can activate units, coordinate with other officers and their units, call for artillery support, air support, smoke screens, influence moral checks, coordinate assaults, and much more. Rules for special actions.

Based on the principle of simultaneous execution, or simply "WE GO", a hybrid system of turns and "real time". The players must activate unit leaders to perform many actions (fire, assault, move, coordinate, etc). A turn ends when both players have completed all their activations. The scale is platoon level with units

representing groups of between 30 and 40 soldiers, weapons units represents groups of 3-4 weapons and their accompanying crews (20-25 soldiers), and the AFvs-Transports representing groups of 3 to 5 vehicles and their corresponding crews. Scenarios are divided into turns representing about 12-15 minutes of action.

Turns are divided into the following phases: Command Phase, Initiative Phase, Activation Phase and Marker Removal Phase

The game uses isomorphic mapboards, each of which are aligned to any edge of equal length on any other mopboard. This allows for an almost unlimited number of combinations to create any terrain situation, including player designed scenarios. Each map hex represents a distance of approximately 150 to 200 metres.

Components
4 Isomorphic Maps
8 Overlays
5 sheets of Counters (3 of 5/8” and 2 of 3/4”)
1 Standard Rulebook
1 Exclusive Rulebook
7 Scenario Cards featuring 13 scenarios
3 Charts and Table Cards
2 Battalion Charts Cards
2 six-side dice
177861.name: Paths to Hell
boardgameexpansion: Alone in the Storm: Solo Play Expansion for War Storm Series

177862.name: Planet Mercenary
177862.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




The gun-toting, maxim-quoting, space-opera RPG. Set in the universe of Schlock Mercenary, by Howard Tayler

At its core, the game uses a simple stat-plus-die mechanic for determining success or failure of a given activity. The dice in use are six-sided, and players will need three of them. Preferably three per player. Oh, and one of each set of three dice should be readily distinguishable from the other two, because you’ll need more than just sum of the rolled dice—you’ll need a few of the permutations. 6, 2, and 4 is a different roll than 2, 4, and 6. This is less confusing than it sounds at first, and it’s what makes the D6³ system so versatile.

In the very first Schlock Mercenary strip we learn the slogan of Captain Tagon’s company: Travel the galaxy, meet fascinating new life forms, and kill them. That slogan provides a solid, thematic underpinning for this project. From character generation forward your party is part of a mercenary organization that you’ll define, and your adventures will invite you to function as a team.

- From schlocktroops.com, the designers' website.

177863.name: No Quarter (Issue 37 - Jul 2011)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
177863.description:
Hordes: Domination Preview
Warmachine Video Game Update
Guts & Gears: Ogrun Assault Corps
Alexia Goes Epic (Witchfire Trilogy modules)
Modeling & Painting: Epic Alexia
Dead Stop (Fiction by Aeryn Rudel)
Unbound Scenarios
Battle Report: Grave Reckoning

177864.name: Das Sprungbrett
177864.description: The first player to get his 2 pawns from space 1 to space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by 1 or 2 dies. If a pawn lands on a space with the number 10 or a multiple of 10, its next roll counts double. A pawn that gets on a space with a square number automatically advances by as much spaces as the numbers square root. Spaces with prime numbers can only be left by rolling a prime number.

177866.name: Sea Monster (ICONS)
177866.description:
From publisher blurb:

Worlds Most Wanted helps you get to the fun faster with pregenerated villains and adventure hooks.

Bertram Ackermann was a leader in the field of marine biology and genetics. One day, something happened in his state of the art underwater lab. The lab was destroyed, and Bertram was changed forever.
As “The Sea Monster”, Ackermann claims to be sent by the ocean itself to punish mankind for all it has done to her.

177867.name: No Quarter (Issue 38 - Sep 2011)
177867.description:
Hordes: Domination Preview II
Guts & Gears: Vessel of Judgment
Gavyn Kyle Files: Kayazy Underbosses
Unbound Formations
Tournaments 101: Time Management
Lock & Load Recap
Power Progression: Unbound
Forces of Distinction V

177868.name: Game Election
177868.description:
Game Election is a simple and intuitive card game to help a group of 3-6 players decide which game to play in a fun and fair manner.

The 54 card deck is comprised of six different sets of nine cards (YEA, DOUBLE YEAH, NAY, and VETO), and four of the cards have special powers such Cancel a Vote and Break Ties. But the powers have consequences: swap another player's cast vote and they get to chose your color/faction in the winning game!

Gameplay is fast: players nominate up to 8 games and then place their votes in a face-down pile in front of the game. They may then use their one remaining card's special power... if they choose.

177869.name: The Tower Vault Heist
177869.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Compatible Adventure for 3rd to 4th level characters.

With notes for a follow-on adventure for 5th to 10th level characters.

This adventure is designed to be placed and run in any fantasy setting.

A tower has sunk under the waves, with only the top still being accessable. A mysterious letter holds the key to breaking into the tower and penetrating the security to reach the treasure vault at the bottom. Can the players sneak through to steal their prize and then fight their way out or will the tower's security defeat them?

177871.name: Costume Party
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ryan Reviews: Costume Party
177871.description:
Costume Party is a quick card game about bluffing, memory, and looking great. The goal is to score the most points among several rounds of play by wearing certain costumes.

Each round, players have a hand of three cards and can play one of five corny costumes -- Vampire, Mummy, Robot, Ghost, Zombie, or one half of a Horse costume -- and each costume works a little differently. For example, you win 6 points if you and another player can coordinate a Horse costume... but lose 3 points if you go as just a Horse's bottom.

177872.name: The Halls of Hellfire (Pathfinder)
177872.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4–5 Characters Level 10–11

The Halls of Hellfire is a former holy site and part of a fortress deep within the rocky deserts of the South. It was always seen as hallowed ground and was revered by the many nomadic clans that travelled those deep deserts. Indeed it was once seen by all as neutral ground, and often used to settle disputes, enjoy celebrations and trade between themselves, but is now shunned.

However, several dozen years ago, the Halls were used by the exiled sorcerer Mennu the Betrayer to summon an unnamed demon as old as time itself; in the process Mennu lost control, his life and his soul, and the demon furiously razed the remnants of the fortress to the ground, before returning to the Abyss. All that was left was the deepest portion of the underground chambers, long since hidden and occupied by creatures that thrive on the residual evil that permeates this site.

177873.name: Wor Briefs: Gobs o' Trouble!
177873.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a chance encounter on the road turns out to have a more nefarious story behind it than meets the eye, you've got Gobs o' Trouble!

Are you up to the challenge?

Within these covers you'll find 8 pages of adventure, perfect for either a one­off scenario or to drop into an existing campaign as a side quest. Inside you’ll find:

A complete adventure stemming from a single roadside encounter
A campaign map showing the adventure location in Alia­Wor
An area map detailing the main adventure locations
An optional encounter to beef up the adventure if desired
Notes on how Goblins and Hobgoblins fit in the world of Alia­Wor
Information on Hobgoblin weapons (the Ripper and the Lighter)
Tips on scaling the adventure for lower or higher powered parties




Gobs o’ Trouble! can be used as is, or molded to fit the Referee’s existing campaign. Also, being usable as a short scenario, it’s great for convention play, and is an excellent way to introduce players to Swords & Wizardry or the Realms of Wor!

177874.name: Conflict of Plants
177874.description:
Welcome to the complex world of plants. A place where thriving depends on strategy, tactics and maybe a tiny bit of luck .

Plants compete to be the most successful wild plant. Players will be deciding how to use their resources to best support their plants'
success in this game's environment. Conflict of Plants at its core is both an action selection and an area control game, but with a twist. The environment does not always favor the most abundant species.

The game consists of 6 rounds. Each round excluding the first, the player with the fewest points swaps two on-map Non-White Tokens with those of the randomly-chosen icons. Each player, in turn order, sends their cubes to tiles have an icon that matches the icon played to their Player mat. Players then in turn perform one action each three times.

Each player then places one Brown Token onto an empty corner of a tile in the map again matching an icon to what was played on their Player Mat. The map is then examined in order to award points and Brown Tokens. The players then balance each region by removing cubes from each tile until the number of Player Cubes in total is equal to or less than the region’s number.

Finally, the players clean up their Player Mats to prepare for the next round.

177875.description:
In The Last Spike, players must cooperate to build a continuous railway from St. Louis to Sacramento. Different routes are possible and some towns never get a railway link. Each player competes to accumulate the most money from land speculation before the "last spike" is laid.

Each player has a hand of four track tiles, with each tile showing a particular location on the game board and a cost. The game board depicts nine cities in a diamond shape, with St. Louis at one tip and Sacramento at the other, and locations where track can be built are marked on the game board.

On a turn, a player places one of their track tiles in the appropriate space, paying the cost while doing so. (If a player can't afford to place track, they must sell one or more of their train deeds to raise cash.) If the player is the first to place adjacent to a city, they gain a deed to that city for free. After placing a tile, a player can purchase one deed for a city.

Whenever two cities are connected, all holders of the deeds for those two cities receive funds from the bank based on the number of deeds they hold. A city will pay out 0-4 times depending on where it is and how track is built during the game.

When a player places a tile that creates a contiguous track from St. Louis to Sacramento, this player receives a $20,000 bonus, everyone receives a deed payout for the cities just connected, then the game ends. Whoever has the most cash wins.
177875.name: The Last Spike
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
Episode 41 - Viticulture Essential Edition BA Holiday Special
RDTN Episode 83 – Fortress Around Your Heart – Stronghold 2nd Edition Review and a bunch more
Vox Republica 088: Con Season Anticipation

177876.name: 1653: Sailors and Merchants
177876.description:
In the seventeenth century, the Caribbean, was an area little explored and full of adventure, where the intrepid crews traded and discovered valuable treasures.

Choose your crew, your cargo and weapons, and sailing in the Caribbean, seeking fame and riches.

In 1653: Sailors and Merchants, you will use your ship , which is represented by a deck of cards (which you will change during the game) in order to get the most possible fame points.


En el Siglo XVII, el Caribe, era un área poco explorada y llena de aventuras, donde las tripulaciones intrépidas comerciaban y descubrían valiosos tesoros.

Elige tu tripulación, tu carga y tus armas, y navega el Caribe en busca de fama y riquezas.

En "1653: Marineros y Mercaderes", usarás tu barco, que es representado por un mazo de cartas (que irá cambiando a lo largo de la partida) para conseguir la mayor cantidad de puntos de fama.

177877.description:
SiXeS is about things that are similar and different. Play six rounds, thinking of six things each round and trying to predict what you will write that will match — or not match — what the other players write, depending on whether you are in a "match" round or a "unique" round. The player with the most points after six rounds wins.

SiXeS is #6 in the E•G•G Series from Eagle-Gryphon Games.
177877.name: SiXeS

177879.name: Hongerige Harrie
177879.description:
Harrie has eaten all your stuff. Try to pick them one by one out of his mouth. He's asleep. Watch out! Don't wake him, he'll grab your hand!

Is the object you grabbed colored? Well done! Did you grab an insect or a black object? Ouch! You have to put the item back into Harrie's mouth and you lose one of your collected items.

When Harrie bites while your hand is in his mouth, you lose 2 of your collected items.

The first player to collect 5 items, wins the game.

There is a special scoring system for older children.

177880.name: Connect 4 & More
177880.description:
From the publisher:

Play Classic Connect 4 - and MORE! There are 3 NEW Connect 4 games: Backwards Connect 4, Connect 4 Any Color and Connect 4 Teams! Contains 40 Heavy Duty cardboard tiles (20 red and 20 yellow) and illustrated instructions for 6 different games!

177881.name: No Quarter (Issue 27 - Nov 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Sign and Sigil: Order of the Golden Crucible
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Victoria Haley and Denegrah
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
177881.description:

Bosun's Call
News From the Front
New Releases
2009 Formula P3 Grandmaster Painting Competition

Power Progression: Cygnar

177883.name: Game Tycoon 1.5
177883.description:
User Summary

Set in the 1980s, you select a persona and take the place of a game developer, getting banks and product in line to make money. Balancing suppliers and market changes, technological changes reflect the changing trends in video games.

177884.name: The Abyss (Issue 8 - Jul 1980)
rpgissuearticle: Radiation Damage in Role Playing Games
177884.description:

rpgissuearticle: Simple Realism:  A New Damage System
177886.description:

New Magic Items

New Vision Spells for the Blind
Sorcery Detailed
Artificers, a NPC Class
The Role of Assassins

177887.description:
The Villager Start Card Expansion includes one card/tile that may be used with all Spurs and Sprockets card/tile decks.

The Villager is placed in the field first and the start player places his/her card/tile adjacent to the Villager. Play continues based on which Spurs and Sprockets rules you have decided to play with. The Villager card/tile has no lines in any directions and can't be added to any player's adjacent rows for attacking, defending or scoring purposes. It works as a blocking mechanism. The Villager may be destroyed by using Tic Attack Toe or Fired Away rules.
177887.name: Spurs and Sprockets: Villager Start Card Expansion

177888.name: Ultima V: Lazarus
177888.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Ultima V: Warriors of Destiny.




Ultima V: Lazarus is a fan-made remake of Ultima V. The game uses Gas Powered Games' Dungeon Siege engine, and that game is required to play the remake. It is an attempt to reconstruct the original title, including an elaborated plot, strategy elements and updated conversational mechanisms to resemble modern game dialog systems.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ultima V: Lazarus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

177889.name: The Blue Flamingo
177889.description:
Every now and then, pilots from all over the world join to challenge each other in a big competition. They take turns finishing a dangerous track filled with foes, hoping to dominate the score table.
Your team is making the final preparations. The band are setting up to perform. And your ship - ”The Blue Flamingo” stands ready and waiting in the hangar...

A handmade world
We have created the game world and its inhabitants entirely with handcrafted miniatures. This graphical style is the result of a collaboration between Might and Delight and a set designer/model maker.
A 32 feet long handcrafted model was made specially for the game, along with countless props and assets that were filmed and photographed. The green screened material was made in to sprites and combined with the background to mesh the visual image together.
All the effects, rocket flares and explosions were created using firecrackers and other pyrotechnics. Strings with magnets pulling cars, small lighted miniature trains and shiny animated cloth are all details in the process behind The Blue Flamingo world.

Invest VS Interest
Like every other Shmup, this is a game that challenges you to reach the highest possible score. This is made interesting by an economical system that allows you to invest your score in upgrades, which makes earning more score points easier.
On the other end, you are rewarded with interest on what is left of your score when you progress to the next level. You have to make a choice - to upgrade and try to regain the score, or rely on your skills to beat the increasingly difficult levels.
Use your greed wisely to beat your friends and climb up the score table.

Source: The Publisher Website.

177890.name: Eidolon
177890.description:
Eidolon is a game about exploring a mysterious landscape and uncovering the stories of the people who lived there once before. It is a game about history, curiosity, interconnectedness, and the slow and inevitable beauty of life.

You will be dropped into the dreary and mystical Western Washington circa 2400 c.e. with little to guide your way. Awaiting you is a vast landscape filled with wildlife, edible plants, and the memories of our now-dead culture—stored in artefacts such as journals, sketchbooks, newspapers, zines, brochures, transcripts, blogs, and more. Collect these memories and piece together what happened to these people.

FEATURES:
- Over 150 documents telling the interconnected stories of dozens of characters across hundreds of years.
- An enormous, hand-sculpted Western Washington that takes multiple hours to cross.
- Day/night cycle and dynamic weather.
- Varied flora and fauna (both predators and prey).

Source: The Developer Website.

177891.name: Alanori Krónika (Issue 145 - Mar/Apr 2008)
rpgissuearticle: HKK versenyek márciusban, áprilisban és májusban

177892.name: Shadow Warrior Classic Redux
177892.description:
​The definitive version of the cult classic shooter, Shadow Warrior Classic Redux features remastered visuals and two massive expansion packs. Corporations rule every facet of life in a near-future Japan and employ Shadow Warriors, one-man armies of unparalleled skill, to protect their power and forcefully remove all opposition.

The Zilla Corporation is the most powerful of these conglomerates and will stop at nothing to achieve domination unseen by any other corporation in the world. Lo Wang, Zilla Corporation’s legendary Shadow Warrior, discovers this corruption and the dark powers being summoned to aid his employers in this quest for absolute power. As a man of honor, Lo Wang vows to battle these demonic forces with an arsenal of explosive weapons, his silent blade, and a razor sharp wit.

Source: The Publisher Website.

177893.name: Astraterra: Pelivalmiit hahmolomakkeet
177893.description:
Description in english:
Package contains 40 ready-to-play character sheets for Astraterra adventure RPG. Each race and role have five prefilled sheets, with which starting to play is quick and easy. All races' and roles' preliminary information is already printed in the sheets. Just choose your character's talent and starting gear and throw the dice for starting money and you are ready for adventure!

Sheets are printed on sturdy cardstock that endures hard use and is easy to handle.

Description in finnish:
Pakkaus sisältää 40 pelivalmista hahmolomaketta Astraterra-seikkailuroolipeliin. Kullekin lajille ja roolille löytyy viisi esitäytettyä lomaketta, joidenka avulla pelaamisen aloittaminen on nopeaa ja vaivatonta. Kaikki lajien ja roolien oletustiedot on merkitty valmiiksi ylös lomakkeisiin. Valitse vain hahmosi lahjakkuus ja aloitusvarusteet sekä heitä nopalla montako kultarahaa tuoreen sankarisi kukkarossa on ja olet valmis seikkailuun!

Lomakkeet on painettu kartongille, jotka kestävät käyttöä ja niitä on helppo käsitellä.

177894.name: Astraterra: Kertojan Näkösuoja
177894.description:
Description translated to english:
Stroryteller's screen is handy accessory for the storyteller. The screen is put standing on the table and behind it is easy to hide adventure notes and in addition the storytellers side of the screen has nifty printed all srts of tables and rule references to help memory. What treasures does the creature have? Don't worry, throw dice and check from the table what riches the adventurers find. How many extra dice did a shield give for defence? Ah, there it is written in sight.

The screen is approx. 60cm wide, can be folded in three parts for transport and storage.

Description in finnish:
Kertojan näkösuoja on kätevä lisäväline kertojalle. Näkösuoja asetetaan pöydälle pystyyn ja sen taakse on helppo kätkeä muistiinpanot seikkailuista ja kaiken lisäksi kertojan puolelle näkösuojaa on painettu näppärästi erilaisia taulukoita ja sääntötiivistelmiä muistiavuksi. Mitä aarteita otukselta löytyy? Ei hätää! Heitä nopalla taulukosta mitä rikkauksia sankarit löytävät? Kuinka monta apunoppaa kilpi antoi puolustukseen? Ah! Siinähän se on kätevästi näkyvillä.

Näkösuoja on kolmen noin 60 cm levyinen ja se taittuu kätevästi kolmeen osaan säilytystä ja kuljetusta varten.

177895.name: Astraterra: Olentohavaintomuistio
177895.description:
Description translated to english:
The Creature Observation Archive collects explorers observations of creatures and animals all-over Astraterra. By writing down your own observations to the Archive you help other explorers to avoid danger and find help during their expeditions.

This Creature Observation Archive Notepad is officially approved by the Astraterra Explorer Society.

Description in finnish:
Olentohavaintoarkistoon kerätään löytöretkeilijöiden havaintoja olennoista ja eläimistä kaikkialta Astraterrasta. Kirjaamalla omat havaintosi arkistoon autat muita löytöretkeilijöitä välttämään vaaroja ja löytämään apua tutkimusmatkoillaan.

Tämä OLENTOHAVAINTOARKISTON muistilehtiö on Astraterran löytöretkeilijäinseuran virallisesti hyväksymä muistiinpanoapuväline.

177896.name: Godmind (4E)
177896.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the tenth adventure in the ZEITGEIST adventure path!

This is the D&D 4th Edition version of this adventure.

An Age of Reason. An Age of Darkness.

The Obscurati have won. Across the world, peoples' minds turn to rationality and industriousness - ideals of Nicodemus, the conspiracy's founder. But even as the Ob form a world government, strange side effects of this Great Eclipse begin to arise.

Thoughts in crowds begin to link into great hiveminds, subsuming free will and even manifesting as monsters. Ancient titans long ago subdued by the ways of magic awaken and contest for their land. And the sun and the stars themselves have vanished, save for an ominous nebula shaped like two crushing gears, which grows slowly closer day by day.

Only the nation of Risur resists the Ob's control, and its people look to the heroes for salvation. Will they be able to defend their homeland and thwart the Obscurati's plans to unify all civilization, before those efforts awakan an all-consuming horror: a Godmind?

An adventure for rebellious heroes of levels 23-25.

177897.description:
The darkness spread all around the chamber with the quiet howling in the background. There was a spectral sensation in the room, dark and ominous. Don’t get spooked though and sit around the mystic board in a vain hope to catch the spirit... Before it will manage to catch you.
Third Eye is the truly terrifying hybrid card game of cutthroat decisions, quick wit and brutal interactions. Be the last one to survive a haunting from beyond and never hesitate to lead the malignant presence towards other, unfortunate souls!
177897.name: Third Eye

177898.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 1 - Jun 1987)
177898.description:
User summary
The first Pegasus issue contains a few creatures, an article with rules suggestions for adventures set in (or travels through) moors and marshland, and the first part of a two-part scenario.

177899.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 2 - Sep 1987)
177899.description:
User summary
The second issue concludes the scenario begun in #1, contains creatures, a magical object, and setting description.

177900.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 3 - Nov 1987)
177900.description:
User summary
Pegasus #3 contains a scenario designed to test the characters' (and players') knowledge about Aventurien, the main DSA setting. It also includes another article on the Bamuhr/ Hamecon setting, and new magic spells.

177901.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 4 - Feb 1988)
177901.description:
User summary
Pegasus no. 4 contains a review, small convention (?) report, an article on Aventurian cults, and creatures

177902.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 5 - May 1988)
177902.description:
User summary
Pegasus #5 expands to 24 pages and contains, apart from the usually long letters section, a short story, review, and new talents/ feats, as well as new spells for DSA.

177903.description:
Dominion: Guilds & Cornucopia combines the Dominion: Guilds and Dominion: Cornucopia small box expansions — originally the fifth and the eighth expansions — into a single large box expansion.

The cards from Dominion: Cornucopia — 13 new Kingdom cards, plus 5 unique cards — are focused on variety, with cards that reward you for having a variety of cards in your deck, in your hand, and in play, in addition to cards that help you get that variety.

Dominion: Guilds also consists of 13 new Kingdom cards, with some of these cards allowing you to get more out of them by paying extra when you buy them. In addition, this expansion contains coin tokens that you can save to spend later.

Part of the Dominion series.
177903.name: Dominion: Guilds & Cornucopia

177904.name: Hay Bales
177904.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 252nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features hay bales on a harvested field or meadow.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

177905.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 121 - Mar 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey
Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay: The Gathering Storm
177905.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177906.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 6 - Sep 1988)
177906.description:
User summary
PS 6 contains a new Bamuhr article, a review, new Aventurian cults, and second installment of the short story.

rpgissuearticle: Warhammer: Invasion — March of the Damned
177911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

177912.name: Der Pegasus (Issue 7 - Jan 1989)
177912.description:
User summary
Pegasus issue 7 contains an article on druid magic, another on the pegasus (as creature), continues story, and magical artefacts.

177913.name: AdVenture Capitalist
177913.description:
Welcome, eager young investor, to AdVenture Capitalist! Arguably the world's greatest Capitalism simulator!

Have you always dreamed of owning your own business? Being the master of your own destiny? Forming your own multi-national conglomerate to create a world-wide, monopolistic economy? Then AdVenture Capitalist is the game for YOU!

Begin your quest for world domination by clicking on the Lemonade Stand progress bar. Keep clicking until you can afford to pay for more squeezers! Now you’ve got the hang of it.

Hire employees, purchase cutting edge upgrades, dominate the market, and attract eager Angel Investors to boost your profits! The only way to go is UP UP UP!

AdVenture Capitalist - you can't spell hedge fund without F U N!

Source: The Developer Website.

177914.description:
Your ancestors were more than mortal: they were travelers of untold lands, legendary figures battling the primeval forces of the world… or even embracing them. So what does that make you?

Norsaga: Into the Myths is an expansion for the puzzle battle card game Norsaga. New types of advanced heroes add unique mechanics and embellishments, while additional basic heroes allow you to increase the player count.

Combine these cards with the hero cards from the base game to maximize the strategic possibilities and player interaction in each game, or tailor the complexity to your liking by picking and choosing which new cards to use.
177914.name: Norsaga: Into the Myths

177915.name: Interregnum (Issue 6 - Sep 1994)
177915.description:
Editorial

177919.name: Rise of the Triad
177919.description:
Rise of the Triad is a first-person shooter developed by Interceptor Entertainment and published by Apogee Software for Windows in 2013. The game is a remake of the original Rise of the Triad: Dark War published by Apogee in 1995.

The gameplay has been touted as a throwback to classic first-person shooters of the 1990s such as the original Rise of the Triad . It features non-linear level design, a high rate of player movespeed, multiple playable characters and an arsenal of over the top explosive weaponry recreated from the original game. The game consists of 20 levels (plus four secret levels) spread across four episodes as well as an online multiplayer component which features Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch and Capture the Flag game modes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rise of the Triad (2013 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

177920.name: 20 Questions (Pepys Party Game)
177920.description:
A spoken party game in which players try to guess the object on the card using closed questions (that can only be answered 'Yes', 'No', or 'Maybe'). If players fail to guess correctly within 20 questions the answerer wins.

Based on the BBC Radio panel game show (which was itself based on a US radio show derived from a 19th century parlour game) the package contains twelve object cards with enough information to answer most questions.

177921.name: Death Wish
177921.description:
Death Wish is a light-hearted party card game where the goal is to be the first player to die from fictional diseases. Truly a game you're dying to win.

Players take turns to collect matching symptoms and afflicters with the aim of contracting the diseases displayed on the table. Diseases are always changing on the table so it’s a race before they’re snapped up by other players. The colours play a part in the game with white strains the most common, less harmful types contrasted with the rare and deadly reds.

Share your weird diagnosis! Contract a disease and declare the the disease you caught, how you caught it and the terrible combination of symptoms you are suffering from. With over 240 different diseases, afflicters and symptoms, the combinations are vast.

Does your disease have an outbreak? Read out an outbreak card to the group. Outbreaks allow events such as mutating diseases, puking on players or even de-fibrillating someone back to life. These cards have an array of random creative effects that change the dynamic of every game.

177926.name: BOXBOY!
177926.description:
"Box Boy! is a platform game in which players control a box-shaped character named Qbby as he makes his way through each level. The source of the game's mechanics come from Qbby's ability to spawn boxes out of his body, the number of which varies between each level. These boxes can spread out in whatever direction is possible to make various shapes and can either be carried or thrown and pushed around. The boxes have various uses, such as allowing players to reach high ledges or cross large gaps, holding down switches, or blocking deadly lasers. Additionally, by hooking these boxes onto a ledge while Qbby is still attached, he can pull himself up.

Each level features one or more crowns, which can be collected with advanced play but will become uncollectable if the player uses too many boxes during a level. These crowns unlock additional worlds as the game progresses. Medals obtained from clearing each level can be spent on extras, such as costumes, technique manuals, and bonus levels."

Source: Wikipedia, "Box Boy!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

177927.description:
Res Publica returns with a new version under a different theme. In Res Publica: 2230AD, the players travel to the future, when races migrate through space searching for new areas in which to settle. Intensive trading brings together strong Races, encourages new settlements and promotes the development of civilization.

Each turn is divided in three different phases: Trade, Display and Draw cards. Each player at his turn can make a trade offer and each player in turn responds in kind. Using the cards through trading and drawing players work to acquire five identical race cards in order to build a Space Station (which increases the number of cards you can draw each turn) or five identical technology cards in order to build a City (which gives Victory Points). A variant play has been created in this game where each player, owns a planet divided in four different missions. If a mission is accomplished, more Victory Points are added to the sum and if a player completes all missions game ends.

Aside the set collection and trading mechanisms, you will discover some extra cards in the game. New buildings with different abilities that either allow you to build a City displaying four technology cards, or give you extra Victory Points. At the end of the game, players total the points collected and the highest score wins.

177931.name: A Conta da Copa é Nossa!
177931.description:
A Conta da Copa é Nossa! is a card game who pictures the process of building the infrastructure of Brazil's 2014 World Cup.

Each player represents a contractor which competes with other players to gain more profit and participation in the constructions. To achieve their goals, the players will have at their disposal a humorous deck of illustrated cards with politicians and characters which can help you with many tasks: gain favors, spoil the adversaries, work around difficult situations, among other things.

At the beginning, each player gets 20 cards of characters. Three piles are stocked at the center of the table: constructions, governors, and sponsors. After that, 8 construction cards, 1 governor and 2 sponsors are removed from their piles, and the players can use them, replacing the cards as they are used. There are material tokens that make constructions possible. They are obtained by using the characters and politicians cards.

Each construction sums points to a total, and the highest total wins the game.

177935.name: Fate Codex (Vol 2, Issue 1 - Mar 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Bringing DFRG into the Atomic Robot era
Deck of FATE: Variant FATE points
177935.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fate Codex is a mostly-monthly e-zine featuring Quick Start Adventures and more for the Fate roleplaying system. The project, funded through Patreon, grows and swells as more patrons support our work. We've been lucky to have lots of folks pledge, and we're now entering our second year of production!

Our backers have enabled us to not only hire great authors, but also to include great art in every issue. Issue 1 of Volume 2 features Marissa Kelly, Juan Ochoa, Olivia Boyd, and Kaitlynn Peavler! There's some great work in this piece and over 10,000 words of awesome Fate content, ready to be thrown into your next game of Fate.

Now we're bringing this content to you on DriveThruRPG, so you can find and download your issues easily. Since every title is saved to your library on the site, you'll always have The Fate Codex right at hand when you need it.

In this first issue, we've got:

Heather Beauregard's conversion document, Bringing DFRPG into the Atomic Robo Era, for the Dresden Files Roleplaying Game to Fate Core, with a special section making use of new Fate ideas from Atomic Robo.
Jacob Possin's guide to running short Fate games, Two Hour Fate, that can fit into anyone's busy schedule.
Mark Diaz Truman's new Deck of Fate system, Deck of Fate: Variant Fate Points, that brings new excitement to invoking aspects with cards
Brendan Conway's quick start adventure, Primal World, that brings the Chaos Worlds setting (usually for Dungeon World) to Fate Core for the first time. Create a new world before it's snuffed out by the forces of chaos and darkness!

177936.name: Fate Codex (Vol 2, Issue 2 - May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: About the FATE Codex vol. 2, issue 2
177936.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fate Codex is a mostly-monthly e-zine featuring Quick Start Adventures and more for the Fate roleplaying system. The project, funded through Patreon, grows and swells as more patrons support our work. We've been lucky to have lots of folks pledge, and we're now entering our second year of production!

Our backers have enabled us to not only hire great authors, but also to include great art in every issue. Issue 2 of Volume 2 features Marissa Kelly, Mike Mumah, and Juan Ochoa! There's some great work in this piece and over 10,000 words of awesome Fate content, ready to be thrown into your next game of Fate.

Now we're bringing this content to you on DriveThruRPG, so you can find and download your issues easily. Since every title is saved to your library on the site, you'll always have The Fate Codex right at hand when you need it.

In this second issue of Volume 2, we've got:

Clark Valentine's guide to using corruption as a devil's bargain in Corruption in Fate Accelerated.
Jason Corley's tips on using GM-prepared aspects, Pre-Generated Aspects, to help players jump directly into intriguing Fate fiction.
Mark Diaz Truman's essay, At What Cost, that contrasts Fate with Apocalypse World to learn new things about the nature of Fate conflicts
Marissa Kelly's quick start adventure, Forged by Fates, a two-player plus GM adventure set in a Greek-inspired world filled with monsters and warlords.

177937.description:
The third expansion to For the Crown, Between Heaven and Earth, introduces 12 new kinds of variable cards and 10 new types of units that can be trained using the new cards, in addition to an alternate starting card, the Merchant. You can mix and match cards from the original game with any 2nd Edition expansion.

Note: This expansion kit cannot be used with the first edition of For the Crown.

177939.description:
Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

The Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-­Man Starter Set features fan favorite characters like Spider-­Man, Ghost Rider, Kingpin, and more! Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-­Man premieres the Sinister Six, Allies, Underdogs, and other exciting mechanics!

With game­play that supports two players in epic dice battles, Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-­Man will let players build their own team of heroes or villains! The Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-­Man Starter Set is perfect for the Dice Masters veteran or someone looking to jump into the game fresh!

Introducing more than 30 heroes and villains (and their dice!), Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-­Man will be sure to stick out as a highlight of your Dice Masters collections!

The Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man Gravity Feed features fan favorite characters like Spider-Man, Gwen Stacy, Aunt May, Blink, The Sinister Six, Agent Venom, Cloak, Dagger, and more!

Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man has brand new mechanics for Allies and Underdogs. Even when the odds are against Spider-Man, he’ll surprise you with some new tricks!

177940.description:
Shoot Your Friends is a lightning-fast game that pits opponents across from each other with nothing but a toy gun and a deck of cards between them. Be the first to create a lethal combination of cards on the table to become either the shooter or the shootie. To play Shoot Your Friends, you must have fast reflexes, quick thinking, and an itchy trigger finger.

Separate the 6 Bullet Cards from the deck and set them aside. Deal 8 cards to each player. Each player places 4 cards face down, side by side, on the table and his other 4 cards (the player’s hand) face down off to the side. Players may not look at them… yet.

Place the rest of the cards into draw piles on the table within easy reach of every player.

Use Character Cards to create matches and use the toy gun to shoot your friends out of the game.

Use Shield Cards to deflect bullets and stay alive a little while longer.

Use Bullet Cards to determine who wins!
177940.name: Shoot Your Friends
